6198 Color::Green)
6199 << std::setw(passwidth) << p.numTestCasesPassingFilters - p.numTestCasesFailed << " passed"
6200 << Color::None << " | " << (p.numTestCasesFailed > 0 ? Color::Red : Color::None)
6201 << std::setw(failwidth) << p.numTestCasesFailed << " failed" << Color::None << " |";
6202 if(opt.no_skipped_summary == false) {
6203 const int numSkipped = p.numTestCases - p.numTestCasesPassingFilters;
6204 s << " " << (numSkipped == 0 ? Color::None : Color::Yellow) << numSkipped
6205 << " skipped" << Color::None;
6206 }
6207 s << "\n";
6208 s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None << "assertions: " << std::setw(totwidth)
6209 << p.numAsserts << " | "
6210 << ((p.numAsserts == 0 || anythingFailed) ? Color::None : Color::Green)
6211 << std::setw(passwidth) << (p.numAsserts - p.numAssertsFailed) << " passed" << Color::None
6212 << " | " << (p.numAssertsFailed > 0 ? Color::Red : Color::None) << std::setw(failwidth)
6213 << p.numAssertsFailed << " failed" << Color::None << " |\n";
6214 s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None
6215 << "Status: " << (p.numTestCasesFailed > 0 ? Color::Red : Color::Green)
6216 << ((p.numTestCasesFailed > 0) ? "FAILURE!" : "SUCCESS!") << Color::None << std::endl;
6217 }
6218
6219 void test_case_start(const TestCaseData& in) override {
6220 hasLoggedCurrentTestStart = false;
6221 tc = &in;
6222 subcasesStack.clear();
6223 currentSubcaseLevel = 0;
6224 }
6225
6226 void test_case_reenter(const TestCaseData&) override {
6227 subcasesStack.clear();
6228 }
6229
6230 void test_case_end(const CurrentTestCaseStats& st) override {
6231 if(tc->m_no_output)
6232 return;
6233
6234 // log the preamble of the test case only if there is something
6235 // else to print - something other than that an assert has failed
6236 if(opt.duration ||
6237 (st.failure_flags && st.failure_flags != static_cast<int>(TestCaseFailureReason::AssertFailure)))
6238 logTestStart();
6239
6240 if(opt.duration)
6241 s << Color::None << std::setprecision(6) << std::fixed << st.seconds
6242 << " s: " << tc->m_name << "\n";
6243
6244 if(st.failure_flags & TestCaseFailureReason::Timeout)
6245 s << Color::Red << "Test case exceeded time limit of " << std::setprecision(6)
6246 << std::fixed << tc->m_timeout << "!\n";
6247
6248 if(st.failure_flags & TestCaseFailureReason::ShouldHaveFailedButDidnt) {
6249 s << Color::Red << "Should have failed but didn't! Marking it as failed!\n";
6250 } else if(st.failure_flags & TestCaseFailureReason::ShouldHaveFailedAndDid) {
6251 s << Color::Yellow << "Failed as expected so marking it as not failed\n";
6252 } else if(st.failure_flags & TestCaseFailureReason::CouldHaveFailedAndDid) {
6253 s << Color::Yellow << "Allowed to fail so marking it as not failed\n";
6254 } else if(st.failure_flags & TestCaseFailureReason::DidntFailExactlyNumTimes) {
6255 s << Color::Red << "Didn't fail exactly " << tc->m_expected_failures
6256 << " times so marking it as failed!\n";
6257 } else if(st.failure_flags & TestCaseFailureReason::FailedExactlyNumTimes) {
6258 s << Color::Yellow << "Failed exactly " << tc->m_expected_failures
6259 << " times as expected so marking it as not failed!\n";
6260 }
6261 if(st.failure_flags & TestCaseFailureReason::TooManyFailedAsserts) {
6262 s << Color::Red << "Aborting - too many failed asserts!\n";
6263 }
6264 s << Color::None; // lgtm [cpp/useless-expression]
6265 }
6266
6267 void test_case_exception(const TestCaseException& e) override {
6268 DOCTEST_LOCK_MUTEX(mutex)
6269 if(tc->m_no_output)
6270 return;
6271
6272 logTestStart();
6273
6274 file_line_to_stream(tc->m_file.c_str(), tc->m_line, " ");
6275 successOrFailColoredStringToStream(false, e.is_crash ? assertType::is_require :
6276 assertType::is_check);
6277 s << Color::Red << (e.is_crash ? "test case CRASHED: " : "test case THREW exception: ")
6278 << Color::Cyan << e.error_string << "\n";
6279
6280 int num_stringified_contexts = get_num_stringified_contexts();
6281 if(num_stringified_contexts) {
6282 auto stringified_contexts = get_stringified_contexts();
6283 s << Color::None << " logged: ";
6284 for(int i = num_stringified_contexts; i > 0; --i) {
6285 s << (i == num_stringified_contexts ? "" : " ")
6286 << stringified_contexts[i - 1] << "\n";
6287 }
6288 }
6289 s << "\n" << Color::None;
6290 }
6291
6292 void subcase_start(const SubcaseSignature& subc) override {
6293 subcasesStack.push_back(subc);
6294 ++currentSubcaseLevel;
6295 hasLoggedCurrentTestStart = false;
6296 }
6297
6298 void subcase_end() override {
6299 --currentSubcaseLevel;
6300 hasLoggedCurrentTestStart = false;
6301 }
6302
6303 void log_assert(const AssertData& rb) override {
6304 if((!rb.m_failed && !opt.success) || tc->m_no_output)
6305 return;
6306
6307 DOCTEST_LOCK_MUTEX(mutex)
6308
6309 logTestStart();
6310
6311 file_line_to_stream(rb.m_file, rb.m_line, " ");
6312 successOrFailColoredStringToStream(!rb.m_failed, rb.m_at);
6313
6314 fulltext_log_assert_to_stream(s, rb);
6315
6316 log_contexts();
6317 }
6318
6319 void log_message(const MessageData& mb) override {
6320 if(tc->m_no_output)
6321 return;
6322
6323 DOCTEST_LOCK_MUTEX(mutex)
6324
6325 logTestStart();
6326
6327 file_line_to_stream(mb.m_file, mb.m_line, " ");
6328 s << getSuccessOrFailColor(false, mb.m_severity)
6329 << getSuccessOrFailString(mb.m_severity & assertType::is_warn, mb.m_severity,
6330 "MESSAGE") << ": ";
6331 s << Color::None << mb.m_string << "\n";
6332 log_contexts();
6333 }
6334
6335 void test_case_skipped(const TestCaseData&) override {}
6336 };
6337
6338 DOCTEST_REGISTER_REPORTER("console", 0, ConsoleReporter);
6339
6340#ifdef DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
6341 struct DebugOutputWindowReporter : public ConsoleReporter
6342 {
6343 DOCTEST_THREAD_LOCAL static std::ostringstream oss;
6344
6345 DebugOutputWindowReporter(const ContextOptions& co)
6346 : ConsoleReporter(co, oss) {}
6347
6348#define DOCTEST_DEBUG_OUTPUT_REPORTER_OVERRIDE(func, type, arg) \
6349 void func(type arg) override { \
6350 bool with_col = g_no_colors; \
6351 g_no_colors = false; \
6352 ConsoleReporter::func(arg); \
6353 if(oss.tellp() != std::streampos{}) { \
6354 DOCTEST_OUTPUT_DEBUG_STRING(oss.str().c_str()); \
6355 oss.str(""); \
6356 } \
6357 g_no_colors = with_col; \
6358 }
6359
6360 DOCTEST_DEBUG_OUTPUT_REPORTER_OVERRIDE(test_run_start, DOCTEST_EMPTY, DOCTEST_EMPTY)
6361 DOCTEST_DEBUG_OUTPUT_REPORTER_OVERRIDE(test_run_end, const TestRunStats&, in)
6362 DOCTEST_DEBUG_OUTPUT_REPORTER_OVERRIDE(test_case_start, const TestCaseData&, in)
6363 DOCTEST_DEBUG_OUTPUT_REPORTER_OVERRIDE(test_case_reenter, const TestCaseData&, in)
6364 DOCTEST_DEBUG_OUTPUT_REPORTER_OVERRIDE(test_case_end, const CurrentTestCaseStats&, in)
6365 DOCTEST_DEBUG_OUTPUT_REPORTER_OVERRIDE(test_case_exception, const TestCaseException&, in)
6366 DOCTEST_DEBUG_OUTPUT_REPORTER_OVERRIDE(subcase_start, const SubcaseSignature&, in)
6367 DOCTEST_DEBUG_OUTPUT_REPORTER_OVERRIDE(subcase_end, DOCTEST_EMPTY, DOCTEST_EMPTY)
6368 DOCTEST_DEBUG_OUTPUT_REPORTER_OVERRIDE(log_assert, const AssertData&, in)
6369 DOCTEST_DEBUG_OUTPUT_REPORTER_OVERRIDE(log_message, const MessageData&, in)
6370 DOCTEST_DEBUG_OUTPUT_REPORTER_OVERRIDE(test_case_skipped, const TestCaseData&, in)
6371 };
6372
6373 DOCTEST_THREAD_LOCAL std::ostringstream DebugOutputWindowReporter::oss;
6374#endif // DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
6375
6376 // the implementation of parseOption()
6377 bool parseOptionImpl(int argc, const char* const* argv, const char* pattern, String* value) {
6378 // going from the end to the beginning and stopping on the first occurrence from the end
6379 for(int i = argc; i > 0; --i) {
6380 auto index = i - 1;
6381 auto temp = std::strstr(argv[index], pattern);
6382 if(temp && (value || strlen(temp) == strlen(pattern))) {
6383 // eliminate matches in which the chars before the option are not '-'
6384 bool noBadCharsFound = true;
6385 auto curr = argv[index];
6386 while(curr != temp) {
6387 if(*curr++ != '-') {
6388 noBadCharsFound = false;
6389 break;
6390 }
6391 }
6392 if(noBadCharsFound && argv[index][0] == '-') {
6393 if(value) {
6394 // parsing the value of an option
6395 temp += strlen(pattern);
6396 const unsigned len = strlen(temp);
6397 if(len) {
6398 *value = temp;
6399 return true;
6400 }
6401 } else {
6402 // just a flag - no value
6403 return true;
6404 }
6405 }
6406 }
6407 }
6408 return false;
6409 }
6410
6411 // parses an option and returns the string after the '=' character
6412 bool parseOption(int argc, const char* const* argv, const char* pattern, String* value = nullptr,
6413 const String& defaultVal = String()) {
6414 if(value)
6415 *value = defaultVal;
6416#ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_UNPREFIXED_OPTIONS
6417 // offset (normally 3 for "dt-") to skip prefix
6418 if(parseOptionImpl(argc, argv, pattern + strlen(DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX), value))
6419 return true;
6420#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_UNPREFIXED_OPTIONS
6421 return parseOptionImpl(argc, argv, pattern, value);
6422 }
6423
6424 // locates a flag on the command line
6425 bool parseFlag(int argc, const char* const* argv, const char* pattern) {
6426 return parseOption(argc, argv, pattern);
6427 }
6428
6429 // parses a comma separated list of words after a pattern in one of the arguments in argv
6430 bool parseCommaSepArgs(int argc, const char* const* argv, const char* pattern,
6431 std::vector<String>& res) {
6432 String filtersString;
6433 if(parseOption(argc, argv, pattern, &filtersString)) {
6434 // tokenize with "," as a separator, unless escaped with backslash
6435 std::ostringstream s;
6436 auto flush = [&s, &res]() {
6437 auto string = s.str();
6438 if(string.size() > 0) {
6439 res.push_back(string.c_str());
6440 }
6441 s.str("");
6442 };
6443
6444 bool seenBackslash = false;
6445 const char* current = filtersString.c_str();
6446 const char* end = current + strlen(current);
6447 while(current != end) {
6448 char character = *current++;
6449 if(seenBackslash) {
6450 seenBackslash = false;
6451 if(character == ',' || character == '\\') {
6452 s.put(character);
6453 continue;
6454 }
6455 s.put('\\');
6456 }
6457 if(character == '\\') {
6458 seenBackslash = true;
6459 } else if(character == ',') {
6460 flush();
6461 } else {
6462 s.put(character);
6463 }
6464 }
6465
6466 if(seenBackslash) {
6467 s.put('\\');
6468 }
6469 flush();
6470 return true;
6471 }
6472 return false;
6473 }
6474
6475 enum optionType
6476 {
6477 option_bool,
6478 option_int
6479 };
6480
6481 // parses an int/bool option from the command line
6482 bool parseIntOption(int argc, const char* const* argv, const char* pattern, optionType type,
6483 int& res) {
6484 String parsedValue;
6485 if(!parseOption(argc, argv, pattern, &parsedValue))
6486 return false;
6487
6488 if(type) {
6489 // integer
6490 // TODO: change this to use std::stoi or something else! currently it uses undefined behavior - assumes '0' on failed parse...
6491 int theInt = std::atoi(parsedValue.c_str());
6492 if (theInt != 0) {
6493 res = theInt;
6494 return true;
6495 }
6496 } else {
6497 // boolean
6498 const char positive[][5] = { "1", "true", "on", "yes" }; // 5 - strlen("true") + 1
6499 const char negative[][6] = { "0", "false", "off", "no" }; // 6 - strlen("false") + 1
6500
6501 // if the value matches any of the positive/negative possibilities
6502 for (unsigned i = 0; i < 4; i++) {
6503 if (parsedValue.compare(positive[i], true) == 0) {
6504 res = 1;
6505 return true;
6506 }
6507 if (parsedValue.compare(negative[i], true) == 0) {
6508 res = 0;
6509 return true;
6510 }
6511 }
6512 }
6513 return false;
6514 }
6515} // namespace
6516
6517Context::Context(int argc, const char* const* argv)
6518 : p(new detail::ContextState) {
6519 parseArgs(argc, argv, true);
6520 if(argc)
6521 p->binary_name = argv[0];
6522}
6523
6524Context::~Context() {
6525 if(g_cs == p)
6526 g_cs = nullptr;
6527 delete p;
6528}
6529
6530void Context::applyCommandLine(int argc, const char* const* argv) {
6531 parseArgs(argc, argv);
6532 if(argc)
6533 p->binary_name = argv[0];
6534}
6535
6536// parses args
6537void Context::parseArgs(int argc, const char* const* argv, bool withDefaults) {
6538 using namespace detail;
6539
6540 // clang-format off
6541 parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "source-file=", p->filters[0]);
6542 parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "sf=", p->filters[0]);
6543 parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "source-file-exclude=",p->filters[1]);
6544 parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "sfe=", p->filters[1]);
6545 parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "test-suite=", p->filters[2]);
6546 parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "ts=", p->filters[2]);
6547 parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "test-suite-exclude=", p->filters[3]);
6548 parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "tse=", p->filters[3]);
6549 parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "test-case=", p->filters[4]);
6550 parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "tc=", p->filters[4]);
6551 parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "test-case-exclude=", p->filters[5]);
6552 parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "tce=", p->filters[5]);
6553 parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "subcase=", p->filters[6]);
6554 parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "sc=", p->filters[6]);
6555 parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "subcase-exclude=", p->filters[7]);
6556 parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "sce=", p->filters[7]);
6557 parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "reporters=", p->filters[8]);
6558 parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "r=", p->filters[8]);
6559 // clang-format on
6560
6561 int intRes = 0;
6562 String strRes;
6563
6564#define DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG(name, sname, var, default) \
6565 if(parseIntOption(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX name "=", option_bool, intRes) || \
6566 parseIntOption(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX sname "=", option_bool, intRes)) \
6567 p->var = static_cast<bool>(intRes); \
6568 else if(parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX name) || \
6569 parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX sname)) \
6570 p->var = true; \
6571 else if(withDefaults) \
6572 p->var = default
6573
6574#define DOCTEST_PARSE_INT_OPTION(name, sname, var, default) \
6575 if(parseIntOption(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX name "=", option_int, intRes) || \
6576 parseIntOption(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX sname "=", option_int, intRes)) \
6577 p->var = intRes; \
6578 else if(withDefaults) \
6579 p->var = default
6580
6581#define DOCTEST_PARSE_STR_OPTION(name, sname, var, default) \
6582 if(parseOption(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX name "=", &strRes, default) || \
6583 parseOption(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX sname "=", &strRes, default) || \
6584 withDefaults) \
6585 p->var = strRes
6586
6587 // clang-format off
6588 DOCTEST_PARSE_STR_OPTION("out", "o", out, "");
6589 DOCTEST_PARSE_STR_OPTION("order-by", "ob", order_by, "file");
6590 DOCTEST_PARSE_INT_OPTION("rand-seed", "rs", rand_seed, 0);
6591
6592 DOCTEST_PARSE_INT_OPTION("first", "f", first, 0);
6593 DOCTEST_PARSE_INT_OPTION("last", "l", last, UINT_MAX);
6594
6595 DOCTEST_PARSE_INT_OPTION("abort-after", "aa", abort_after, 0);
6596 DOCTEST_PARSE_INT_OPTION("subcase-filter-levels", "scfl", subcase_filter_levels, INT_MAX);
6597
6598 DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("success", "s", success, false);
6599 DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("case-sensitive", "cs", case_sensitive, false);
6600 DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("exit", "e", exit, false);
6601 DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("duration", "d", duration, false);
6602 DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("minimal", "m", minimal, false);
6603 DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("quiet", "q", quiet, false);
6604 DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("no-throw", "nt", no_throw, false);
6605 DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("no-exitcode", "ne", no_exitcode, false);
6606 DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FL// ====================================================================== lgtm [cpp/missing-header-guard]
6607// == DO NOT MODIFY THIS FILE BY HAND - IT IS AUTO GENERATED BY CMAKE! ==
6608// ======================================================================
6609//
6610// doctest.h - the lightest feature-rich C++ single-header testing framework for unit tests and TDD
6611//
6612// Copyright (c) 2016-2021 Viktor Kirilov
6613//
6614// Distributed under the MIT Software License
6615// See accompanying file LICENSE.txt or copy at
6616// https://opensource.org/licenses/MIT
6617//
6618// The documentation can be found at the library's page:
6619// https://github.com/doctest/doctest/blob/master/doc/markdown/readme.md
6620//
6621// =================================================================================================
6622// =================================================================================================
6623// =================================================================================================
6624//
6625// The library is heavily influenced by Catch - https://github.com/catchorg/Catch2
6626// which uses the Boost Software License - Version 1.0
6627// see here - https://github.com/catchorg/Catch2/blob/master/LICENSE.txt
6628//
6629// The concept of subcases (sections in Catch) and expression decomposition are from there.
6630// Some parts of the code are taken directly:
6631// - stringification - the detection of "ostream& operator<<(ostream&, const T&)" and StringMaker<>
6632// - the Approx() helper class for floating point comparison
6633// - colors in the console
6634// - breaking into a debugger
6635// - signal / SEH handling
6636// - timer
6637// - XmlWriter class - thanks to Phil Nash for allowing the direct reuse (AKA copy/paste)
6638//
6639// The expression decomposing templates are taken from lest - https://github.com/martinmoene/lest
6640// which uses the Boost Software License - Version 1.0
6641// see here - https://github.com/martinmoene/lest/blob/master/LICENSE.txt
6642//
6643// =================================================================================================
6644// =================================================================================================
6645// =================================================================================================
6646
6647#ifndef DOCTEST_LIBRARY_INCLUDED
6648#define DOCTEST_LIBRARY_INCLUDED
6649
6650// =================================================================================================
6651// == VERSION ======================================================================================
6652// =================================================================================================
6653
6654#define DOCTEST_VERSION_MAJOR 2
6655#define DOCTEST_VERSION_MINOR 4
6656#define DOCTEST_VERSION_PATCH 9
6657
6658// util we need here
6659#define DOCTEST_TOSTR_IMPL(x) #x
6660#define DOCTEST_TOSTR(x) DOCTEST_TOSTR_IMPL(x)
6661
6662#define DOCTEST_VERSION_STR \
6663 DOCTEST_TOSTR(DOCTEST_VERSION_MAJOR) "." \
6664 DOCTEST_TOSTR(DOCTEST_VERSION_MINOR) "." \
6665 DOCTEST_TOSTR(DOCTEST_VERSION_PATCH)
6666
6667#define DOCTEST_VERSION \
6668 (DOCTEST_VERSION_MAJOR * 10000 + DOCTEST_VERSION_MINOR * 100 + DOCTEST_VERSION_PATCH)
6669
6670// =================================================================================================
6671// == COMPILER VERSION =============================================================================
6672// =================================================================================================
6673
6674// ideas for the version stuff are taken from here: https://github.com/cxxstuff/cxx_detect
6675
6676#ifdef _MSC_VER
6677#define DOCTEST_CPLUSPLUS _MSVC_LANG
6678#else
6679#define DOCTEST_CPLUSPLUS __cplusplus
6680#endif
6681
6682#define DOCTEST_COMPILER(MAJOR, MINOR, PATCH) ((MAJOR)*10000000 + (MINOR)*100000 + (PATCH))
6683
6684// GCC/Clang and GCC/MSVC are mutually exclusive, but Clang/MSVC are not because of clang-cl...
6685#if defined(_MSC_VER) && defined(_MSC_FULL_VER)
6686#if _MSC_VER == _MSC_FULL_VER / 10000
6687#define DOCTEST_MSVC DOCTEST_COMPILER(_MSC_VER / 100, _MSC_VER % 100, _MSC_FULL_VER % 10000)
6688#else // MSVC
6689#define DOCTEST_MSVC \
6690 DOCTEST_COMPILER(_MSC_VER / 100, (_MSC_FULL_VER / 100000) % 100, _MSC_FULL_VER % 100000)
6691#endif // MSVC
6692#endif // MSVC
6693#if defined(__clang__) && defined(__clang_minor__)
6694#define DOCTEST_CLANG DOCTEST_COMPILER(__clang_major__, __clang_minor__, __clang_patchlevel__)
6695#elif defined(__GNUC__) && defined(__GNUC_MINOR__) && defined(__GNUC_PATCHLEVEL__) && \
6696 !defined(__INTEL_COMPILER)
6697#define DOCTEST_GCC DOCTEST_COMPILER(__GNUC__, __GNUC_MINOR__, __GNUC_PATCHLEVEL__)
6698#endif // GCC
6699
6700#ifndef DOCTEST_MSVC
6701#define DOCTEST_MSVC 0
6702#endif // DOCTEST_MSVC
6703#ifndef DOCTEST_CLANG
6704#define DOCTEST_CLANG 0
6705#endif // DOCTEST_CLANG
6706#ifndef DOCTEST_GCC
6707#define DOCTEST_GCC 0
6708#endif // DOCTEST_GCC
6709
6710// =================================================================================================
6711// == COMPILER WARNINGS HELPERS ====================================================================
6712// =================================================================================================
6713
6714#if DOCTEST_CLANG
6715#define DOCTEST_PRAGMA_TO_STR(x) _Pragma(#x)
6716#define DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_PUSH _Pragma("clang diagnostic push")
6717#define DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING(w) DOCTEST_PRAGMA_TO_STR(clang diagnostic ignored w)
6718#define DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP _Pragma("clang diagnostic pop")
6719#define DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH(w) \
6720 DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_PUSH DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING(w)
6721#else // DOCTEST_CLANG
6722#define DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_PUSH
6723#define DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING(w)
6724#define DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
6725#define DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH(w)
6726#endif // DOCTEST_CLANG
6727
6728#if DOCTEST_GCC
6729#define DOCTEST_PRAGMA_TO_STR(x) _Pragma(#x)
6730#define DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_PUSH _Pragma("GCC diagnostic push")
6731#define DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(w) DOCTEST_PRAGMA_TO_STR(GCC diagnostic ignored w)
6732#define DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP _Pragma("GCC diagnostic pop")
6733#define DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH(w) \
6734 DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_PUSH DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(w)
6735#else // DOCTEST_GCC
6736#define DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_PUSH
6737#define DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(w)
6738#define DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
6739#define DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH(w)
6740#endif // DOCTEST_GCC
6741
6742#if DOCTEST_MSVC
6743#define DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_PUSH __pragma(warning(push))
6744#define DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(w) __pragma(warning(disable : w))
6745#define DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP __pragma(warning(pop))
6746#define DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH(w) \
6747 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_PUSH DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(w)
6748#else // DOCTEST_MSVC
6749#define DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_PUSH
6750#define DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(w)
6751#define DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
6752#define DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH(w)
6753#endif // DOCTEST_MSVC
6754
6755// =================================================================================================
6756// == COMPILER WARNINGS ============================================================================
6757// =================================================================================================
6758
6759// both the header and the implementation suppress all of these,
6760// so it only makes sense to aggregrate them like so
6761#define DOCTEST_SUPPRESS_COMMON_WARNINGS_PUSH \
6762 DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_PUSH \
6763 DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING("-Wunknown-pragmas") \
6764 DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING("-Wweak-vtables") \
6765 DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING("-Wpadded") \
6766 DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING("-Wmissing-prototypes") \
6767 DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING("-Wc++98-compat") \
6768 DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING("-Wc++98-compat-pedantic") \
6769 \
6770 DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_PUSH \
6771 DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING("-Wunknown-pragmas") \
6772 DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING("-Wpragmas") \
6773 DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING("-Weffc++") \
6774 DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING("-Wstrict-overflow") \
6775 DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING("-Wstrict-aliasing") \
6776 DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING("-Wmissing-declarations") \
6777 DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING("-Wuseless-cast") \
6778 DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING("-Wnoexcept") \
6779 \
6780 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_PUSH \
6781 /* these 4 also disabled globally via cmake: */ \
6782 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(4514) /* unreferenced inline function has been removed */ \
6783 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(4571) /* SEH related */ \
6784 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(4710) /* function not inlined */ \
6785 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(4711) /* function selected for inline expansion*/ \
6786 /* */ \
6787 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(4616) /* invalid compiler warning */ \
6788 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(4619) /* invalid compiler warning */ \
6789 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(4996) /* The compiler encountered a deprecated declaration */ \
6790 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(4706) /* assignment within conditional expression */ \
6791 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(4512) /* 'class' : assignment operator could not be generated */ \
6792 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(4127) /* conditional expression is constant */ \
6793 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(4820) /* padding */ \
6794 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(4625) /* copy constructor was implicitly deleted */ \
6795 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(4626) /* assignment operator was implicitly deleted */ \
6796 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(5027) /* move assignment operator implicitly deleted */ \
6797 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(5026) /* move constructor was implicitly deleted */ \
6798 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(4640) /* construction of local static object not thread-safe */ \
6799 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(5045) /* Spectre mitigation for memory load */ \
6800 /* static analysis */ \
6801 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(26439) /* Function may not throw. Declare it 'noexcept' */ \
6802 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(26495) /* Always initialize a member variable */ \
6803 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(26451) /* Arithmetic overflow ... */ \
6804 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(26444) /* Avoid unnamed objects with custom ctor and dtor... */ \
6805 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(26812) /* Prefer 'enum class' over 'enum' */
6806
6807#define DOCTEST_SUPPRESS_COMMON_WARNINGS_POP \
6808 DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP \
6809 DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP \
6810 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
6811
6812DOCTEST_SUPPRESS_COMMON_WARNINGS_PUSH
6813
6814DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_PUSH
6815DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING("-Wnon-virtual-dtor")
6816DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING("-Wdeprecated")
6817
6818DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_PUSH
6819DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING("-Wctor-dtor-privacy")
6820DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING("-Wnon-virtual-dtor")
6821DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING("-Wsign-promo")
6822
6823DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_PUSH
6824DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(4623) // default constructor was implicitly defined as deleted
6825
6826#define DOCTEST_MAKE_STD_HEADERS_CLEAN_FROM_WARNINGS_ON_WALL_BEGIN \
6827 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_PUSH \
6828 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(4548) /* before comma no effect; expected side - effect */ \
6829 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(4265) /* virtual functions, but destructor is not virtual */ \
6830 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(4986) /* exception specification does not match previous */ \
6831 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(4350) /* 'member1' called instead of 'member2' */ \
6832 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(4668) /* not defined as a preprocessor macro */ \
6833 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(4365) /* signed/unsigned mismatch */ \
6834 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(4774) /* format string not a string literal */ \
6835 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(4820) /* padding */ \
6836 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(4625) /* copy constructor was implicitly deleted */ \
6837 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(4626) /* assignment operator was implicitly deleted */ \
6838 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(5027) /* move assignment operator implicitly deleted */ \
6839 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(5026) /* move constructor was implicitly deleted */ \
6840 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(4623) /* default constructor was implicitly deleted */ \
6841 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(5039) /* pointer to pot. throwing function passed to extern C */ \
6842 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(5045) /* Spectre mitigation for memory load */ \
6843 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(5105) /* macro producing 'defined' has undefined behavior */ \
6844 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(4738) /* storing float result in memory, loss of performance */
6845
6846#define DOCTEST_MAKE_STD_HEADERS_CLEAN_FROM_WARNINGS_ON_WALL_END DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
6847
6848// =================================================================================================
6849// == FEATURE DETECTION ============================================================================
6850// =================================================================================================
6851
6852// general compiler feature support table: https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/compiler_support
6853// MSVC C++11 feature support table: https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/hh567368.aspx
6854// GCC C++11 feature support table: https://gcc.gnu.org/projects/cxx-status.html
6855// MSVC version table:
6856// https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Microsoft_Visual_C%2B%2B#Internal_version_numbering
6857// MSVC++ 14.3 (17) _MSC_VER == 1930 (Visual Studio 2022)
6858// MSVC++ 14.2 (16) _MSC_VER == 1920 (Visual Studio 2019)
6859// MSVC++ 14.1 (15) _MSC_VER == 1910 (Visual Studio 2017)
6860// MSVC++ 14.0 _MSC_VER == 1900 (Visual Studio 2015)
6861// MSVC++ 12.0 _MSC_VER == 1800 (Visual Studio 2013)
6862// MSVC++ 11.0 _MSC_VER == 1700 (Visual Studio 2012)
6863// MSVC++ 10.0 _MSC_VER == 1600 (Visual Studio 2010)
6864// MSVC++ 9.0 _MSC_VER == 1500 (Visual Studio 2008)
6865// MSVC++ 8.0 _MSC_VER == 1400 (Visual Studio 2005)
6866
6867// Universal Windows Platform support
6868#if defined(WINAPI_FAMILY) && (WINAPI_FAMILY == WINAPI_FAMILY_APP)
6869#define DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_WINDOWS_SEH
6870#endif // WINAPI_FAMILY
6871#if DOCTEST_MSVC && !defined(DOCTEST_CONFIG_WINDOWS_SEH)
6872#define DOCTEST_CONFIG_WINDOWS_SEH
6873#endif // MSVC
6874#if defined(DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_WINDOWS_SEH) && defined(DOCTEST_CONFIG_WINDOWS_SEH)
6875#undef DOCTEST_CONFIG_WINDOWS_SEH
6876#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_WINDOWS_SEH
6877
6878#if !defined(_WIN32) && !defined(__QNX__) && !defined(DOCTEST_CONFIG_POSIX_SIGNALS) && \
6879 !defined(__EMSCRIPTEN__) && !defined(__wasi__)
6880#define DOCTEST_CONFIG_POSIX_SIGNALS
6881#endif // _WIN32
6882#if defined(DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_POSIX_SIGNALS) && defined(DOCTEST_CONFIG_POSIX_SIGNALS)
6883#undef DOCTEST_CONFIG_POSIX_SIGNALS
6884#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_POSIX_SIGNALS
6885
6886#ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
6887#if !defined(__cpp_exceptions) && !defined(__EXCEPTIONS) && !defined(_CPPUNWIND) \
6888 || defined(__wasi__)
6889#define DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
6890#endif // no exceptions
6891#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
6892
6893#ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS_BUT_WITH_ALL_ASSERTS
6894#ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
6895#define DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
6896#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
6897#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS_BUT_WITH_ALL_ASSERTS
6898
6899#if defined(DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS) && !defined(DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_TRY_CATCH_IN_ASSERTS)
6900#define DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_TRY_CATCH_IN_ASSERTS
6901#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS && !DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_TRY_CATCH_IN_ASSERTS
6902
6903#ifdef __wasi__
6904#define DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_MULTITHREADING
6905#endif
6906
6907#if defined(DOCTEST_CONFIG_IMPLEMENT_WITH_MAIN) && !defined(DOCTEST_CONFIG_IMPLEMENT)
6908#define DOCTEST_CONFIG_IMPLEMENT
6909#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_IMPLEMENT_WITH_MAIN
6910
6911#if defined(_WIN32) || defined(__CYGWIN__)
6912#if DOCTEST_MSVC
6913#define DOCTEST_SYMBOL_EXPORT __declspec(dllexport)
6914#define DOCTEST_SYMBOL_IMPORT __declspec(dllimport)
6915#else // MSVC
6916#define DOCTEST_SYMBOL_EXPORT __attribute__((dllexport))
6917#define DOCTEST_SYMBOL_IMPORT __attribute__((dllimport))
6918#endif // MSVC
6919#else // _WIN32
6920#define DOCTEST_SYMBOL_EXPORT __attribute__((visibility("default")))
6921#define DOCTEST_SYMBOL_IMPORT
6922#endif // _WIN32
6923
6924#ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_IMPLEMENTATION_IN_DLL
6925#ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_IMPLEMENT
6926#define DOCTEST_INTERFACE DOCTEST_SYMBOL_EXPORT
6927#else // DOCTEST_CONFIG_IMPLEMENT
6928#define DOCTEST_INTERFACE DOCTEST_SYMBOL_IMPORT
6929#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_IMPLEMENT
6930#else // DOCTEST_CONFIG_IMPLEMENTATION_IN_DLL
6931#define DOCTEST_INTERFACE
6932#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_IMPLEMENTATION_IN_DLL
6933
6934// needed for extern template instantiations
6935// see https://github.com/fmtlib/fmt/issues/2228
6936#if DOCTEST_MSVC
6937#define DOCTEST_INTERFACE_DECL
6938#define DOCTEST_INTERFACE_DEF DOCTEST_INTERFACE
6939#else // DOCTEST_MSVC
6940#define DOCTEST_INTERFACE_DECL DOCTEST_INTERFACE
6941#define DOCTEST_INTERFACE_DEF
6942#endif // DOCTEST_MSVC
6943
6944#define DOCTEST_EMPTY
6945
6946#if DOCTEST_MSVC
6947#define DOCTEST_NOINLINE __declspec(noinline)
6948#define DOCTEST_UNUSED
6949#define DOCTEST_ALIGNMENT(x)
6950#elif DOCTEST_CLANG && DOCTEST_CLANG < DOCTEST_COMPILER(3, 5, 0)
6951#define DOCTEST_NOINLINE
6952#define DOCTEST_UNUSED
6953#define DOCTEST_ALIGNMENT(x)
6954#else
6955#define DOCTEST_NOINLINE __attribute__((noinline))
6956#define DOCTEST_UNUSED __attribute__((unused))
6957#define DOCTEST_ALIGNMENT(x) __attribute__((aligned(x)))
6958#endif
6959
6960#ifndef DOCTEST_NORETURN
6961#if DOCTEST_MSVC && (DOCTEST_MSVC < DOCTEST_COMPILER(19, 0, 0))
6962#define DOCTEST_NORETURN
6963#else // DOCTEST_MSVC
6964#define DOCTEST_NORETURN [[noreturn]]
6965#endif // DOCTEST_MSVC
6966#endif // DOCTEST_NORETURN
6967
6968#ifndef DOCTEST_NOEXCEPT
6969#if DOCTEST_MSVC && (DOCTEST_MSVC < DOCTEST_COMPILER(19, 0, 0))
6970#define DOCTEST_NOEXCEPT
6971#else // DOCTEST_MSVC
6972#define DOCTEST_NOEXCEPT noexcept
6973#endif // DOCTEST_MSVC
6974#endif // DOCTEST_NOEXCEPT
6975
6976#ifndef DOCTEST_CONSTEXPR
6977#if DOCTEST_MSVC && (DOCTEST_MSVC < DOCTEST_COMPILER(19, 0, 0))
6978#define DOCTEST_CONSTEXPR const
6979#define DOCTEST_CONSTEXPR_FUNC inline
6980#else // DOCTEST_MSVC
6981#define DOCTEST_CONSTEXPR constexpr
6982#define DOCTEST_CONSTEXPR_FUNC constexpr
6983#endif // DOCTEST_MSVC
6984#endif // DOCTEST_CONSTEXPR
6985
6986// =================================================================================================
6987// == FEATURE DETECTION END ========================================================================
6988// =================================================================================================
6989
6990#define DOCTEST_DECLARE_INTERFACE(name) \
6991 virtual ~name(); \
6992 name() = default; \
6993 name(const name&) = delete; \
6994 name(name&&) = delete; \
6995 name& operator=(const name&) = delete; \
6996 name& operator=(name&&) = delete;
6997
6998#define DOCTEST_DEFINE_INTERFACE(name) \
6999 name::~name() = default;
7000
7001// internal macros for string concatenation and anonymous variable name generation
7002#define DOCTEST_CAT_IMPL(s1, s2) s1##s2
7003#define DOCTEST_CAT(s1, s2) DOCTEST_CAT_IMPL(s1, s2)
7004#ifdef __COUNTER__ // not standard and may be missing for some compilers
7005#define DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(x) DOCTEST_CAT(x, __COUNTER__)
7006#else // __COUNTER__
7007#define DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(x) DOCTEST_CAT(x, __LINE__)
7008#endif // __COUNTER__
7009
7010#ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_ASSERTION_PARAMETERS_BY_VALUE
7011#define DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(x) x&
7012#else // DOCTEST_CONFIG_ASSERTION_PARAMETERS_BY_VALUE
7013#define DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(x) x
7014#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_ASSERTION_PARAMETERS_BY_VALUE
7015
7016// not using __APPLE__ because... this is how Catch does it
7017#ifdef __MAC_OS_X_VERSION_MIN_REQUIRED
7018#define DOCTEST_PLATFORM_MAC
7019#elif defined(__IPHONE_OS_VERSION_MIN_REQUIRED)
7020#define DOCTEST_PLATFORM_IPHONE
7021#elif defined(_WIN32)
7022#define DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
7023#elif defined(__wasi__)
7024#define DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WASI
7025#else // DOCTEST_PLATFORM
7026#define DOCTEST_PLATFORM_LINUX
7027#endif // DOCTEST_PLATFORM
7028
7029namespace doctest { namespace detail {
7030 static DOCTEST_CONSTEXPR int consume(const int*, int) noexcept { return 0; }
7031}}
7032
7033#define DOCTEST_GLOBAL_NO_WARNINGS(var, ...) \
7034 DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH("-Wglobal-constructors") \
7035 static const int var = doctest::detail::consume(&var, __VA_ARGS__); \
7036 DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
7037
7038#ifndef DOCTEST_BREAK_INTO_DEBUGGER
7039// should probably take a look at https://github.com/scottt/debugbreak
7040#ifdef DOCTEST_PLATFORM_LINUX
7041#if defined(__GNUC__) && (defined(__i386) || defined(__x86_64))
7042// Break at the location of the failing check if possible
7043#define DOCTEST_BREAK_INTO_DEBUGGER() __asm__("int $3\n" : :) // NOLINT(hicpp-no-assembler)
7044#else
7045#include <signal.h>
7046#define DOCTEST_BREAK_INTO_DEBUGGER() raise(SIGTRAP)
7047#endif
7048#elif defined(DOCTEST_PLATFORM_MAC)
7049#if defined(__x86_64) || defined(__x86_64__) || defined(__amd64__) || defined(__i386)
7050#define DOCTEST_BREAK_INTO_DEBUGGER() __asm__("int $3\n" : :) // NOLINT(hicpp-no-assembler)
7051#elif defined(__ppc__) || defined(__ppc64__)
7052// https://www.cocoawithlove.com/2008/03/break-into-debugger.html
7053#define DOCTEST_BREAK_INTO_DEBUGGER() __asm__("li r0, 20\nsc\nnop\nli r0, 37\nli r4, 2\nsc\nnop\n": : : "memory","r0","r3","r4") // NOLINT(hicpp-no-assembler)
7054#else
7055#define DOCTEST_BREAK_INTO_DEBUGGER() __asm__("brk #0"); // NOLINT(hicpp-no-assembler)
7056#endif
7057#elif DOCTEST_MSVC
7058#define DOCTEST_BREAK_INTO_DEBUGGER() __debugbreak()
7059#elif defined(__MINGW32__)
7060DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH("-Wredundant-decls")
7061extern "C" __declspec(dllimport) void __stdcall DebugBreak();
7062DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
7063#define DOCTEST_BREAK_INTO_DEBUGGER() ::DebugBreak()
7064#else // linux
7065#define DOCTEST_BREAK_INTO_DEBUGGER() (static_cast<void>(0))
7066#endif // linux
7067#endif // DOCTEST_BREAK_INTO_DEBUGGER
7068
7069// this is kept here for backwards compatibility since the config option was changed
7070#ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_USE_IOSFWD
7071#ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_USE_STD_HEADERS
7072#define DOCTEST_CONFIG_USE_STD_HEADERS
7073#endif
7074#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_USE_IOSFWD
7075
7076// for clang - always include ciso646 (which drags some std stuff) because
7077// we want to check if we are using libc++ with the _LIBCPP_VERSION macro in
7078// which case we don't want to forward declare stuff from std - for reference:
7079// https://github.com/doctest/doctest/issues/126
7080// https://github.com/doctest/doctest/issues/356
7081#if DOCTEST_CLANG
7082#include <ciso646>
7083#ifdef _LIBCPP_VERSION
7084#ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_USE_STD_HEADERS
7085#define DOCTEST_CONFIG_USE_STD_HEADERS
7086#endif
7087#endif // _LIBCPP_VERSION
7088#endif // clang
7089
7090#ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_USE_STD_HEADERS
7091#ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_INCLUDE_TYPE_TRAITS
7092#define DOCTEST_CONFIG_INCLUDE_TYPE_TRAITS
7093#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_INCLUDE_TYPE_TRAITS
7094DOCTEST_MAKE_STD_HEADERS_CLEAN_FROM_WARNINGS_ON_WALL_BEGIN
7095#include <cstddef>
7096#include <ostream>
7097#include <istream>
7098DOCTEST_MAKE_STD_HEADERS_CLEAN_FROM_WARNINGS_ON_WALL_END
7099#else // DOCTEST_CONFIG_USE_STD_HEADERS
7100
7101// Forward declaring 'X' in namespace std is not permitted by the C++ Standard.
7102DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH(4643)
7103
7104namespace std { // NOLINT(cert-dcl58-cpp)
7105typedef decltype(nullptr) nullptr_t; // NOLINT(modernize-use-using)
7106typedef decltype(sizeof(void*)) size_t; // NOLINT(modernize-use-using)
7107template <class charT>
7108struct char_traits;
7109template <>
7110struct char_traits<char>;
7111template <class charT, class traits>
7112class basic_ostream; // NOLINT(fuchsia-virtual-inheritance)
7113typedef basic_ostream<char, char_traits<char>> ostream; // NOLINT(modernize-use-using)
7114template<class traits>
7115// NOLINTNEXTLINE
7116basic_ostream<char, traits>& operator<<(basic_ostream<char, traits>&, const char*);
7117template <class charT, class traits>
7118class basic_istream;
7119typedef basic_istream<char, char_traits<char>> istream; // NOLINT(modernize-use-using)
7120template <class... Types>
7121class tuple;
7122#if DOCTEST_MSVC >= DOCTEST_COMPILER(19, 20, 0)
7123// see this issue on why this is needed: https://github.com/doctest/doctest/issues/183
7124template <class Ty>
7125class allocator;
7126template <class Elem, class Traits, class Alloc>
7127class basic_string;
7128using string = basic_string<char, char_traits<char>, allocator<char>>;
7129#endif // VS 2019
7130} // namespace std
7131
7132DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
7133
7134#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_USE_STD_HEADERS
7135
7136#ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_INCLUDE_TYPE_TRAITS
7137#include <type_traits>
7138#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_INCLUDE_TYPE_TRAITS
7139
7140namespace doctest {
7141
7142using std::size_t;
7143
7144DOCTEST_INTERFACE extern bool is_running_in_test;
7145
7146#ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_STRING_SIZE_TYPE
7147#define DOCTEST_CONFIG_STRING_SIZE_TYPE unsigned
7148#endif
7149
7150// A 24 byte string class (can be as small as 17 for x64 and 13 for x86) that can hold strings with length
7151// of up to 23 chars on the stack before going on the heap - the last byte of the buffer is used for:
7152// - "is small" bit - the highest bit - if "0" then it is small - otherwise its "1" (128)
7153// - if small - capacity left before going on the heap - using the lowest 5 bits
7154// - if small - 2 bits are left unused - the second and third highest ones
7155// - if small - acts as a null terminator if strlen() is 23 (24 including the null terminator)
7156// and the "is small" bit remains "0" ("as well as the capacity left") so its OK
7157// Idea taken from this lecture about the string implementation of facebook/folly - fbstring
7158// https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kPR8h4-qZdk
7159// TODO:
7160// - optimizations - like not deleting memory unnecessarily in operator= and etc.
7161// - resize/reserve/clear
7162// - replace
7163// - back/front
7164// - iterator stuff
7165// - find & friends
7166// - push_back/pop_back
7167// - assign/insert/erase
7168// - relational operators as free functions - taking const char* as one of the params
7169class DOCTEST_INTERFACE String
7170{
7171public:
7172 using size_type = DOCTEST_CONFIG_STRING_SIZE_TYPE;
7173
7174private:
7175 static DOCTEST_CONSTEXPR size_type len = 24;
7176 static DOCTEST_CONSTEXPR size_type last = len - 1;
7177
7178 struct view // len should be more than sizeof(view) - because of the final byte for flags
7179 {
7180 char* ptr;
7181 size_type size;
7182 size_type capacity;
7183 };
7184
7185 union
7186 {
7187 char buf[len]; // NOLINT(*-avoid-c-arrays)
7188 view data;
7189 };
7190
7191 char* allocate(size_type sz);
7192
7193 bool isOnStack() const noexcept { return (buf[last] & 128) == 0; }
7194 void setOnHeap() noexcept;
7195 void setLast(size_type in = last) noexcept;
7196 void setSize(size_type sz) noexcept;
7197
7198 void copy(const String& other);
7199
7200public:
7201 static DOCTEST_CONSTEXPR size_type npos = static_cast<size_type>(-1);
7202
7203 String() noexcept;
7204 ~String();
7205
7206 // cppcheck-suppress noExplicitConstructor
7207 String(const char* in);
7208 String(const char* in, size_type in_size);
7209
7210 String(std::istream& in, size_type in_size);
7211
7212 String(const String& other);
7213 String& operator=(const String& other);
7214
7215 String& operator+=(const String& other);
7216
7217 String(String&& other) noexcept;
7218 String& operator=(String&& other) noexcept;
7219
7220 char operator[](size_type i) const;
7221 char& operator[](size_type i);
7222
7223 // the only functions I'm willing to leave in the interface - available for inlining
7224 const char* c_str() const { return const_cast<String*>(this)->c_str(); } // NOLINT
7225 char* c_str() {
7226 if (isOnStack()) {
7227 return reinterpret_cast<char*>(buf);
7228 }
7229 return data.ptr;
7230 }
7231
7232 size_type size() const;
7233 size_type capacity() const;
7234
7235 String substr(size_type pos, size_type cnt = npos) &&;
7236 String substr(size_type pos, size_type cnt = npos) const &;
7237
7238 size_type find(char ch, size_type pos = 0) const;
7239 size_type rfind(char ch, size_type pos = npos) const;
7240
7241 int compare(const char* other, bool no_case = false) const;
7242 int compare(const String& other, bool no_case = false) const;
7243
7244friend DOCTEST_INTERFACE std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& s, const String& in);
7245};
7246
7247DOCTEST_INTERFACE String operator+(const String& lhs, const String& rhs);
7248
7249DOCTEST_INTERFACE bool operator==(const String& lhs, const String& rhs);
7250DOCTEST_INTERFACE bool operator!=(const String& lhs, const String& rhs);
7251DOCTEST_INTERFACE bool operator<(const String& lhs, const String& rhs);
7252DOCTEST_INTERFACE bool operator>(const String& lhs, const String& rhs);
7253DOCTEST_INTERFACE bool operator<=(const String& lhs, const String& rhs);
7254DOCTEST_INTERFACE bool operator>=(const String& lhs, const String& rhs);
7255
7256class DOCTEST_INTERFACE Contains {
7257public:
7258 explicit Contains(const String& string);
7259
7260 bool checkWith(const String& other) const;
7261
7262 String string;
7263};
7264
7265DOCTEST_INTERFACE String toString(const Contains& in);
7266
7267DOCTEST_INTERFACE bool operator==(const String& lhs, const Contains& rhs);
7268DOCTEST_INTERFACE bool operator==(const Contains& lhs, const String& rhs);
7269DOCTEST_INTERFACE bool operator!=(const String& lhs, const Contains& rhs);
7270DOCTEST_INTERFACE bool operator!=(const Contains& lhs, const String& rhs);
7271
7272namespace Color {
7273 enum Enum
7274 {
7275 None = 0,
7276 White,
7277 Red,
7278 Green,
7279 Blue,
7280 Cyan,
7281 Yellow,
7282 Grey,
7283
7284 Bright = 0x10,
7285
7286 BrightRed = Bright | Red,
7287 BrightGreen = Bright | Green,
7288 LightGrey = Bright | Grey,
7289 BrightWhite = Bright | White
7290 };
7291
7292 DOCTEST_INTERFACE std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& s, Color::Enum code);
7293} // namespace Color
7294
7295namespace assertType {
7296 enum Enum
7297 {
7298 // macro traits
7299
7300 is_warn = 1,
7301 is_check = 2 * is_warn,
7302 is_require = 2 * is_check,
7303
7304 is_normal = 2 * is_require,
7305 is_throws = 2 * is_normal,
7306 is_throws_as = 2 * is_throws,
7307 is_throws_with = 2 * is_throws_as,
7308 is_nothrow = 2 * is_throws_with,
7309
7310 is_false = 2 * is_nothrow,
7311 is_unary = 2 * is_false, // not checked anywhere - used just to distinguish the types
7312
7313 is_eq = 2 * is_unary,
7314 is_ne = 2 * is_eq,
7315
7316 is_lt = 2 * is_ne,
7317 is_gt = 2 * is_lt,
7318
7319 is_ge = 2 * is_gt,
7320 is_le = 2 * is_ge,
7321
7322 // macro types
7323
7324 DT_WARN = is_normal | is_warn,
7325 DT_CHECK = is_normal | is_check,
7326 DT_REQUIRE = is_normal | is_require,
7327
7328 DT_WARN_FALSE = is_normal | is_false | is_warn,
7329 DT_CHECK_FALSE = is_normal | is_false | is_check,
7330 DT_REQUIRE_FALSE = is_normal | is_false | is_require,
7331
7332 DT_WARN_THROWS = is_throws | is_warn,
7333 DT_CHECK_THROWS = is_throws | is_check,
7334 DT_REQUIRE_THROWS = is_throws | is_require,
7335
7336 DT_WARN_THROWS_AS = is_throws_as | is_warn,
7337 DT_CHECK_THROWS_AS = is_throws_as | is_check,
7338 DT_REQUIRE_THROWS_AS = is_throws_as | is_require,
7339
7340 DT_WARN_THROWS_WITH = is_throws_with | is_warn,
7341 DT_CHECK_THROWS_WITH = is_throws_with | is_check,
7342 DT_REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH = is_throws_with | is_require,
7343
7344 DT_WARN_THROWS_WITH_AS = is_throws_with | is_throws_as | is_warn,
7345 DT_CHECK_THROWS_WITH_AS = is_throws_with | is_throws_as | is_check,
7346 DT_REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH_AS = is_throws_with | is_throws_as | is_require,
7347
7348 DT_WARN_NOTHROW = is_nothrow | is_warn,
7349 DT_CHECK_NOTHROW = is_nothrow | is_check,
7350 DT_REQUIRE_NOTHROW = is_nothrow | is_require,
7351
7352 DT_WARN_EQ = is_normal | is_eq | is_warn,
7353 DT_CHECK_EQ = is_normal | is_eq | is_check,
7354 DT_REQUIRE_EQ = is_normal | is_eq | is_require,
7355
7356 DT_WARN_NE = is_normal | is_ne | is_warn,
7357 DT_CHECK_NE = is_normal | is_ne | is_check,
7358 DT_REQUIRE_NE = is_normal | is_ne | is_require,
7359
7360 DT_WARN_GT = is_normal | is_gt | is_warn,
7361 DT_CHECK_GT = is_normal | is_gt | is_check,
7362 DT_REQUIRE_GT = is_normal | is_gt | is_require,
7363
7364 DT_WARN_LT = is_normal | is_lt | is_warn,
7365 DT_CHECK_LT = is_normal | is_lt | is_check,
7366 DT_REQUIRE_LT = is_normal | is_lt | is_require,
7367
7368 DT_WARN_GE = is_normal | is_ge | is_warn,
7369 DT_CHECK_GE = is_normal | is_ge | is_check,
7370 DT_REQUIRE_GE = is_normal | is_ge | is_require,
7371
7372 DT_WARN_LE = is_normal | is_le | is_warn,
7373 DT_CHECK_LE = is_normal | is_le | is_check,
7374 DT_REQUIRE_LE = is_normal | is_le | is_require,
7375
7376 DT_WARN_UNARY = is_normal | is_unary | is_warn,
7377 DT_CHECK_UNARY = is_normal | is_unary | is_check,
7378 DT_REQUIRE_UNARY = is_normal | is_unary | is_require,
7379
7380 DT_WARN_UNARY_FALSE = is_normal | is_false | is_unary | is_warn,
7381 DT_CHECK_UNARY_FALSE = is_normal | is_false | is_unary | is_check,
7382 DT_REQUIRE_UNARY_FALSE = is_normal | is_false | is_unary | is_require,
7383 };
7384} // namespace assertType

7386DOCTEST_INTERFACE const char* assertString(assertType::Enum at);
7387DOCTEST_INTERFACE const char* failureString(assertType::Enum at);
7388DOCTEST_INTERFACE const char* skipPathFromFilename(const char* file);

7390struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE TestCaseData
7391{
7392 String m_file; // the file in which the test was registered (using String - see #350)
7393 unsigned m_line; // the line where the test was registered
7394 const char* m_name; // name of the test case
7395 const char* m_test_suite; // the test suite in which the test was added
7396 const char* m_description;
7397 bool m_skip;
7398 bool m_no_breaks;
7399 bool m_no_output;
7400 bool m_may_fail;
7401 bool m_should_fail;
7402 int m_expected_failures;
7403 double m_timeout;
7404};
7405
7406struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE AssertData
7407{
7408 // common - for all asserts
7409 const TestCaseData* m_test_case;
7410 assertType::Enum m_at;
7411 const char* m_file;
7412 int m_line;
7413 const char* m_expr;
7414 bool m_failed;
7415
7416 // exception-related - for all asserts
7417 bool m_threw;
7418 String m_exception;
7419
7420 // for normal asserts
7421 String m_decomp;
7422
7423 // for specific exception-related asserts
7424 bool m_threw_as;
7425 const char* m_exception_type;
7426
7427 class DOCTEST_INTERFACE StringContains {
7428 private:
7429 Contains content;
7430 bool isContains;
7431
7432 public:
7433 StringContains(const String& str) : content(str), isContains(false) { }
7434 StringContains(Contains cntn) : content(static_cast<Contains&&>(cntn)), isContains(true) { }
7435
7436 bool check(const String& str) { return isContains ? (content == str) : (content.string == str); }
7437
7438 operator const String&() const { return content.string; }
7439
7440 const char* c_str() const { return content.string.c_str(); }
7441 } m_exception_string;
7442
7443 AssertData(assertType::Enum at, const char* file, int line, const char* expr,
7444 const char* exception_type, const StringContains& exception_string);
7445};
7446
7447struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE MessageData
7448{
7449 String m_string;
7450 const char* m_file;
7451 int m_line;
7452 assertType::Enum m_severity;
7453};
7454
7455struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE SubcaseSignature
7456{
7457 String m_name;
7458 const char* m_file;
7459 int m_line;
7460
7461 bool operator==(const SubcaseSignature& other) const;
7462 bool operator<(const SubcaseSignature& other) const;
7463};
7464
7465struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE IContextScope
7466{
7467 DOCTEST_DECLARE_INTERFACE(IContextScope)
7468 virtual void stringify(std::ostream*) const = 0;
7469};

7471namespace detail {
7472 struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE TestCase;
7473} // namespace detail
7474
7475struct ContextOptions
7476{
7477 std::ostream* cout = nullptr; // stdout stream
7478 String binary_name; // the test binary name
7479
7480 const detail::TestCase* currentTest = nullptr;
7481
7482 // == parameters from the command line
7483 String out; // output filename
7484 String order_by; // how tests should be ordered
7485 unsigned rand_seed; // the seed for rand ordering
7486
7487 unsigned first; // the first (matching) test to be executed
7488 unsigned last; // the last (matching) test to be executed
7489
7490 int abort_after; // stop tests after this many failed assertions
7491 int subcase_filter_levels; // apply the subcase filters for the first N levels
7492
7493 bool success; // include successful assertions in output
7494 bool case_sensitive; // if filtering should be case sensitive
7495 bool exit; // if the program should be exited after the tests are ran/whatever
7496 bool duration; // print the time duration of each test case
7497 bool minimal; // minimal console output (only test failures)
7498 bool quiet; // no console output
7499 bool no_throw; // to skip exceptions-related assertion macros
7500 bool no_exitcode; // if the framework should return 0 as the exitcode
7501 bool no_run; // to not run the tests at all (can be done with an "*" exclude)
7502 bool no_intro; // to not print the intro of the framework
7503 bool no_version; // to not print the version of the framework
7504 bool no_colors; // if output to the console should be colorized
7505 bool force_colors; // forces the use of colors even when a tty cannot be detected
7506 bool no_breaks; // to not break into the debugger
7507 bool no_skip; // don't skip test cases which are marked to be skipped
7508 bool gnu_file_line; // if line numbers should be surrounded with :x: and not (x):
7509 bool no_path_in_filenames; // if the path to files should be removed from the output
7510 bool no_line_numbers; // if source code line numbers should be omitted from the output
7511 bool no_debug_output; // no output in the debug console when a debugger is attached
7512 bool no_skipped_summary; // don't print "skipped" in the summary !!! UNDOCUMENTED !!!
7513 bool no_time_in_output; // omit any time/timestamps from output !!! UNDOCUMENTED !!!
7514
7515 bool help; // to print the help
7516 bool version; // to print the version
7517 bool count; // if only the count of matching tests is to be retrieved
7518 bool list_test_cases; // to list all tests matching the filters
7519 bool list_test_suites; // to list all suites matching the filters
7520 bool list_reporters; // lists all registered reporters
7521};
7522
7523namespace detail {
7524 namespace types {
7525#ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_INCLUDE_TYPE_TRAITS
7526 using namespace std;
7527#else
7528 template <bool COND, typename T = void>
7529 struct enable_if { };
7530
7531 template <typename T>
7532 struct enable_if<true, T> { using type = T; };
7533
7534 struct true_type { static DOCTEST_CONSTEXPR bool value = true; };
7535 struct false_type { static DOCTEST_CONSTEXPR bool value = false; };
7536
7537 template <typename T> struct remove_reference { using type = T; };
7538 template <typename T> struct remove_reference<T&> { using type = T; };
7539 template <typename T> struct remove_reference<T&&> { using type = T; };
7540
7541 template <typename T> struct is_rvalue_reference : false_type { };
7542 template <typename T> struct is_rvalue_reference<T&&> : true_type { };
7543
7544 template<typename T> struct remove_const { using type = T; };
7545 template <typename T> struct remove_const<const T> { using type = T; };
7546
7547 // Compiler intrinsics
7548 template <typename T> struct is_enum { static DOCTEST_CONSTEXPR bool value = __is_enum(T); };
7549 template <typename T> struct underlying_type { using type = __underlying_type(T); };
7550
7551 template <typename T> struct is_pointer : false_type { };
7552 template <typename T> struct is_pointer<T*> : true_type { };
7553
7554 template <typename T> struct is_array : false_type { };
7555 // NOLINTNEXTLINE(*-avoid-c-arrays)
7556 template <typename T, size_t SIZE> struct is_array<T[SIZE]> : true_type { };
7557#endif
7558 }
7559
7560 // <utility>
7561 template <typename T>
7562 T&& declval();
7563
7564 template <class T>
7565 DOCTEST_CONSTEXPR_FUNC T&& forward(typename types::remove_reference<T>::type& t) DOCTEST_NOEXCEPT {
7566 return static_cast<T&&>(t);
7567 }
7568
7569 template <class T>
7570 DOCTEST_CONSTEXPR_FUNC T&& forward(typename types::remove_reference<T>::type&& t) DOCTEST_NOEXCEPT {
7571 return static_cast<T&&>(t);
7572 }
7573
7574 template <typename T>
7575 struct deferred_false : types::false_type { };
7576
7577// MSVS 2015 :(
7578#if defined(_MSC_VER) && _MSC_VER <= 1900
7579 template <typename T, typename = void>
7580 struct has_global_insertion_operator : types::false_type { };
7581
7582 template <typename T>
7583 struct has_global_insertion_operator<T, decltype(::operator<<(declval<std::ostream&>(), declval<const T&>()), void())> : types::true_type { };
7584
7585 template <typename T, typename = void>
7586 struct has_insertion_operator { static DOCTEST_CONSTEXPR bool value = has_global_insertion_operator<T>::value; };
7587
7588 template <typename T, bool global>
7589 struct insert_hack;
7590
7591 template <typename T>
7592 struct insert_hack<T, true> {
7593 static void insert(std::ostream& os, const T& t) { ::operator<<(os, t); }
7594 };
7595
7596 template <typename T>
7597 struct insert_hack<T, false> {
7598 static void insert(std::ostream& os, const T& t) { operator<<(os, t); }
7599 };
7600
7601 template <typename T>
7602 using insert_hack_t = insert_hack<T, has_global_insertion_operator<T>::value>;
7603#else
7604 template <typename T, typename = void>
7605 struct has_insertion_operator : types::false_type { };
7606#endif
7607
7608template <typename T>
7609struct has_insertion_operator<T, decltype(operator<<(declval<std::ostream&>(), declval<const T&>()), void())> : types::true_type { };
7610
7611 DOCTEST_INTERFACE std::ostream* tlssPush();
7612 DOCTEST_INTERFACE String tlssPop();
7613
7614 template <bool C>
7615 struct StringMakerBase {
7616 template <typename T>
7617 static String convert(const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(T)) {
7618#ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_REQUIRE_STRINGIFICATION_FOR_ALL_USED_TYPES
7619 static_assert(deferred_false<T>::value, "No stringification detected for type T. See string conversion manual");
7620#endif
7621 return "{?}";
7622 }
7623 };
7624
7625 template <typename T>
7626 struct filldata;
7627
7628 template <typename T>
7629 void filloss(std::ostream* stream, const T& in) {
7630 filldata<T>::fill(stream, in);
7631 }
7632
7633 template <typename T, size_t N>
7634 void filloss(std::ostream* stream, const T (&in)[N]) { // NOLINT(*-avoid-c-arrays)
7635 // T[N], T(&)[N], T(&&)[N] have same behaviour.
7636 // Hence remove reference.
7637 filloss<typename types::remove_reference<decltype(in)>::type>(stream, in);
7638 }
7639
7640 template <typename T>
7641 String toStream(const T& in) {
7642 std::ostream* stream = tlssPush();
7643 filloss(stream, in);
7644 return tlssPop();
7645 }
7646
7647 template <>
7648 struct StringMakerBase<true> {
7649 template <typename T>
7650 static String convert(const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(T) in) {
7651 return toStream(in);
7652 }
7653 };
7654} // namespace detail
7655
7656template <typename T>
7657struct StringMaker : public detail::StringMakerBase<
7658 detail::has_insertion_operator<T>::value || detail::types::is_pointer<T>::value || detail::types::is_array<T>::value>
7659{};
7660
7661#ifndef DOCTEST_STRINGIFY
7662#ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_DOUBLE_STRINGIFY
7663#define DOCTEST_STRINGIFY(...) toString(toString(__VA_ARGS__))
7664#else
7665#define DOCTEST_STRINGIFY(...) toString(__VA_ARGS__)
7666#endif
7667#endif
7668
7669template <typename T>
7670String toString() {
7671#if DOCTEST_MSVC >= 0 && DOCTEST_CLANG == 0 && DOCTEST_GCC == 0
7672 String ret = __FUNCSIG__; // class doctest::String __cdecl doctest::toString<TYPE>(void)
7673 String::size_type beginPos = ret.find('<');
7674 return ret.substr(beginPos + 1, ret.size() - beginPos - static_cast<String::size_type>(sizeof(">(void)")));
7675#else
7676 String ret = __PRETTY_FUNCTION__; // doctest::String toString() [with T = TYPE]
7677 String::size_type begin = ret.find('=') + 2;
7678 return ret.substr(begin, ret.size() - begin - 1);
7679#endif
7680}
7681
7682template <typename T, typename detail::types::enable_if<!detail::types::is_enum<T>::value, bool>::type = true>
7683String toString(const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(T) value) {
7684 return StringMaker<T>::convert(value);
7685}
7686
7687#ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_TREAT_CHAR_STAR_AS_STRING
7688DOCTEST_INTERFACE String toString(const char* in);
7689#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_TREAT_CHAR_STAR_AS_STRING
7690
7691#if DOCTEST_MSVC >= DOCTEST_COMPILER(19, 20, 0)
7692// see this issue on why this is needed: https://github.com/doctest/doctest/issues/183
7693DOCTEST_INTERFACE String toString(const std::string& in);
7694#endif // VS 2019
7695
7696DOCTEST_INTERFACE String toString(String in);
7697
7698DOCTEST_INTERFACE String toString(std::nullptr_t);
7699
7700DOCTEST_INTERFACE String toString(bool in);
7701
7702DOCTEST_INTERFACE String toString(float in);
7703DOCTEST_INTERFACE String toString(double in);
7704DOCTEST_INTERFACE String toString(double long in);
7705
7706DOCTEST_INTERFACE String toString(char in);
7707DOCTEST_INTERFACE String toString(char signed in);
7708DOCTEST_INTERFACE String toString(char unsigned in);
7709DOCTEST_INTERFACE String toString(short in);
7710DOCTEST_INTERFACE String toString(short unsigned in);
7711DOCTEST_INTERFACE String toString(signed in);
7712DOCTEST_INTERFACE String toString(unsigned in);
7713DOCTEST_INTERFACE String toString(long in);
7714DOCTEST_INTERFACE String toString(long unsigned in);
7715DOCTEST_INTERFACE String toString(long long in);
7716DOCTEST_INTERFACE String toString(long long unsigned in);
7717
7718template <typename T, typename detail::types::enable_if<detail::types::is_enum<T>::value, bool>::type = true>
7719String toString(const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(T) value) {
7720 using UT = typename detail::types::underlying_type<T>::type;
7721 return (DOCTEST_STRINGIFY(static_cast<UT>(value)));
7722}
7723
7724namespace detail {
7725 template <typename T>
7726 struct filldata
7727 {
7728 static void fill(std::ostream* stream, const T& in) {
7729#if defined(_MSC_VER) && _MSC_VER <= 1900
7730 insert_hack_t<T>::insert(*stream, in);
7731#else
7732 operator<<(*stream, in);
7733#endif
7734 }
7735 };
7736
7737DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH(4866)
7738// NOLINTBEGIN(*-avoid-c-arrays)
7739 template <typename T, size_t N>
7740 struct filldata<T[N]> {
7741 static void fill(std::ostream* stream, const T(&in)[N]) {
7742 *stream << "[";
7743 for (size_t i = 0; i < N; i++) {
7744 if (i != 0) { *stream << ", "; }
7745 *stream << (DOCTEST_STRINGIFY(in[i]));
7746 }
7747 *stream << "]";
7748 }
7749 };
7750// NOLINTEND(*-avoid-c-arrays)
7751DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
7752
7753 // Specialized since we don't want the terminating null byte!
7754// NOLINTBEGIN(*-avoid-c-arrays)
7755 template <size_t N>
7756 struct filldata<const char[N]> {
7757 static void fill(std::ostream* stream, const char (&in)[N]) {
7758 *stream << String(in, in[N - 1] ? N : N - 1);
7759 } // NOLINT(clang-analyzer-cplusplus.NewDeleteLeaks)
7760 };
7761// NOLINTEND(*-avoid-c-arrays)
7762
7763 template <>
7764 struct filldata<const void*> {
7765 static void fill(std::ostream* stream, const void* in);
7766 };
7767
7768 template <typename T>
7769 struct filldata<T*> {
7770 static void fill(std::ostream* stream, const T* in) {
7771 filldata<const void*>::fill(stream, in);
7772 }
7773 };
7774}
7775
7776struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE Approx
7777{
7778 Approx(double value);
7779
7780 Approx operator()(double value) const;
7781
7782#ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_INCLUDE_TYPE_TRAITS
7783 template <typename T>
7784 explicit Approx(const T& value,
7785 typename detail::types::enable_if<std::is_constructible<double, T>::value>::type* =
7786 static_cast<T*>(nullptr)) {
7787 *this = static_cast<double>(value);
7788 }
7789#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_INCLUDE_TYPE_TRAITS
7790
7791 Approx& epsilon(double newEpsilon);
7792
7793#ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_INCLUDE_TYPE_TRAITS
7794 template <typename T>
7795 typename std::enable_if<std::is_constructible<double, T>::value, Approx&>::type epsilon(
7796 const T& newEpsilon) {
7797 m_epsilon = static_cast<double>(newEpsilon);
7798 return *this;
7799 }
7800#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_INCLUDE_TYPE_TRAITS
7801
7802 Approx& scale(double newScale);
7803
7804#ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_INCLUDE_TYPE_TRAITS
7805 template <typename T>
7806 typename std::enable_if<std::is_constructible<double, T>::value, Approx&>::type scale(
7807 const T& newScale) {
7808 m_scale = static_cast<double>(newScale);
7809 return *this;
7810 }
7811#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_INCLUDE_TYPE_TRAITS
7812
7813 // clang-format off
7814 DOCTEST_INTERFACE friend bool operator==(double lhs, const Approx & rhs);
7815 DOCTEST_INTERFACE friend bool operator==(const Approx & lhs, double rhs);
7816 DOCTEST_INTERFACE friend bool operator!=(double lhs, const Approx & rhs);
7817 DOCTEST_INTERFACE friend bool operator!=(const Approx & lhs, double rhs);
7818 DOCTEST_INTERFACE friend bool operator<=(double lhs, const Approx & rhs);
7819 DOCTEST_INTERFACE friend bool operator<=(const Approx & lhs, double rhs);
7820 DOCTEST_INTERFACE friend bool operator>=(double lhs, const Approx & rhs);
7821 DOCTEST_INTERFACE friend bool operator>=(const Approx & lhs, double rhs);
7822 DOCTEST_INTERFACE friend bool operator< (double lhs, const Approx & rhs);
7823 DOCTEST_INTERFACE friend bool operator< (const Approx & lhs, double rhs);
7824 DOCTEST_INTERFACE friend bool operator> (double lhs, const Approx & rhs);
7825 DOCTEST_INTERFACE friend bool operator> (const Approx & lhs, double rhs);
7826
7827#ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_INCLUDE_TYPE_TRAITS
7828#define DOCTEST_APPROX_PREFIX \
7829 template <typename T> friend typename std::enable_if<std::is_constructible<double, T>::value, bool>::type
7830
7831 DOCTEST_APPROX_PREFIX operator==(const T& lhs, const Approx& rhs) { return operator==(static_cast<double>(lhs), rhs); }
7832 DOCTEST_APPROX_PREFIX operator==(const Approx& lhs, const T& rhs) { return operator==(rhs, lhs); }
7833 DOCTEST_APPROX_PREFIX operator!=(const T& lhs, const Approx& rhs) { return !operator==(lhs, rhs); }
7834 DOCTEST_APPROX_PREFIX operator!=(const Approx& lhs, const T& rhs) { return !operator==(rhs, lhs); }
7835 DOCTEST_APPROX_PREFIX operator<=(const T& lhs, const Approx& rhs) { return static_cast<double>(lhs) < rhs.m_value || lhs == rhs; }
7836 DOCTEST_APPROX_PREFIX operator<=(const Approx& lhs, const T& rhs) { return lhs.m_value < static_cast<double>(rhs) || lhs == rhs; }
7837 DOCTEST_APPROX_PREFIX operator>=(const T& lhs, const Approx& rhs) { return static_cast<double>(lhs) > rhs.m_value || lhs == rhs; }
7838 DOCTEST_APPROX_PREFIX operator>=(const Approx& lhs, const T& rhs) { return lhs.m_value > static_cast<double>(rhs) || lhs == rhs; }
7839 DOCTEST_APPROX_PREFIX operator< (const T& lhs, const Approx& rhs) { return static_cast<double>(lhs) < rhs.m_value && lhs != rhs; }
7840 DOCTEST_APPROX_PREFIX operator< (const Approx& lhs, const T& rhs) { return lhs.m_value < static_cast<double>(rhs) && lhs != rhs; }
7841 DOCTEST_APPROX_PREFIX operator> (const T& lhs, const Approx& rhs) { return static_cast<double>(lhs) > rhs.m_value && lhs != rhs; }
7842 DOCTEST_APPROX_PREFIX operator> (const Approx& lhs, const T& rhs) { return lhs.m_value > static_cast<double>(rhs) && lhs != rhs; }
7843#undef DOCTEST_APPROX_PREFIX
7844#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_INCLUDE_TYPE_TRAITS
7845
7846 // clang-format on
7847
7848 double m_epsilon;
7849 double m_scale;
7850 double m_value;
7851};
7852
7853DOCTEST_INTERFACE String toString(const Approx& in);
7854
7855DOCTEST_INTERFACE const ContextOptions* getContextOptions();
7856
7857template <typename F>
7858struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE_DECL IsNaN
7859{
7860 F value; bool flipped;
7861 IsNaN(F f, bool flip = false) : value(f), flipped(flip) { }
7862 IsNaN<F> operator!() const { return { value, !flipped }; }
7863 operator bool() const;
7864};
7865#ifndef __MINGW32__
7866extern template struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE_DECL IsNaN<float>;
7867extern template struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE_DECL IsNaN<double>;
7868extern template struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE_DECL IsNaN<long double>;
7869#endif
7870DOCTEST_INTERFACE String toString(IsNaN<float> in);
7871DOCTEST_INTERFACE String toString(IsNaN<double> in);
7872DOCTEST_INTERFACE String toString(IsNaN<double long> in);
7873
7874#ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_DISABLE
7875
7876namespace detail {
7877 // clang-format off
7878#ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_TREAT_CHAR_STAR_AS_STRING
7879 template<class T> struct decay_array { using type = T; };
7880 template<class T, unsigned N> struct decay_array<T[N]> { using type = T*; };
7881 template<class T> struct decay_array<T[]> { using type = T*; };
7882
7883 template<class T> struct not_char_pointer { static DOCTEST_CONSTEXPR value = 1; };
7884 template<> struct not_char_pointer<char*> { static DOCTEST_CONSTEXPR value = 0; };
7885 template<> struct not_char_pointer<const char*> { static DOCTEST_CONSTEXPR value = 0; };
7886
7887 template<class T> struct can_use_op : public not_char_pointer<typename decay_array<T>::type> {};
7888#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_TREAT_CHAR_STAR_AS_STRING
7889 // clang-format on
7890
7891 struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE TestFailureException
7892 {
7893 };
7894
7895 DOCTEST_INTERFACE bool checkIfShouldThrow(assertType::Enum at);
7896
7897#ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
7898 DOCTEST_NORETURN
7899#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
7900 DOCTEST_INTERFACE void throwException();
7901
7902 struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE Subcase
7903 {
7904 SubcaseSignature m_signature;
7905 bool m_entered = false;
7906
7907 Subcase(const String& name, const char* file, int line);
7908 Subcase(const Subcase&) = delete;
7909 Subcase(Subcase&&) = delete;
7910 Subcase& operator=(const Subcase&) = delete;
7911 Subcase& operator=(Subcase&&) = delete;
7912 ~Subcase();
7913
7914 operator bool() const;
7915
7916 private:
7917 bool checkFilters();
7918 };
7919
7920 template <typename L, typename R>
7921 String stringifyBinaryExpr(const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(L) lhs, const char* op,
7922 const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(R) rhs) {
7923 return (DOCTEST_STRINGIFY(lhs)) + op + (DOCTEST_STRINGIFY(rhs));
7924 }
7925
7926#if DOCTEST_CLANG && DOCTEST_CLANG < DOCTEST_COMPILER(3, 6, 0)
7927DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH("-Wunused-comparison")
7928#endif
7929
7930// This will check if there is any way it could find a operator like member or friend and uses it.
7931// If not it doesn't find the operator or if the operator at global scope is defined after
7932// this template, the template won't be instantiated due to SFINAE. Once the template is not
7933// instantiated it can look for global operator using normal conversions.
7934#define SFINAE_OP(ret,op) decltype((void)(doctest::detail::declval<L>() op doctest::detail::declval<R>()),ret{})
7935
7936#define DOCTEST_DO_BINARY_EXPRESSION_COMPARISON(op, op_str, op_macro) \
7937 template <typename R> \
7938 DOCTEST_NOINLINE SFINAE_OP(Result,op) operator op(R&& rhs) { \
7939 bool res = op_macro(doctest::detail::forward<const L>(lhs), doctest::detail::forward<R>(rhs)); \
7940 if(m_at & assertType::is_false) \
7941 res = !res; \
7942 if(!res || doctest::getContextOptions()->success) \
7943 return Result(res, stringifyBinaryExpr(lhs, op_str, rhs)); \
7944 return Result(res); \
7945 }
7946
7947 // more checks could be added - like in Catch:
7948 // https://github.com/catchorg/Catch2/pull/1480/files
7949 // https://github.com/catchorg/Catch2/pull/1481/files
7950#define DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(rt, op) \
7951 template <typename R> \
7952 rt& operator op(const R&) { \
7953 static_assert(deferred_false<R>::value, \
7954 "Expression Too Complex Please Rewrite As Binary Comparison!"); \
7955 return *this; \
7956 }
7957
7958 struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE Result // NOLINT(*-member-init)
7959 {
7960 bool m_passed;
7961 String m_decomp;
7962
7963 Result() = default; // TODO: Why do we need this? (To remove NOLINT)
7964 Result(bool passed, const String& decomposition = String());
7965
7966 // forbidding some expressions based on this table: https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/language/operator_precedence
7967 DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, &)
7968 DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, ^)
7969 DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, |)
7970 DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, &&)
7971 DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, ||)
7972 DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, ==)
7973 DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, !=)
7974 DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, <)
7975 DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, >)
7976 DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, <=)
7977 DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, >=)
7978 DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, =)
7979 DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, +=)
7980 DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, -=)
7981 DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, *=)
7982 DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, /=)
7983 DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, %=)
7984 DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, <<=)
7985 DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, >>=)
7986 DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, &=)
7987 DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, ^=)
7988 DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, |=)
7989 };
7990
7991#ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_COMPARISON_WARNING_SUPPRESSION
7992
7993 DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_PUSH
7994 DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING("-Wsign-conversion")
7995 DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING("-Wsign-compare")
7996 //DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING("-Wdouble-promotion")
7997 //DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING("-Wconversion")
7998 //DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING("-Wfloat-equal")
7999
8000 DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_PUSH
8001 DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING("-Wsign-conversion")
8002 DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING("-Wsign-compare")
8003 //DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING("-Wdouble-promotion")
8004 //DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING("-Wconversion")
8005 //DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING("-Wfloat-equal")
8006
8007 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_PUSH
8008 // https://stackoverflow.com/questions/39479163 what's the difference between 4018 and 4389
8009 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(4388) // signed/unsigned mismatch
8010 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(4389) // 'operator' : signed/unsigned mismatch
8011 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(4018) // 'expression' : signed/unsigned mismatch
8012 //DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(4805) // 'operation' : unsafe mix of type 'type' and type 'type' in operation
8013
8014#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_COMPARISON_WARNING_SUPPRESSION
8015
8016 // clang-format off
8017#ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_TREAT_CHAR_STAR_AS_STRING
8018#define DOCTEST_COMPARISON_RETURN_TYPE bool
8019#else // DOCTEST_CONFIG_TREAT_CHAR_STAR_AS_STRING
8020#define DOCTEST_COMPARISON_RETURN_TYPE typename types::enable_if<can_use_op<L>::value || can_use_op<R>::value, bool>::type
8021 inline bool eq(const char* lhs, const char* rhs) { return String(lhs) == String(rhs); }
8022 inline bool ne(const char* lhs, const char* rhs) { return String(lhs) != String(rhs); }
8023 inline bool lt(const char* lhs, const char* rhs) { return String(lhs) < String(rhs); }
8024 inline bool gt(const char* lhs, const char* rhs) { return String(lhs) > String(rhs); }
8025 inline bool le(const char* lhs, const char* rhs) { return String(lhs) <= String(rhs); }
8026 inline bool ge(const char* lhs, const char* rhs) { return String(lhs) >= String(rhs); }
8027#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_TREAT_CHAR_STAR_AS_STRING
8028 // clang-format on
8029
8030#define DOCTEST_RELATIONAL_OP(name, op) \
8031 template <typename L, typename R> \
8032 DOCTEST_COMPARISON_RETURN_TYPE name(const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(L) lhs, \
8033 const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(R) rhs) { \
8034 return lhs op rhs; \
8035 }
8036
8037 DOCTEST_RELATIONAL_OP(eq, ==)
8038 DOCTEST_RELATIONAL_OP(ne, !=)
8039 DOCTEST_RELATIONAL_OP(lt, <)
8040 DOCTEST_RELATIONAL_OP(gt, >)
8041 DOCTEST_RELATIONAL_OP(le, <=)
8042 DOCTEST_RELATIONAL_OP(ge, >=)
8043
8044#ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_TREAT_CHAR_STAR_AS_STRING
8045#define DOCTEST_CMP_EQ(l, r) l == r
8046#define DOCTEST_CMP_NE(l, r) l != r
8047#define DOCTEST_CMP_GT(l, r) l > r
8048#define DOCTEST_CMP_LT(l, r) l < r
8049#define DOCTEST_CMP_GE(l, r) l >= r
8050#define DOCTEST_CMP_LE(l, r) l <= r
8051#else // DOCTEST_CONFIG_TREAT_CHAR_STAR_AS_STRING
8052#define DOCTEST_CMP_EQ(l, r) eq(l, r)
8053#define DOCTEST_CMP_NE(l, r) ne(l, r)
8054#define DOCTEST_CMP_GT(l, r) gt(l, r)
8055#define DOCTEST_CMP_LT(l, r) lt(l, r)
8056#define DOCTEST_CMP_GE(l, r) ge(l, r)
8057#define DOCTEST_CMP_LE(l, r) le(l, r)
8058#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_TREAT_CHAR_STAR_AS_STRING
8059
8060 template <typename L>
8061 // cppcheck-suppress copyCtorAndEqOperator
8062 struct Expression_lhs
8063 {
8064 L lhs;
8065 assertType::Enum m_at;
8066
8067 explicit Expression_lhs(L&& in, assertType::Enum at)
8068 : lhs(static_cast<L&&>(in))
8069 , m_at(at) {}
8070
8071 DOCTEST_NOINLINE operator Result() {
8072// this is needed only for MSVC 2015
8073DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH(4800) // 'int': forcing value to bool
8074 bool res = static_cast<bool>(lhs);
8075DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
8076 if(m_at & assertType::is_false) {
8077 res = !res;
8078 }
8079
8080 if(!res || getContextOptions()->success) {
8081 return { res, (DOCTEST_STRINGIFY(lhs)) };
8082 }
8083 return { res };
8084 }
8085
8086 /* This is required for user-defined conversions from Expression_lhs to L */
8087 operator L() const { return lhs; }
8088
8089 // clang-format off
8090 DOCTEST_DO_BINARY_EXPRESSION_COMPARISON(==, " == ", DOCTEST_CMP_EQ)
8091 DOCTEST_DO_BINARY_EXPRESSION_COMPARISON(!=, " != ", DOCTEST_CMP_NE)
8092 DOCTEST_DO_BINARY_EXPRESSION_COMPARISON(>, " > ", DOCTEST_CMP_GT)
8093 DOCTEST_DO_BINARY_EXPRESSION_COMPARISON(<, " < ", DOCTEST_CMP_LT)
8094 DOCTEST_DO_BINARY_EXPRESSION_COMPARISON(>=, " >= ", DOCTEST_CMP_GE)
8095 DOCTEST_DO_BINARY_EXPRESSION_COMPARISON(<=, " <= ", DOCTEST_CMP_LE)
8096 // clang-format on
8097
8098 // forbidding some expressions based on this table: https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/language/operator_precedence
8099 DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Expression_lhs, &)
8100 DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Expression_lhs, ^)
8101 DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Expression_lhs, |)
8102 DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Expression_lhs, &&)
8103 DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Expression_lhs, ||)
8104 DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Expression_lhs, =)
8105 DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Expression_lhs, +=)
8106 DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Expression_lhs, -=)
8107 DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Expression_lhs, *=)
8108 DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Expression_lhs, /=)
8109 DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Expression_lhs, %=)
8110 DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Expression_lhs, <<=)
8111 DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Expression_lhs, >>=)
8112 DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Expression_lhs, &=)
8113 DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Expression_lhs, ^=)
8114 DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Expression_lhs, |=)
8115 // these 2 are unfortunate because they should be allowed - they have higher precedence over the comparisons, but the
8116 // ExpressionDecomposer class uses the left shift operator to capture the left operand of the binary expression...
8117 DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Expression_lhs, <<)
