8118 DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Expression_lhs, >>)
8119 };
8120
8121#ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_COMPARISON_WARNING_SUPPRESSION
8122
8123 DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
8124 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
8125 DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
8126
8127#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_COMPARISON_WARNING_SUPPRESSION
8128
8129#if DOCTEST_CLANG && DOCTEST_CLANG < DOCTEST_COMPILER(3, 6, 0)
8130DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
8131#endif
8132
8133 struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE ExpressionDecomposer
8134 {
8135 assertType::Enum m_at;
8136
8137 ExpressionDecomposer(assertType::Enum at);
8138
8139 // The right operator for capturing expressions is "<=" instead of "<<" (based on the operator precedence table)
8140 // but then there will be warnings from GCC about "-Wparentheses" and since "_Pragma()" is problematic this will stay for now...
8141 // https://github.com/catchorg/Catch2/issues/870
8142 // https://github.com/catchorg/Catch2/issues/565
8143 template <typename L>
8144 Expression_lhs<L> operator<<(L&& operand) {
8145 return Expression_lhs<L>(static_cast<L&&>(operand), m_at);
8146 }
8147
8148 template <typename L,typename types::enable_if<!doctest::detail::types::is_rvalue_reference<L>::value,void >::type* = nullptr>
8149 Expression_lhs<const L&> operator<<(const L &operand) {
8150 return Expression_lhs<const L&>(operand, m_at);
8151 }
8152 };
8153
8154 struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE TestSuite
8155 {
8156 const char* m_test_suite = nullptr;
8157 const char* m_description = nullptr;
8158 bool m_skip = false;
8159 bool m_no_breaks = false;
8160 bool m_no_output = false;
8161 bool m_may_fail = false;
8162 bool m_should_fail = false;
8163 int m_expected_failures = 0;
8164 double m_timeout = 0;
8165
8166 TestSuite& operator*(const char* in);
8167
8168 template <typename T>
8169 TestSuite& operator*(const T& in) {
8170 in.fill(*this);
8171 return *this;
8172 }
8173 };
8174
8175 using funcType = void (*)();
8176
8177 struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE TestCase : public TestCaseData
8178 {
8179 funcType m_test; // a function pointer to the test case
8180
8181 String m_type; // for templated test cases - gets appended to the real name
8182 int m_template_id; // an ID used to distinguish between the different versions of a templated test case
8183 String m_full_name; // contains the name (only for templated test cases!) + the template type
8184
8185 TestCase(funcType test, const char* file, unsigned line, const TestSuite& test_suite,
8186 const String& type = String(), int template_id = -1);
8187
8188 TestCase(const TestCase& other);
8189 TestCase(TestCase&&) = delete;
8190
8191 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH(26434) // hides a non-virtual function
8192 TestCase& operator=(const TestCase& other);
8193 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
8194
8195 TestCase& operator=(TestCase&&) = delete;
8196
8197 TestCase& operator*(const char* in);
8198
8199 template <typename T>
8200 TestCase& operator*(const T& in) {
8201 in.fill(*this);
8202 return *this;
8203 }
8204
8205 bool operator<(const TestCase& other) const;
8206
8207 ~TestCase() = default;
8208 };
8209
8210 // forward declarations of functions used by the macros
8211 DOCTEST_INTERFACE int regTest(const TestCase& tc);
8212 DOCTEST_INTERFACE int setTestSuite(const TestSuite& ts);
8213 DOCTEST_INTERFACE bool isDebuggerActive();
8214
8215 template<typename T>
8216 int instantiationHelper(const T&) { return 0; }
8217
8218 namespace binaryAssertComparison {
8219 enum Enum
8220 {
8221 eq = 0,
8222 ne,
8223 gt,
8224 lt,
8225 ge,
8226 le
8227 };
8228 } // namespace binaryAssertComparison
8229
8230 // clang-format off
8231 template <int, class L, class R> struct RelationalComparator { bool operator()(const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(L), const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(R) ) const { return false; } };
8232
8233#define DOCTEST_BINARY_RELATIONAL_OP(n, op) \
8234 template <class L, class R> struct RelationalComparator<n, L, R> { bool operator()(const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(L) lhs, const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(R) rhs) const { return op(lhs, rhs); } };
8235 // clang-format on
8236
8237 DOCTEST_BINARY_RELATIONAL_OP(0, doctest::detail::eq)
8238 DOCTEST_BINARY_RELATIONAL_OP(1, doctest::detail::ne)
8239 DOCTEST_BINARY_RELATIONAL_OP(2, doctest::detail::gt)
8240 DOCTEST_BINARY_RELATIONAL_OP(3, doctest::detail::lt)
8241 DOCTEST_BINARY_RELATIONAL_OP(4, doctest::detail::ge)
8242 DOCTEST_BINARY_RELATIONAL_OP(5, doctest::detail::le)
8243
8244 struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE ResultBuilder : public AssertData
8245 {
8246 ResultBuilder(assertType::Enum at, const char* file, int line, const char* expr,
8247 const char* exception_type = "", const String& exception_string = "");
8248
8249 ResultBuilder(assertType::Enum at, const char* file, int line, const char* expr,
8250 const char* exception_type, const Contains& exception_string);
8251
8252 void setResult(const Result& res);
8253
8254 template <int comparison, typename L, typename R>
8255 DOCTEST_NOINLINE bool binary_assert(const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(L) lhs,
8256 const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(R) rhs) {
8257 m_failed = !RelationalComparator<comparison, L, R>()(lhs, rhs);
8258 if (m_failed || getContextOptions()->success) {
8259 m_decomp = stringifyBinaryExpr(lhs, ", ", rhs);
8260 }
8261 return !m_failed;
8262 }
8263
8264 template <typename L>
8265 DOCTEST_NOINLINE bool unary_assert(const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(L) val) {
8266 m_failed = !val;
8267
8268 if (m_at & assertType::is_false) {
8269 m_failed = !m_failed;
8270 }
8271
8272 if (m_failed || getContextOptions()->success) {
8273 m_decomp = (DOCTEST_STRINGIFY(val));
8274 }
8275
8276 return !m_failed;
8277 }
8278
8279 void translateException();
8280
8281 bool log();
8282 void react() const;
8283 };
8284
8285 namespace assertAction {
8286 enum Enum
8287 {
8288 nothing = 0,
8289 dbgbreak = 1,
8290 shouldthrow = 2
8291 };
8292 } // namespace assertAction
8293
8294 DOCTEST_INTERFACE void failed_out_of_a_testing_context(const AssertData& ad);
8295
8296 DOCTEST_INTERFACE bool decomp_assert(assertType::Enum at, const char* file, int line,
8297 const char* expr, const Result& result);
8298
8299#define DOCTEST_ASSERT_OUT_OF_TESTS(decomp) \
8300 do { \
8301 if(!is_running_in_test) { \
8302 if(failed) { \
8303 ResultBuilder rb(at, file, line, expr); \
8304 rb.m_failed = failed; \
8305 rb.m_decomp = decomp; \
8306 failed_out_of_a_testing_context(rb); \
8307 if(isDebuggerActive() && !getContextOptions()->no_breaks) \
8308 DOCTEST_BREAK_INTO_DEBUGGER(); \
8309 if(checkIfShouldThrow(at)) \
8310 throwException(); \
8311 } \
8312 return !failed; \
8313 } \
8314 } while(false)
8315
8316#define DOCTEST_ASSERT_IN_TESTS(decomp) \
8317 ResultBuilder rb(at, file, line, expr); \
8318 rb.m_failed = failed; \
8319 if(rb.m_failed || getContextOptions()->success) \
8320 rb.m_decomp = decomp; \
8321 if(rb.log()) \
8322 DOCTEST_BREAK_INTO_DEBUGGER(); \
8323 if(rb.m_failed && checkIfShouldThrow(at)) \
8324 throwException()
8325
8326 template <int comparison, typename L, typename R>
8327 DOCTEST_NOINLINE bool binary_assert(assertType::Enum at, const char* file, int line,
8328 const char* expr, const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(L) lhs,
8329 const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(R) rhs) {
8330 bool failed = !RelationalComparator<comparison, L, R>()(lhs, rhs);
8331
8332 // ###################################################################################
8333 // IF THE DEBUGGER BREAKS HERE - GO 1 LEVEL UP IN THE CALLSTACK FOR THE FAILING ASSERT
8334 // THIS IS THE EFFECT OF HAVING 'DOCTEST_CONFIG_SUPER_FAST_ASSERTS' DEFINED
8335 // ###################################################################################
8336 DOCTEST_ASSERT_OUT_OF_TESTS(stringifyBinaryExpr(lhs, ", ", rhs));
8337 DOCTEST_ASSERT_IN_TESTS(stringifyBinaryExpr(lhs, ", ", rhs));
8338 return !failed;
8339 }
8340
8341 template <typename L>
8342 DOCTEST_NOINLINE bool unary_assert(assertType::Enum at, const char* file, int line,
8343 const char* expr, const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(L) val) {
8344 bool failed = !val;
8345
8346 if(at & assertType::is_false)
8347 failed = !failed;
8348
8349 // ###################################################################################
8350 // IF THE DEBUGGER BREAKS HERE - GO 1 LEVEL UP IN THE CALLSTACK FOR THE FAILING ASSERT
8351 // THIS IS THE EFFECT OF HAVING 'DOCTEST_CONFIG_SUPER_FAST_ASSERTS' DEFINED
8352 // ###################################################################################
8353 DOCTEST_ASSERT_OUT_OF_TESTS((DOCTEST_STRINGIFY(val)));
8354 DOCTEST_ASSERT_IN_TESTS((DOCTEST_STRINGIFY(val)));
8355 return !failed;
8356 }
8357
8358 struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE IExceptionTranslator
8359 {
8360 DOCTEST_DECLARE_INTERFACE(IExceptionTranslator)
8361 virtual bool translate(String&) const = 0;
8362 };
8363
8364 template <typename T>
8365 class ExceptionTranslator : public IExceptionTranslator
8366 {
8367 public:
8368 explicit ExceptionTranslator(String (*translateFunction)(T))
8369 : m_translateFunction(translateFunction) {}
8370
8371 bool translate(String& res) const override {
8372#ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
8373 try {
8374 throw; // lgtm [cpp/rethrow-no-exception]
8375 // cppcheck-suppress catchExceptionByValue
8376 } catch(const T& ex) {
8377 res = m_translateFunction(ex);
8378 return true;
8379 } catch(...) {}
8380#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
8381 static_cast<void>(res); // to silence -Wunused-parameter
8382 return false;
8383 }
8384
8385 private:
8386 String (*m_translateFunction)(T);
8387 };
8388
8389 DOCTEST_INTERFACE void registerExceptionTranslatorImpl(const IExceptionTranslator* et);
8390
8391 // ContextScope base class used to allow implementing methods of ContextScope
8392 // that don't depend on the template parameter in doctest.cpp.
8393 struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE ContextScopeBase : public IContextScope {
8394 ContextScopeBase(const ContextScopeBase&) = delete;
8395
8396 ContextScopeBase& operator=(const ContextScopeBase&) = delete;
8397 ContextScopeBase& operator=(ContextScopeBase&&) = delete;
8398
8399 ~ContextScopeBase() override = default;
8400
8401 protected:
8402 ContextScopeBase();
8403 ContextScopeBase(ContextScopeBase&& other) noexcept;
8404
8405 void destroy();
8406 bool need_to_destroy{true};
8407 };
8408
8409 template <typename L> class ContextScope : public ContextScopeBase
8410 {
8411 L lambda_;
8412
8413 public:
8414 explicit ContextScope(const L &lambda) : lambda_(lambda) {}
8415 explicit ContextScope(L&& lambda) : lambda_(static_cast<L&&>(lambda)) { }
8416
8417 ContextScope(const ContextScope&) = delete;
8418 ContextScope(ContextScope&&) noexcept = default;
8419
8420 ContextScope& operator=(const ContextScope&) = delete;
8421 ContextScope& operator=(ContextScope&&) = delete;
8422
8423 void stringify(std::ostream* s) const override { lambda_(s); }
8424
8425 ~ContextScope() override {
8426 if (need_to_destroy) {
8427 destroy();
8428 }
8429 }
8430 };
8431
8432 struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE MessageBuilder : public MessageData
8433 {
8434 std::ostream* m_stream;
8435 bool logged = false;
8436
8437 MessageBuilder(const char* file, int line, assertType::Enum severity);
8438
8439 MessageBuilder(const MessageBuilder&) = delete;
8440 MessageBuilder(MessageBuilder&&) = delete;
8441
8442 MessageBuilder& operator=(const MessageBuilder&) = delete;
8443 MessageBuilder& operator=(MessageBuilder&&) = delete;
8444
8445 ~MessageBuilder();
8446
8447 // the preferred way of chaining parameters for stringification
8448DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH(4866)
8449 template <typename T>
8450 MessageBuilder& operator,(const T& in) {
8451 *m_stream << (DOCTEST_STRINGIFY(in));
8452 return *this;
8453 }
8454DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
8455
8456 // kept here just for backwards-compatibility - the comma operator should be preferred now
8457 template <typename T>
8458 MessageBuilder& operator<<(const T& in) { return this->operator,(in); }
8459
8460 // the `,` operator has the lowest operator precedence - if `<<` is used by the user then
8461 // the `,` operator will be called last which is not what we want and thus the `*` operator
8462 // is used first (has higher operator precedence compared to `<<`) so that we guarantee that
8463 // an operator of the MessageBuilder class is called first before the rest of the parameters
8464 template <typename T>
8465 MessageBuilder& operator*(const T& in) { return this->operator,(in); }
8466
8467 bool log();
8468 void react();
8469 };
8470
8471 template <typename L>
8472 ContextScope<L> MakeContextScope(const L &lambda) {
8473 return ContextScope<L>(lambda);
8474 }
8475} // namespace detail
8476
8477#define DOCTEST_DEFINE_DECORATOR(name, type, def) \
8478 struct name \
8479 { \
8480 type data; \
8481 name(type in = def) \
8482 : data(in) {} \
8483 void fill(detail::TestCase& state) const { state.DOCTEST_CAT(m_, name) = data; } \
8484 void fill(detail::TestSuite& state) const { state.DOCTEST_CAT(m_, name) = data; } \
8485 }
8486
8487DOCTEST_DEFINE_DECORATOR(test_suite, const char*, "");
8488DOCTEST_DEFINE_DECORATOR(description, const char*, "");
8489DOCTEST_DEFINE_DECORATOR(skip, bool, true);
8490DOCTEST_DEFINE_DECORATOR(no_breaks, bool, true);
8491DOCTEST_DEFINE_DECORATOR(no_output, bool, true);
8492DOCTEST_DEFINE_DECORATOR(timeout, double, 0);
8493DOCTEST_DEFINE_DECORATOR(may_fail, bool, true);
8494DOCTEST_DEFINE_DECORATOR(should_fail, bool, true);
8495DOCTEST_DEFINE_DECORATOR(expected_failures, int, 0);
8496
8497template <typename T>
8498int registerExceptionTranslator(String (*translateFunction)(T)) {
8499 DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH("-Wexit-time-destructors")
8500 static detail::ExceptionTranslator<T> exceptionTranslator(translateFunction);
8501 DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
8502 detail::registerExceptionTranslatorImpl(&exceptionTranslator);
8503 return 0;
8504}
8505
8506} // namespace doctest
8507
8508// in a separate namespace outside of doctest because the DOCTEST_TEST_SUITE macro
8509// introduces an anonymous namespace in which getCurrentTestSuite gets overridden
8510namespace doctest_detail_test_suite_ns {
8511DOCTEST_INTERFACE doctest::detail::TestSuite& getCurrentTestSuite();
8512} // namespace doctest_detail_test_suite_ns
8513
8514namespace doctest {
8515#else // DOCTEST_CONFIG_DISABLE
8516template <typename T>
8517int registerExceptionTranslator(String (*)(T)) {
8518 return 0;
8519}
8520#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_DISABLE
8521
8522namespace detail {
8523 using assert_handler = void (*)(const AssertData&);
8524 struct ContextState;
8525} // namespace detail
8526
8527class DOCTEST_INTERFACE Context
8528{
8529 detail::ContextState* p;
8530
8531 void parseArgs(int argc, const char* const* argv, bool withDefaults = false);
8532
8533public:
8534 explicit Context(int argc = 0, const char* const* argv = nullptr);
8535
8536 Context(const Context&) = delete;
8537 Context(Context&&) = delete;
8538
8539 Context& operator=(const Context&) = delete;
8540 Context& operator=(Context&&) = delete;
8541
8542 ~Context(); // NOLINT(performance-trivially-destructible)
8543
8544 void applyCommandLine(int argc, const char* const* argv);
8545
8546 void addFilter(const char* filter, const char* value);
8547 void clearFilters();
8548 void setOption(const char* option, bool value);
8549 void setOption(const char* option, int value);
8550 void setOption(const char* option, const char* value);
8551
8552 bool shouldExit();
8553
8554 void setAsDefaultForAssertsOutOfTestCases();
8555
8556 void setAssertHandler(detail::assert_handler ah);
8557
8558 void setCout(std::ostream* out);
8559
8560 int run();
8561};
8562
8563namespace TestCaseFailureReason {
8564 enum Enum
8565 {
8566 None = 0,
8567 AssertFailure = 1, // an assertion has failed in the test case
8568 Exception = 2, // test case threw an exception
8569 Crash = 4, // a crash...
8570 TooManyFailedAsserts = 8, // the abort-after option
8571 Timeout = 16, // see the timeout decorator
8572 ShouldHaveFailedButDidnt = 32, // see the should_fail decorator
8573 ShouldHaveFailedAndDid = 64, // see the should_fail decorator
8574 DidntFailExactlyNumTimes = 128, // see the expected_failures decorator
8575 FailedExactlyNumTimes = 256, // see the expected_failures decorator
8576 CouldHaveFailedAndDid = 512 // see the may_fail decorator
8577 };
8578} // namespace TestCaseFailureReason
8579
8580struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE CurrentTestCaseStats
8581{
8582 int numAssertsCurrentTest;
8583 int numAssertsFailedCurrentTest;
8584 double seconds;
8585 int failure_flags; // use TestCaseFailureReason::Enum
8586 bool testCaseSuccess;
8587};
8588
8589struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE TestCaseException
8590{
8591 String error_string;
8592 bool is_crash;
8593};
8594
8595struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE TestRunStats
8596{
8597 unsigned numTestCases;
8598 unsigned numTestCasesPassingFilters;
8599 unsigned numTestSuitesPassingFilters;
8600 unsigned numTestCasesFailed;
8601 int numAsserts;
8602 int numAssertsFailed;
8603};
8604
8605struct QueryData
8606{
8607 const TestRunStats* run_stats = nullptr;
8608 const TestCaseData** data = nullptr;
8609 unsigned num_data = 0;
8610};
8611
8612struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE IReporter
8613{
8614 // The constructor has to accept "const ContextOptions&" as a single argument
8615 // which has most of the options for the run + a pointer to the stdout stream
8616 // Reporter(const ContextOptions& in)
8617
8618 // called when a query should be reported (listing test cases, printing the version, etc.)
8619 virtual void report_query(const QueryData&) = 0;
8620
8621 // called when the whole test run starts
8622 virtual void test_run_start() = 0;
8623 // called when the whole test run ends (caching a pointer to the input doesn't make sense here)
8624 virtual void test_run_end(const TestRunStats&) = 0;
8625
8626 // called when a test case is started (safe to cache a pointer to the input)
8627 virtual void test_case_start(const TestCaseData&) = 0;
8628 // called when a test case is reentered because of unfinished subcases (safe to cache a pointer to the input)
8629 virtual void test_case_reenter(const TestCaseData&) = 0;
8630 // called when a test case has ended
8631 virtual void test_case_end(const CurrentTestCaseStats&) = 0;
8632
8633 // called when an exception is thrown from the test case (or it crashes)
8634 virtual void test_case_exception(const TestCaseException&) = 0;
8635
8636 // called whenever a subcase is entered (don't cache pointers to the input)
8637 virtual void subcase_start(const SubcaseSignature&) = 0;
8638 // called whenever a subcase is exited (don't cache pointers to the input)
8639 virtual void subcase_end() = 0;
8640
8641 // called for each assert (don't cache pointers to the input)
8642 virtual void log_assert(const AssertData&) = 0;
8643 // called for each message (don't cache pointers to the input)
8644 virtual void log_message(const MessageData&) = 0;
8645
8646 // called when a test case is skipped either because it doesn't pass the filters, has a skip decorator
8647 // or isn't in the execution range (between first and last) (safe to cache a pointer to the input)
8648 virtual void test_case_skipped(const TestCaseData&) = 0;
8649
8650 DOCTEST_DECLARE_INTERFACE(IReporter)
8651
8652 // can obtain all currently active contexts and stringify them if one wishes to do so
8653 static int get_num_active_contexts();
8654 static const IContextScope* const* get_active_contexts();
8655
8656 // can iterate through contexts which have been stringified automatically in their destructors when an exception has been thrown
8657 static int get_num_stringified_contexts();
8658 static const String* get_stringified_contexts();
8659};
8660
8661namespace detail {
8662 using reporterCreatorFunc = IReporter* (*)(const ContextOptions&);
8663
8664 DOCTEST_INTERFACE void registerReporterImpl(const char* name, int prio, reporterCreatorFunc c, bool isReporter);
8665
8666 template <typename Reporter>
8667 IReporter* reporterCreator(const ContextOptions& o) {
8668 return new Reporter(o);
8669 }
8670} // namespace detail
8671
8672template <typename Reporter>
8673int registerReporter(const char* name, int priority, bool isReporter) {
8674 detail::registerReporterImpl(name, priority, detail::reporterCreator<Reporter>, isReporter);
8675 return 0;
8676}
8677} // namespace doctest
8678
8679#ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_ASSERTS_RETURN_VALUES
8680#define DOCTEST_FUNC_EMPTY [] { return false; }()
8681#else
8682#define DOCTEST_FUNC_EMPTY (void)0
8683#endif
8684
8685// if registering is not disabled
8686#ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_DISABLE
8687
8688#ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_ASSERTS_RETURN_VALUES
8689#define DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_BEGIN [&]
8690#define DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_END ()
8691#define DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_RET(v) return v
8692#else
8693#define DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_BEGIN do
8694#define DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_END while(false)
8695#define DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_RET(v) (void)0
8696#endif
8697
8698// common code in asserts - for convenience
8699#define DOCTEST_ASSERT_LOG_REACT_RETURN(b) \
8700 if(b.log()) DOCTEST_BREAK_INTO_DEBUGGER(); \
8701 b.react(); \
8702 DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_RET(!b.m_failed)
8703
8704#ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_TRY_CATCH_IN_ASSERTS
8705#define DOCTEST_WRAP_IN_TRY(x) x;
8706#else // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_TRY_CATCH_IN_ASSERTS
8707#define DOCTEST_WRAP_IN_TRY(x) \
8708 try { \
8709 x; \
8710 } catch(...) { DOCTEST_RB.translateException(); }
8711#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_TRY_CATCH_IN_ASSERTS
8712
8713#ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_VOID_CAST_EXPRESSIONS
8714#define DOCTEST_CAST_TO_VOID(...) \
8715 DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH("-Wuseless-cast") \
8716 static_cast<void>(__VA_ARGS__); \
8717 DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
8718#else // DOCTEST_CONFIG_VOID_CAST_EXPRESSIONS
8719#define DOCTEST_CAST_TO_VOID(...) __VA_ARGS__;
8720#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_VOID_CAST_EXPRESSIONS
8721
8722// registers the test by initializing a dummy var with a function
8723#define DOCTEST_REGISTER_FUNCTION(global_prefix, f, decorators) \
8724 global_prefix DOCTEST_GLOBAL_NO_WARNINGS(DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(DOCTEST_ANON_VAR_), /* NOLINT */ \
8725 doctest::detail::regTest( \
8726 doctest::detail::TestCase( \
8727 f, __FILE__, __LINE__, \
8728 doctest_detail_test_suite_ns::getCurrentTestSuite()) * \
8729 decorators))
8730
8731#define DOCTEST_IMPLEMENT_FIXTURE(der, base, func, decorators) \
8732 namespace { /* NOLINT */ \
8733 struct der : public base \
8734 { \
8735 void f(); \
8736 }; \
8737 static inline DOCTEST_NOINLINE void func() { \
8738 der v; \
8739 v.f(); \
8740 } \
8741 DOCTEST_REGISTER_FUNCTION(DOCTEST_EMPTY, func, decorators) \
8742 } \
8743 inline DOCTEST_NOINLINE void der::f() // NOLINT(misc-definitions-in-headers)
8744
8745#define DOCTEST_CREATE_AND_REGISTER_FUNCTION(f, decorators) \
8746 static void f(); \
8747 DOCTEST_REGISTER_FUNCTION(DOCTEST_EMPTY, f, decorators) \
8748 static void f()
8749
8750#define DOCTEST_CREATE_AND_REGISTER_FUNCTION_IN_CLASS(f, proxy, decorators) \
8751 static doctest::detail::funcType proxy() { return f; } \
8752 DOCTEST_REGISTER_FUNCTION(inline, proxy(), decorators) \
8753 static void f()
8754
8755// for registering tests
8756#define DOCTEST_TEST_CASE(decorators) \
8757 DOCTEST_CREATE_AND_REGISTER_FUNCTION(DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(DOCTEST_ANON_FUNC_), decorators)
8758
8759// for registering tests in classes - requires C++17 for inline variables!
8760#if DOCTEST_CPLUSPLUS >= 201703L
8761#define DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_CLASS(decorators) \
8762 DOCTEST_CREATE_AND_REGISTER_FUNCTION_IN_CLASS(DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(DOCTEST_ANON_FUNC_), \
8763 DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(DOCTEST_ANON_PROXY_), \
8764 decorators)
8765#else // DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_CLASS
8766#define DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_CLASS(...) \
8767 TEST_CASES_CAN_BE_REGISTERED_IN_CLASSES_ONLY_IN_CPP17_MODE_OR_WITH_VS_2017_OR_NEWER
8768#endif // DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_CLASS
8769
8770// for registering tests with a fixture
8771#define DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_FIXTURE(c, decorators) \
8772 DOCTEST_IMPLEMENT_FIXTURE(DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(DOCTEST_ANON_CLASS_), c, \
8773 DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(DOCTEST_ANON_FUNC_), decorators)
8774
8775// for converting types to strings without the <typeinfo> header and demangling
8776#define DOCTEST_TYPE_TO_STRING_AS(str, ...) \
8777 namespace doctest { \
8778 template <> \
8779 inline String toString<__VA_ARGS__>() { \
8780 return str; \
8781 } \
8782 } \
8783 static_assert(true, "")
8784
8785#define DOCTEST_TYPE_TO_STRING(...) DOCTEST_TYPE_TO_STRING_AS(#__VA_ARGS__, __VA_ARGS__)
8786
8787#define DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_TEMPLATE_DEFINE_IMPL(dec, T, iter, func) \
8788 template <typename T> \
8789 static void func(); \
8790 namespace { /* NOLINT */ \
8791 template <typename Tuple> \
8792 struct iter; \
8793 template <typename Type, typename... Rest> \
8794 struct iter<std::tuple<Type, Rest...>> \
8795 { \
8796 iter(const char* file, unsigned line, int index) { \
8797 doctest::detail::regTest(doctest::detail::TestCase(func<Type>, file, line, \
8798 doctest_detail_test_suite_ns::getCurrentTestSuite(), \
8799 doctest::toString<Type>(), \
8800 int(line) * 1000 + index) \
8801 * dec); \
8802 iter<std::tuple<Rest...>>(file, line, index + 1); \
8803 } \
8804 }; \
8805 template <> \
8806 struct iter<std::tuple<>> \
8807 { \
8808 iter(const char*, unsigned, int) {} \
8809 }; \
8810 } \
8811 template <typename T> \
8812 static void func()
8813
8814#define DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_TEMPLATE_DEFINE(dec, T, id) \
8815 DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_TEMPLATE_DEFINE_IMPL(dec, T, DOCTEST_CAT(id, ITERATOR), \
8816 DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(DOCTEST_ANON_TMP_))
8817
8818#define DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_TEMPLATE_INSTANTIATE_IMPL(id, anon, ...) \
8819 DOCTEST_GLOBAL_NO_WARNINGS(DOCTEST_CAT(anon, DUMMY), /* NOLINT(cert-err58-cpp, fuchsia-statically-constructed-objects) */ \
8820 doctest::detail::instantiationHelper( \
8821 DOCTEST_CAT(id, ITERATOR)<__VA_ARGS__>(__FILE__, __LINE__, 0)))
8822
8823#define DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_TEMPLATE_INVOKE(id, ...) \
8824 DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_TEMPLATE_INSTANTIATE_IMPL(id, DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(DOCTEST_ANON_TMP_), std::tuple<__VA_ARGS__>) \
8825 static_assert(true, "")
8826
8827#define DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_TEMPLATE_APPLY(id, ...) \
8828 DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_TEMPLATE_INSTANTIATE_IMPL(id, DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(DOCTEST_ANON_TMP_), __VA_ARGS__) \
8829 static_assert(true, "")
8830
8831#define DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_TEMPLATE_IMPL(dec, T, anon, ...) \
8832 DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_TEMPLATE_DEFINE_IMPL(dec, T, DOCTEST_CAT(anon, ITERATOR), anon); \
8833 DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_TEMPLATE_INSTANTIATE_IMPL(anon, anon, std::tuple<__VA_ARGS__>) \
8834 template <typename T> \
8835 static void anon()
8836
8837#define DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_TEMPLATE(dec, T, ...) \
8838 DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_TEMPLATE_IMPL(dec, T, DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(DOCTEST_ANON_TMP_), __VA_ARGS__)
8839
8840// for subcases
8841#define DOCTEST_SUBCASE(name) \
8842 if(const doctest::detail::Subcase & DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(DOCTEST_ANON_SUBCASE_) DOCTEST_UNUSED = \
8843 doctest::detail::Subcase(name, __FILE__, __LINE__))
8844
8845// for grouping tests in test suites by using code blocks
8846#define DOCTEST_TEST_SUITE_IMPL(decorators, ns_name) \
8847 namespace ns_name { namespace doctest_detail_test_suite_ns { \
8848 static DOCTEST_NOINLINE doctest::detail::TestSuite& getCurrentTestSuite() noexcept { \
8849 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH(4640) \
8850 DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH("-Wexit-time-destructors") \
8851 DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH("-Wmissing-field-initializers") \
8852 static doctest::detail::TestSuite data{}; \
8853 static bool inited = false; \
8854 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP \
8855 DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP \
8856 DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP \
8857 if(!inited) { \
8858 data* decorators; \
8859 inited = true; \
8860 } \
8861 return data; \
8862 } \
8863 } \
8864 } \
8865 namespace ns_name
8866
8867#define DOCTEST_TEST_SUITE(decorators) \
8868 DOCTEST_TEST_SUITE_IMPL(decorators, DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(DOCTEST_ANON_SUITE_))
8869
8870// for starting a testsuite block
8871#define DOCTEST_TEST_SUITE_BEGIN(decorators) \
8872 DOCTEST_GLOBAL_NO_WARNINGS(DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(DOCTEST_ANON_VAR_), /* NOLINT(cert-err58-cpp) */ \
8873 doctest::detail::setTestSuite(doctest::detail::TestSuite() * decorators)) \
8874 static_assert(true, "")
8875
8876// for ending a testsuite block
8877#define DOCTEST_TEST_SUITE_END \
8878 DOCTEST_GLOBAL_NO_WARNINGS(DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(DOCTEST_ANON_VAR_), /* NOLINT(cert-err58-cpp) */ \
8879 doctest::detail::setTestSuite(doctest::detail::TestSuite() * "")) \
8880 using DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(DOCTEST_ANON_FOR_SEMICOLON_) = int
8881
8882// for registering exception translators
8883#define DOCTEST_REGISTER_EXCEPTION_TRANSLATOR_IMPL(translatorName, signature) \
8884 inline doctest::String translatorName(signature); \
8885 DOCTEST_GLOBAL_NO_WARNINGS(DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(DOCTEST_ANON_TRANSLATOR_), /* NOLINT(cert-err58-cpp) */ \
8886 doctest::registerExceptionTranslator(translatorName)) \
8887 doctest::String translatorName(signature)
8888
8889#define DOCTEST_REGISTER_EXCEPTION_TRANSLATOR(signature) \
8890 DOCTEST_REGISTER_EXCEPTION_TRANSLATOR_IMPL(DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(DOCTEST_ANON_TRANSLATOR_), \
8891 signature)
8892
8893// for registering reporters
8894#define DOCTEST_REGISTER_REPORTER(name, priority, reporter) \
8895 DOCTEST_GLOBAL_NO_WARNINGS(DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(DOCTEST_ANON_REPORTER_), /* NOLINT(cert-err58-cpp) */ \
8896 doctest::registerReporter<reporter>(name, priority, true)) \
8897 static_assert(true, "")
8898
8899// for registering listeners
8900#define DOCTEST_REGISTER_LISTENER(name, priority, reporter) \
8901 DOCTEST_GLOBAL_NO_WARNINGS(DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(DOCTEST_ANON_REPORTER_), /* NOLINT(cert-err58-cpp) */ \
8902 doctest::registerReporter<reporter>(name, priority, false)) \
8903 static_assert(true, "")
8904
8905// clang-format off
8906// for logging - disabling formatting because it's important to have these on 2 separate lines - see PR #557
8907#define DOCTEST_INFO(...) \
8908 DOCTEST_INFO_IMPL(DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(DOCTEST_CAPTURE_), \
8909 DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(DOCTEST_CAPTURE_OTHER_), \
8910 __VA_ARGS__)
8911// clang-format on
8912
8913#define DOCTEST_INFO_IMPL(mb_name, s_name, ...) \
8914 auto DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(DOCTEST_CAPTURE_) = doctest::detail::MakeContextScope( \
8915 [&](std::ostream* s_name) { \
8916 doctest::detail::MessageBuilder mb_name(__FILE__, __LINE__, doctest::assertType::is_warn); \
8917 mb_name.m_stream = s_name; \
8918 mb_name * __VA_ARGS__; \
8919 })
8920
8921#define DOCTEST_CAPTURE(x) DOCTEST_INFO(#x " := ", x)
8922
8923#define DOCTEST_ADD_AT_IMPL(type, file, line, mb, ...) \
8924 DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_BEGIN { \
8925 doctest::detail::MessageBuilder mb(file, line, doctest::assertType::type); \
8926 mb * __VA_ARGS__; \
8927 if(mb.log()) \
8928 DOCTEST_BREAK_INTO_DEBUGGER(); \
8929 mb.react(); \
8930 } DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_END
8931
8932// clang-format off
8933#define DOCTEST_ADD_MESSAGE_AT(file, line, ...) DOCTEST_ADD_AT_IMPL(is_warn, file, line, DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(DOCTEST_MESSAGE_), __VA_ARGS__)
8934#define DOCTEST_ADD_FAIL_CHECK_AT(file, line, ...) DOCTEST_ADD_AT_IMPL(is_check, file, line, DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(DOCTEST_MESSAGE_), __VA_ARGS__)
8935#define DOCTEST_ADD_FAIL_AT(file, line, ...) DOCTEST_ADD_AT_IMPL(is_require, file, line, DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(DOCTEST_MESSAGE_), __VA_ARGS__)
8936// clang-format on
8937
8938#define DOCTEST_MESSAGE(...) DOCTEST_ADD_MESSAGE_AT(__FILE__, __LINE__, __VA_ARGS__)
8939#define DOCTEST_FAIL_CHECK(...) DOCTEST_ADD_FAIL_CHECK_AT(__FILE__, __LINE__, __VA_ARGS__)
8940#define DOCTEST_FAIL(...) DOCTEST_ADD_FAIL_AT(__FILE__, __LINE__, __VA_ARGS__)
8941
8942#define DOCTEST_TO_LVALUE(...) __VA_ARGS__ // Not removed to keep backwards compatibility.
8943
8944#ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_SUPER_FAST_ASSERTS
8945
8946#define DOCTEST_ASSERT_IMPLEMENT_2(assert_type, ...) \
8947 DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH("-Woverloaded-shift-op-parentheses") \
8948 /* NOLINTNEXTLINE(clang-analyzer-cplusplus.NewDeleteLeaks) */ \
8949 doctest::detail::ResultBuilder DOCTEST_RB(doctest::assertType::assert_type, __FILE__, \
8950 __LINE__, #__VA_ARGS__); \
8951 DOCTEST_WRAP_IN_TRY(DOCTEST_RB.setResult( \
8952 doctest::detail::ExpressionDecomposer(doctest::assertType::assert_type) \
8953 << __VA_ARGS__)) /* NOLINTNEXTLINE(clang-analyzer-cplusplus.NewDeleteLeaks) */ \
8954 DOCTEST_ASSERT_LOG_REACT_RETURN(DOCTEST_RB) \
8955 DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
8956
8957#define DOCTEST_ASSERT_IMPLEMENT_1(assert_type, ...) \
8958 DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_BEGIN { \
8959 DOCTEST_ASSERT_IMPLEMENT_2(assert_type, __VA_ARGS__); \
8960 } DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_END // NOLINT(clang-analyzer-cplusplus.NewDeleteLeaks)
8961
8962#define DOCTEST_BINARY_ASSERT(assert_type, comp, ...) \
8963 DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_BEGIN { \
8964 doctest::detail::ResultBuilder DOCTEST_RB(doctest::assertType::assert_type, __FILE__, \
8965 __LINE__, #__VA_ARGS__); \
8966 DOCTEST_WRAP_IN_TRY( \
8967 DOCTEST_RB.binary_assert<doctest::detail::binaryAssertComparison::comp>( \
8968 __VA_ARGS__)) \
8969 DOCTEST_ASSERT_LOG_REACT_RETURN(DOCTEST_RB); \
8970 } DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_END
8971
8972#define DOCTEST_UNARY_ASSERT(assert_type, ...) \
8973 DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_BEGIN { \
8974 doctest::detail::ResultBuilder DOCTEST_RB(doctest::assertType::assert_type, __FILE__, \
8975 __LINE__, #__VA_ARGS__); \
8976 DOCTEST_WRAP_IN_TRY(DOCTEST_RB.unary_assert(__VA_ARGS__)) \
8977 DOCTEST_ASSERT_LOG_REACT_RETURN(DOCTEST_RB); \
8978 } DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_END
8979
8980#else // DOCTEST_CONFIG_SUPER_FAST_ASSERTS
8981
8982// necessary for <ASSERT>_MESSAGE
8983#define DOCTEST_ASSERT_IMPLEMENT_2 DOCTEST_ASSERT_IMPLEMENT_1
8984
8985#define DOCTEST_ASSERT_IMPLEMENT_1(assert_type, ...) \
8986 DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH("-Woverloaded-shift-op-parentheses") \
8987 doctest::detail::decomp_assert( \
8988 doctest::assertType::assert_type, __FILE__, __LINE__, #__VA_ARGS__, \
8989 doctest::detail::ExpressionDecomposer(doctest::assertType::assert_type) \
8990 << __VA_ARGS__) DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
8991
8992#define DOCTEST_BINARY_ASSERT(assert_type, comparison, ...) \
8993 doctest::detail::binary_assert<doctest::detail::binaryAssertComparison::comparison>( \
8994 doctest::assertType::assert_type, __FILE__, __LINE__, #__VA_ARGS__, __VA_ARGS__)
8995
8996#define DOCTEST_UNARY_ASSERT(assert_type, ...) \
8997 doctest::detail::unary_assert(doctest::assertType::assert_type, __FILE__, __LINE__, \
8998 #__VA_ARGS__, __VA_ARGS__)
8999
9000#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_SUPER_FAST_ASSERTS
9001
9002#define DOCTEST_WARN(...) DOCTEST_ASSERT_IMPLEMENT_1(DT_WARN, __VA_ARGS__)
9003#define DOCTEST_CHECK(...) DOCTEST_ASSERT_IMPLEMENT_1(DT_CHECK, __VA_ARGS__)
9004#define DOCTEST_REQUIRE(...) DOCTEST_ASSERT_IMPLEMENT_1(DT_REQUIRE, __VA_ARGS__)
9005#define DOCTEST_WARN_FALSE(...) DOCTEST_ASSERT_IMPLEMENT_1(DT_WARN_FALSE, __VA_ARGS__)
9006#define DOCTEST_CHECK_FALSE(...) DOCTEST_ASSERT_IMPLEMENT_1(DT_CHECK_FALSE, __VA_ARGS__)
9007#define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_FALSE(...) DOCTEST_ASSERT_IMPLEMENT_1(DT_REQUIRE_FALSE, __VA_ARGS__)
9008
9009// clang-format off
9010#define DOCTEST_WARN_MESSAGE(cond, ...) DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_BEGIN { DOCTEST_INFO(__VA_ARGS__); DOCTEST_ASSERT_IMPLEMENT_2(DT_WARN, cond); } DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_END
9011#define DOCTEST_CHECK_MESSAGE(cond, ...) DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_BEGIN { DOCTEST_INFO(__VA_ARGS__); DOCTEST_ASSERT_IMPLEMENT_2(DT_CHECK, cond); } DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_END
9012#define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_MESSAGE(cond, ...) DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_BEGIN { DOCTEST_INFO(__VA_ARGS__); DOCTEST_ASSERT_IMPLEMENT_2(DT_REQUIRE, cond); } DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_END
9013#define DOCTEST_WARN_FALSE_MESSAGE(cond, ...) DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_BEGIN { DOCTEST_INFO(__VA_ARGS__); DOCTEST_ASSERT_IMPLEMENT_2(DT_WARN_FALSE, cond); } DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_END
9014#define DOCTEST_CHECK_FALSE_MESSAGE(cond, ...) DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_BEGIN { DOCTEST_INFO(__VA_ARGS__); DOCTEST_ASSERT_IMPLEMENT_2(DT_CHECK_FALSE, cond); } DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_END
9015#define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_FALSE_MESSAGE(cond, ...) DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_BEGIN { DOCTEST_INFO(__VA_ARGS__); DOCTEST_ASSERT_IMPLEMENT_2(DT_REQUIRE_FALSE, cond); } DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_END
9016// clang-format on
9017
9018#define DOCTEST_WARN_EQ(...) DOCTEST_BINARY_ASSERT(DT_WARN_EQ, eq, __VA_ARGS__)
9019#define DOCTEST_CHECK_EQ(...) DOCTEST_BINARY_ASSERT(DT_CHECK_EQ, eq, __VA_ARGS__)
9020#define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_EQ(...) DOCTEST_BINARY_ASSERT(DT_REQUIRE_EQ, eq, __VA_ARGS__)
9021#define DOCTEST_WARN_NE(...) DOCTEST_BINARY_ASSERT(DT_WARN_NE, ne, __VA_ARGS__)
9022#define DOCTEST_CHECK_NE(...) DOCTEST_BINARY_ASSERT(DT_CHECK_NE, ne, __VA_ARGS__)
9023#define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_NE(...) DOCTEST_BINARY_ASSERT(DT_REQUIRE_NE, ne, __VA_ARGS__)
9024#define DOCTEST_WARN_GT(...) DOCTEST_BINARY_ASSERT(DT_WARN_GT, gt, __VA_ARGS__)
9025#define DOCTEST_CHECK_GT(...) DOCTEST_BINARY_ASSERT(DT_CHECK_GT, gt, __VA_ARGS__)
9026#define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_GT(...) DOCTEST_BINARY_ASSERT(DT_REQUIRE_GT, gt, __VA_ARGS__)
9027#define DOCTEST_WARN_LT(...) DOCTEST_BINARY_ASSERT(DT_WARN_LT, lt, __VA_ARGS__)
9028#define DOCTEST_CHECK_LT(...) DOCTEST_BINARY_ASSERT(DT_CHECK_LT, lt, __VA_ARGS__)
9029#define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_LT(...) DOCTEST_BINARY_ASSERT(DT_REQUIRE_LT, lt, __VA_ARGS__)
9030#define DOCTEST_WARN_GE(...) DOCTEST_BINARY_ASSERT(DT_WARN_GE, ge, __VA_ARGS__)
9031#define DOCTEST_CHECK_GE(...) DOCTEST_BINARY_ASSERT(DT_CHECK_GE, ge, __VA_ARGS__)
9032#define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_GE(...) DOCTEST_BINARY_ASSERT(DT_REQUIRE_GE, ge, __VA_ARGS__)
9033#define DOCTEST_WARN_LE(...) DOCTEST_BINARY_ASSERT(DT_WARN_LE, le, __VA_ARGS__)
9034#define DOCTEST_CHECK_LE(...) DOCTEST_BINARY_ASSERT(DT_CHECK_LE, le, __VA_ARGS__)
9035#define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_LE(...) DOCTEST_BINARY_ASSERT(DT_REQUIRE_LE, le, __VA_ARGS__)
9036
9037#define DOCTEST_WARN_UNARY(...) DOCTEST_UNARY_ASSERT(DT_WARN_UNARY, __VA_ARGS__)
9038#define DOCTEST_CHECK_UNARY(...) DOCTEST_UNARY_ASSERT(DT_CHECK_UNARY, __VA_ARGS__)
9039#define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_UNARY(...) DOCTEST_UNARY_ASSERT(DT_REQUIRE_UNARY, __VA_ARGS__)
9040#define DOCTEST_WARN_UNARY_FALSE(...) DOCTEST_UNARY_ASSERT(DT_WARN_UNARY_FALSE, __VA_ARGS__)
9041#define DOCTEST_CHECK_UNARY_FALSE(...) DOCTEST_UNARY_ASSERT(DT_CHECK_UNARY_FALSE, __VA_ARGS__)
9042#define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_UNARY_FALSE(...) DOCTEST_UNARY_ASSERT(DT_REQUIRE_UNARY_FALSE, __VA_ARGS__)
9043
9044#ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
9045
9046#define DOCTEST_ASSERT_THROWS_AS(expr, assert_type, message, ...) \
9047 DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_BEGIN { \
9048 if(!doctest::getContextOptions()->no_throw) { \
9049 doctest::detail::ResultBuilder DOCTEST_RB(doctest::assertType::assert_type, __FILE__, \
9050 __LINE__, #expr, #__VA_ARGS__, message); \
9051 try { \
9052 DOCTEST_CAST_TO_VOID(expr) \
9053 } catch(const typename doctest::detail::types::remove_const< \
9054 typename doctest::detail::types::remove_reference<__VA_ARGS__>::type>::type&) {\
9055 DOCTEST_RB.translateException(); \
9056 DOCTEST_RB.m_threw_as = true; \
9057 } catch(...) { DOCTEST_RB.translateException(); } \
9058 DOCTEST_ASSERT_LOG_REACT_RETURN(DOCTEST_RB); \
9059 } else { /* NOLINT(*-else-after-return) */ \
9060 DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_RET(false); \
9061 } \
9062 } DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_END
9063
9064#define DOCTEST_ASSERT_THROWS_WITH(expr, expr_str, assert_type, ...) \
9065 DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_BEGIN { \
9066 if(!doctest::getContextOptions()->no_throw) { \
9067 doctest::detail::ResultBuilder DOCTEST_RB(doctest::assertType::assert_type, __FILE__, \
9068 __LINE__, expr_str, "", __VA_ARGS__); \
9069 try { \
9070 DOCTEST_CAST_TO_VOID(expr) \
9071 } catch(...) { DOCTEST_RB.translateException(); } \
9072 DOCTEST_ASSERT_LOG_REACT_RETURN(DOCTEST_RB); \
9073 } else { /* NOLINT(*-else-after-return) */ \
9074 DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_RET(false); \
9075 } \
9076 } DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_END
9077
9078#define DOCTEST_ASSERT_NOTHROW(assert_type, ...) \
9079 DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_BEGIN { \
9080 doctest::detail::ResultBuilder DOCTEST_RB(doctest::assertType::assert_type, __FILE__, \
9081 __LINE__, #__VA_ARGS__); \
9082 try { \
9083 DOCTEST_CAST_TO_VOID(__VA_ARGS__) \
9084 } catch(...) { DOCTEST_RB.translateException(); } \
9085 DOCTEST_ASSERT_LOG_REACT_RETURN(DOCTEST_RB); \
9086 } DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_END
9087
9088// clang-format off
9089#define DOCTEST_WARN_THROWS(...) DOCTEST_ASSERT_THROWS_WITH((__VA_ARGS__), #__VA_ARGS__, DT_WARN_THROWS, "")
9090#define DOCTEST_CHECK_THROWS(...) DOCTEST_ASSERT_THROWS_WITH((__VA_ARGS__), #__VA_ARGS__, DT_CHECK_THROWS, "")
9091#define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_THROWS(...) DOCTEST_ASSERT_THROWS_WITH((__VA_ARGS__), #__VA_ARGS__, DT_REQUIRE_THROWS, "")
9092
9093#define DOCTEST_WARN_THROWS_AS(expr, ...) DOCTEST_ASSERT_THROWS_AS(expr, DT_WARN_THROWS_AS, "", __VA_ARGS__)
9094#define DOCTEST_CHECK_THROWS_AS(expr, ...) DOCTEST_ASSERT_THROWS_AS(expr, DT_CHECK_THROWS_AS, "", __VA_ARGS__)
9095#define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_THROWS_AS(expr, ...) DOCTEST_ASSERT_THROWS_AS(expr, DT_REQUIRE_THROWS_AS, "", __VA_ARGS__)
9096
9097#define DOCTEST_WARN_THROWS_WITH(expr, ...) DOCTEST_ASSERT_THROWS_WITH(expr, #expr, DT_WARN_THROWS_WITH, __VA_ARGS__)
9098#define DOCTEST_CHECK_THROWS_WITH(expr, ...) DOCTEST_ASSERT_THROWS_WITH(expr, #expr, DT_CHECK_THROWS_WITH, __VA_ARGS__)
9099#define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH(expr, ...) DOCTEST_ASSERT_THROWS_WITH(expr, #expr, DT_REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH, __VA_ARGS__)
9100
9101#define DOCTEST_WARN_THROWS_WITH_AS(expr, message, ...) DOCTEST_ASSERT_THROWS_AS(expr, DT_WARN_THROWS_WITH_AS, message, __VA_ARGS__)
9102#define DOCTEST_CHECK_THROWS_WITH_AS(expr, message, ...) DOCTEST_ASSERT_THROWS_AS(expr, DT_CHECK_THROWS_WITH_AS, message, __VA_ARGS__)
9103#define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH_AS(expr, message, ...) DOCTEST_ASSERT_THROWS_AS(expr, DT_REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH_AS, message, __VA_ARGS__)
9104
9105#define DOCTEST_WARN_NOTHROW(...) DOCTEST_ASSERT_NOTHROW(DT_WARN_NOTHROW, __VA_ARGS__)
9106#define DOCTEST_CHECK_NOTHROW(...) DOCTEST_ASSERT_NOTHROW(DT_CHECK_NOTHROW, __VA_ARGS__)
9107#define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_NOTHROW(...) DOCTEST_ASSERT_NOTHROW(DT_REQUIRE_NOTHROW, __VA_ARGS__)
9108
9109#define DOCTEST_WARN_THROWS_MESSAGE(expr, ...) DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_BEGIN { DOCTEST_INFO(__VA_ARGS__); DOCTEST_WARN_THROWS(expr); } DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_END
9110#define DOCTEST_CHECK_THROWS_MESSAGE(expr, ...) DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_BEGIN { DOCTEST_INFO(__VA_ARGS__); DOCTEST_CHECK_THROWS(expr); } DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_END
9111#define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_THROWS_MESSAGE(expr, ...) DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_BEGIN { DOCTEST_INFO(__VA_ARGS__); DOCTEST_REQUIRE_THROWS(expr); } DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_END
9112#define DOCTEST_WARN_THROWS_AS_MESSAGE(expr, ex, ...) DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_BEGIN { DOCTEST_INFO(__VA_ARGS__); DOCTEST_WARN_THROWS_AS(expr, ex); } DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_END
9113#define DOCTEST_CHECK_THROWS_AS_MESSAGE(expr, ex, ...) DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_BEGIN { DOCTEST_INFO(__VA_ARGS__); DOCTEST_CHECK_THROWS_AS(expr, ex); } DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_END
9114#define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_THROWS_AS_MESSAGE(expr, ex, ...) DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_BEGIN { DOCTEST_INFO(__VA_ARGS__); DOCTEST_REQUIRE_THROWS_AS(expr, ex); } DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_END
9115#define DOCTEST_WARN_THROWS_WITH_MESSAGE(expr, with, ...) DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_BEGIN { DOCTEST_INFO(__VA_ARGS__); DOCTEST_WARN_THROWS_WITH(expr, with); } DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_END
9116#define DOCTEST_CHECK_THROWS_WITH_MESSAGE(expr, with, ...) DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_BEGIN { DOCTEST_INFO(__VA_ARGS__); DOCTEST_CHECK_THROWS_WITH(expr, with); } DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_END
9117#define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH_MESSAGE(expr, with, ...) DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_BEGIN { DOCTEST_INFO(__VA_ARGS__); DOCTEST_REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH(expr, with); } DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_END
9118#define DOCTEST_WARN_THROWS_WITH_AS_MESSAGE(expr, with, ex, ...) DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_BEGIN { DOCTEST_INFO(__VA_ARGS__); DOCTEST_WARN_THROWS_WITH_AS(expr, with, ex); } DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_END
9119#define DOCTEST_CHECK_THROWS_WITH_AS_MESSAGE(expr, with, ex, ...) DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_BEGIN { DOCTEST_INFO(__VA_ARGS__); DOCTEST_CHECK_THROWS_WITH_AS(expr, with, ex); } DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_END
9120#define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH_AS_MESSAGE(expr, with, ex, ...) DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_BEGIN { DOCTEST_INFO(__VA_ARGS__); DOCTEST_REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH_AS(expr, with, ex); } DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_END
9121#define DOCTEST_WARN_NOTHROW_MESSAGE(expr, ...) DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_BEGIN { DOCTEST_INFO(__VA_ARGS__); DOCTEST_WARN_NOTHROW(expr); } DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_END
9122#define DOCTEST_CHECK_NOTHROW_MESSAGE(expr, ...) DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_BEGIN { DOCTEST_INFO(__VA_ARGS__); DOCTEST_CHECK_NOTHROW(expr); } DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_END
9123#define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_NOTHROW_MESSAGE(expr, ...) DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_BEGIN { DOCTEST_INFO(__VA_ARGS__); DOCTEST_REQUIRE_NOTHROW(expr); } DOCTEST_FUNC_SCOPE_END
9124// clang-format on
9125
9126#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
9127
9128// =================================================================================================
9129// == WHAT FOLLOWS IS VERSIONS OF THE MACROS THAT DO NOT DO ANY REGISTERING! ==
9130// == THIS CAN BE ENABLED BY DEFINING DOCTEST_CONFIG_DISABLE GLOBALLY! ==
9131// =================================================================================================
9132#else // DOCTEST_CONFIG_DISABLE
9133
9134#define DOCTEST_IMPLEMENT_FIXTURE(der, base, func, name) \
9135 namespace /* NOLINT */ { \
9136 template <typename DOCTEST_UNUSED_TEMPLATE_TYPE> \
9137 struct der : public base \
9138 { void f(); }; \
9139 } \
9140 template <typename DOCTEST_UNUSED_TEMPLATE_TYPE> \
9141 inline void der<DOCTEST_UNUSED_TEMPLATE_TYPE>::f()
9142
9143#define DOCTEST_CREATE_AND_REGISTER_FUNCTION(f, name) \
9144 template <typename DOCTEST_UNUSED_TEMPLATE_TYPE> \
9145 static inline void f()
9146
9147// for registering tests
9148#define DOCTEST_TEST_CASE(name) \
9149 DOCTEST_CREATE_AND_REGISTER_FUNCTION(DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(DOCTEST_ANON_FUNC_), name)
9150
9151// for registering tests in classes
9152#define DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_CLASS(name) \
9153 DOCTEST_CREATE_AND_REGISTER_FUNCTION(DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(DOCTEST_ANON_FUNC_), name)
9154
9155// for registering tests with a fixture
9156#define DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_FIXTURE(x, name) \
9157 DOCTEST_IMPLEMENT_FIXTURE(DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(DOCTEST_ANON_CLASS_), x, \
9158 DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(DOCTEST_ANON_FUNC_), name)
9159
9160// for converting types to strings without the <typeinfo> header and demangling
9161#define DOCTEST_TYPE_TO_STRING_AS(str, ...) static_assert(true, "")
9162#define DOCTEST_TYPE_TO_STRING(...) static_assert(true, "")
9163
9164// for typed tests
9165#define DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_TEMPLATE(name, type, ...) \
9166 template <typename type> \
9167 inline void DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(DOCTEST_ANON_TMP_)()
9168
9169#define DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_TEMPLATE_DEFINE(name, type, id) \
9170 template <typename type> \
9171 inline void DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(DOCTEST_ANON_TMP_)()
9172
9173#define DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_TEMPLATE_INVOKE(id, ...) static_assert(true, "")
9174#define DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_TEMPLATE_APPLY(id, ...) static_assert(true, "")
9175
9176// for subcases
9177#define DOCTEST_SUBCASE(name)
9178
9179// for a testsuite block
9180#define DOCTEST_TEST_SUITE(name) namespace // NOLINT
9181
9182// for starting a testsuite block
9183#define DOCTEST_TEST_SUITE_BEGIN(name) static_assert(true, "")
9184
9185// for ending a testsuite block
9186#define DOCTEST_TEST_SUITE_END using DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(DOCTEST_ANON_FOR_SEMICOLON_) = int
9187
9188#define DOCTEST_REGISTER_EXCEPTION_TRANSLATOR(signature) \
9189 template <typename DOCTEST_UNUSED_TEMPLATE_TYPE> \
9190 static inline doctest::String DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(DOCTEST_ANON_TRANSLATOR_)(signature)
9191
9192#define DOCTEST_REGISTER_REPORTER(name, priority, reporter)
9193#define DOCTEST_REGISTER_LISTENER(name, priority, reporter)
9194
9195#define DOCTEST_INFO(...) (static_cast<void>(0))
9196#define DOCTEST_CAPTURE(x) (static_cast<void>(0))
9197#define DOCTEST_ADD_MESSAGE_AT(file, line, ...) (static_cast<void>(0))
9198#define DOCTEST_ADD_FAIL_CHECK_AT(file, line, ...) (static_cast<void>(0))
9199#define DOCTEST_ADD_FAIL_AT(file, line, ...) (static_cast<void>(0))
9200#define DOCTEST_MESSAGE(...) (static_cast<void>(0))
9201#define DOCTEST_FAIL_CHECK(...) (static_cast<void>(0))
9202#define DOCTEST_FAIL(...) (static_cast<void>(0))
9203
9204#if defined(DOCTEST_CONFIG_EVALUATE_ASSERTS_EVEN_WHEN_DISABLED) \
9205 && defined(DOCTEST_CONFIG_ASSERTS_RETURN_VALUES)
9206
9207#define DOCTEST_WARN(...) [&] { return __VA_ARGS__; }()
9208#define DOCTEST_CHECK(...) [&] { return __VA_ARGS__; }()
9209#define DOCTEST_REQUIRE(...) [&] { return __VA_ARGS__; }()
9210#define DOCTEST_WARN_FALSE(...) [&] { return !(__VA_ARGS__); }()
9211#define DOCTEST_CHECK_FALSE(...) [&] { return !(__VA_ARGS__); }()
9212#define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_FALSE(...) [&] { return !(__VA_ARGS__); }()
9213
9214#define DOCTEST_WARN_MESSAGE(cond, ...) [&] { return cond; }()
9215#define DOCTEST_CHECK_MESSAGE(cond, ...) [&] { return cond; }()
9216#define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_MESSAGE(cond, ...) [&] { return cond; }()
9217#define DOCTEST_WARN_FALSE_MESSAGE(cond, ...) [&] { return !(cond); }()
9218#define DOCTEST_CHECK_FALSE_MESSAGE(cond, ...) [&] { return !(cond); }()
9219#define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_FALSE_MESSAGE(cond, ...) [&] { return !(cond); }()
9220
9221namespace doctest {
9222namespace detail {
9223#define DOCTEST_RELATIONAL_OP(name, op) \
9224 template <typename L, typename R> \
9225 bool name(const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(L) lhs, const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(R) rhs) { return lhs op rhs; }
9226
9227 DOCTEST_RELATIONAL_OP(eq, ==)
9228 DOCTEST_RELATIONAL_OP(ne, !=)
9229 DOCTEST_RELATIONAL_OP(lt, <)
9230 DOCTEST_RELATIONAL_OP(gt, >)
9231 DOCTEST_RELATIONAL_OP(le, <=)
9232 DOCTEST_RELATIONAL_OP(ge, >=)
9233} // namespace detail
9234} // namespace doctest
9235
9236#define DOCTEST_WARN_EQ(...) [&] { return doctest::detail::eq(__VA_ARGS__); }()
9237#define DOCTEST_CHECK_EQ(...) [&] { return doctest::detail::eq(__VA_ARGS__); }()
9238#define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_EQ(...) [&] { return doctest::detail::eq(__VA_ARGS__); }()
9239#define DOCTEST_WARN_NE(...) [&] { return doctest::detail::ne(__VA_ARGS__); }()
9240#define DOCTEST_CHECK_NE(...) [&] { return doctest::detail::ne(__VA_ARGS__); }()
9241#define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_NE(...) [&] { return doctest::detail::ne(__VA_ARGS__); }()
9242#define DOCTEST_WARN_LT(...) [&] { return doctest::detail::lt(__VA_ARGS__); }()
9243#define DOCTEST_CHECK_LT(...) [&] { return doctest::detail::lt(__VA_ARGS__); }()
9244#define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_LT(...) [&] { return doctest::detail::lt(__VA_ARGS__); }()
9245#define DOCTEST_WARN_GT(...) [&] { return doctest::detail::gt(__VA_ARGS__); }()
9246#define DOCTEST_CHECK_GT(...) [&] { return doctest::detail::gt(__VA_ARGS__); }()
9247#define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_GT(...) [&] { return doctest::detail::gt(__VA_ARGS__); }()
9248#define DOCTEST_WARN_LE(...) [&] { return doctest::detail::le(__VA_ARGS__); }()
9249#define DOCTEST_CHECK_LE(...) [&] { return doctest::detail::le(__VA_ARGS__); }()
9250#define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_LE(...) [&] { return doctest::detail::le(__VA_ARGS__); }()
9251#define DOCTEST_WARN_GE(...) [&] { return doctest::detail::ge(__VA_ARGS__); }()
9252#define DOCTEST_CHECK_GE(...) [&] { return doctest::detail::ge(__VA_ARGS__); }()
9253#define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_GE(...) [&] { return doctest::detail::ge(__VA_ARGS__); }()
9254#define DOCTEST_WARN_UNARY(...) [&] { return __VA_ARGS__; }()
9255#define DOCTEST_CHECK_UNARY(...) [&] { return __VA_ARGS__; }()
9256#define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_UNARY(...) [&] { return __VA_ARGS__; }()
9257#define DOCTEST_WARN_UNARY_FALSE(...) [&] { return !(__VA_ARGS__); }()
9258#define DOCTEST_CHECK_UNARY_FALSE(...) [&] { return !(__VA_ARGS__); }()
9259#define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_UNARY_FALSE(...) [&] { return !(__VA_ARGS__); }()
9260
9261#ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
9262
9263#define DOCTEST_WARN_THROWS_WITH(expr, with, ...) [] { static_assert(false, "Exception translation is not available when doctest is disabled."); return false; }()
9264#define DOCTEST_CHECK_THROWS_WITH(expr, with, ...) DOCTEST_WARN_THROWS_WITH(,,)
9265#define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH(expr, with, ...) DOCTEST_WARN_THROWS_WITH(,,)
9266#define DOCTEST_WARN_THROWS_WITH_AS(expr, with, ex, ...) DOCTEST_WARN_THROWS_WITH(,,)
9267#define DOCTEST_CHECK_THROWS_WITH_AS(expr, with, ex, ...) DOCTEST_WARN_THROWS_WITH(,,)
9268#define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH_AS(expr, with, ex, ...) DOCTEST_WARN_THROWS_WITH(,,)
9269
9270#define DOCTEST_WARN_THROWS_WITH_MESSAGE(expr, with, ...) DOCTEST_WARN_THROWS_WITH(,,)
9271#define DOCTEST_CHECK_THROWS_WITH_MESSAGE(expr, with, ...) DOCTEST_WARN_THROWS_WITH(,,)
9272#define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH_MESSAGE(expr, with, ...) DOCTEST_WARN_THROWS_WITH(,,)
9273#define DOCTEST_WARN_THROWS_WITH_AS_MESSAGE(expr, with, ex, ...) DOCTEST_WARN_THROWS_WITH(,,)
9274#define DOCTEST_CHECK_THROWS_WITH_AS_MESSAGE(expr, with, ex, ...) DOCTEST_WARN_THROWS_WITH(,,)
9275#define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH_AS_MESSAGE(expr, with, ex, ...) DOCTEST_WARN_THROWS_WITH(,,)
9276
9277#define DOCTEST_WARN_THROWS(...) [&] { try { __VA_ARGS__; return false; } catch (...) { return true; } }()
9278#define DOCTEST_CHECK_THROWS(...) [&] { try { __VA_ARGS__; return false; } catch (...) { return true; } }()
9279#define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_THROWS(...) [&] { try { __VA_ARGS__; return false; } catch (...) { return true; } }()
9280#define DOCTEST_WARN_THROWS_AS(expr, ...) [&] { try { expr; } catch (__VA_ARGS__) { return true; } catch (...) { } return false; }()
9281#define DOCTEST_CHECK_THROWS_AS(expr, ...) [&] { try { expr; } catch (__VA_ARGS__) { return true; } catch (...) { } return false; }()
9282#define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_THROWS_AS(expr, ...) [&] { try { expr; } catch (__VA_ARGS__) { return true; } catch (...) { } return false; }()
9283#define DOCTEST_WARN_NOTHROW(...) [&] { try { __VA_ARGS__; return true; } catch (...) { return false; } }()
9284#define DOCTEST_CHECK_NOTHROW(...) [&] { try { __VA_ARGS__; return true; } catch (...) { return false; } }()
9285#define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_NOTHROW(...) [&] { try { __VA_ARGS__; return true; } catch (...) { return false; } }()
9286
9287#define DOCTEST_WARN_THROWS_MESSAGE(expr, ...) [&] { try { __VA_ARGS__; return false; } catch (...) { return true; } }()
9288#define DOCTEST_CHECK_THROWS_MESSAGE(expr, ...) [&] { try { __VA_ARGS__; return false; } catch (...) { return true; } }()
9289#define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_THROWS_MESSAGE(expr, ...) [&] { try { __VA_ARGS__; return false; } catch (...) { return true; } }()
9290#define DOCTEST_WARN_THROWS_AS_MESSAGE(expr, ex, ...) [&] { try { expr; } catch (__VA_ARGS__) { return true; } catch (...) { } return false; }()
9291#define DOCTEST_CHECK_THROWS_AS_MESSAGE(expr, ex, ...) [&] { try { expr; } catch (__VA_ARGS__) { return true; } catch (...) { } return false; }()
9292#define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_THROWS_AS_MESSAGE(expr, ex, ...) [&] { try { expr; } catch (__VA_ARGS__) { return true; } catch (...) { } return false; }()
9293#define DOCTEST_WARN_NOTHROW_MESSAGE(expr, ...) [&] { try { __VA_ARGS__; return true; } catch (...) { return false; } }()
9294#define DOCTEST_CHECK_NOTHROW_MESSAGE(expr, ...) [&] { try { __VA_ARGS__; return true; } catch (...) { return false; } }()
9295#define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_NOTHROW_MESSAGE(expr, ...) [&] { try { __VA_ARGS__; return true; } catch (...) { return false; } }()
9296
9297#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS

9382
9383#ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS_BUT_WITH_ALL_ASSERTS
9384#define DOCTEST_EXCEPTION_EMPTY_FUNC DOCTEST_FUNC_EMPTY
9385#else // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS_BUT_WITH_ALL_ASSERTS
9386#define DOCTEST_EXCEPTION_EMPTY_FUNC [] { static_assert(false, "Exceptions are disabled! " \
9387 "Use DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS_BUT_WITH_ALL_ASSERTS if you want to compile with exceptions disabled."); return false; }()

9394#undef DOCTEST_REQUIRE_NE

9400#undef DOCTEST_REQUIRE_UNARY_FALSE

9405#define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_FALSE_MESSAGE DOCTEST_EXCEPTION_EMPTY_FUNC

9454#define DOCTEST_FAST_CHECK_EQ DOCTEST_CHECK_EQ
9455#define DOCTEST_FAST_REQUIRE_EQ DOCTEST_REQUIRE_EQ

9457#define DOCTEST_FAST_CHECK_NE DOCTEST_CHECK_NE
9458#define DOCTEST_FAST_REQUIRE_NE DOCTEST_REQUIRE_NE

9461#define DOCTEST_FAST_REQUIRE_GT DOCTEST_REQUIRE_GT

9464#define DOCTEST_FAST_REQUIRE_LT DOCTEST_REQUIRE_LT

9479#define DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_TEMPLATE_INSTANTIATE(id, ...) DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_TEMPLATE_INVOKE(id,__VA_ARGS__)
9480// clang-format on
9481
9482// BDD style macros
9483// clang-format off
9484#define DOCTEST_SCENARIO(name) DOCTEST_TEST_CASE(" Scenario: " name)
9485#define DOCTEST_SCENARIO_CLASS(name) DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_CLASS(" Scenario: " name)
9486#define DOCTEST_SCENARIO_TEMPLATE(name, T, ...) DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_TEMPLATE(" Scenario: " name, T, __VA_ARGS__)
9487#define DOCTEST_SCENARIO_TEMPLATE_DEFINE(name, T, id) DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_TEMPLATE_DEFINE(" Scenario: " name, T, id)
9488
9489#define DOCTEST_GIVEN(name) DOCTEST_SUBCASE(" Given: " name)
9490#define DOCTEST_WHEN(name) DOCTEST_SUBCASE(" When: " name)
9491#define DOCTEST_AND_WHEN(name) DOCTEST_SUBCASE("And when: " name)
9492#define DOCTEST_THEN(name) DOCTEST_SUBCASE(" Then: " name)
9493#define DOCTEST_AND_THEN(name) DOCTEST_SUBCASE(" And: " name)
9494// clang-format on
9495
9496// == SHORT VERSIONS OF THE MACROS
9497#ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_SHORT_MACRO_NAMES
9498
9499#define TEST_CASE(name) DOCTEST_TEST_CASE(name)
9500#define TEST_CASE_CLASS(name) DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_CLASS(name)
9501#define TEST_CASE_FIXTURE(x, name) DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_FIXTURE(x, name)
9502#define TYPE_TO_STRING_AS(str, ...) DOCTEST_TYPE_TO_STRING_AS(str, __VA_ARGS__)
9503#define TYPE_TO_STRING(...) DOCTEST_TYPE_TO_STRING(__VA_ARGS__)
9504#define TEST_CASE_TEMPLATE(name, T, ...) DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_TEMPLATE(name, T, __VA_ARGS__)
9505#define TEST_CASE_TEMPLATE_DEFINE(name, T, id) DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_TEMPLATE_DEFINE(name, T, id)
9506#define TEST_CASE_TEMPLATE_INVOKE(id, ...) DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_TEMPLATE_INVOKE(id, __VA_ARGS__)
9507#define TEST_CASE_TEMPLATE_APPLY(id, ...) DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_TEMPLATE_APPLY(id, __VA_ARGS__)
9508#define SUBCASE(name) DOCTEST_SUBCASE(name)
9509#define TEST_SUITE(decorators) DOCTEST_TEST_SUITE(decorators)
9510#define TEST_SUITE_BEGIN(name) DOCTEST_TEST_SUITE_BEGIN(name)
9511#define TEST_SUITE_END DOCTEST_TEST_SUITE_END
9512#define REGISTER_EXCEPTION_TRANSLATOR(signature) DOCTEST_REGISTER_EXCEPTION_TRANSLATOR(signature)
9513#define REGISTER_REPORTER(name, priority, reporter) DOCTEST_REGISTER_REPORTER(name, priority, reporter)
9514#define REGISTER_LISTENER(name, priority, reporter) DOCTEST_REGISTER_LISTENER(name, priority, reporter)
9515#define INFO(...) DOCTEST_INFO(__VA_ARGS__)
9516#define CAPTURE(x) DOCTEST_CAPTURE(x)
9517#define ADD_MESSAGE_AT(file, line, ...) DOCTEST_ADD_MESSAGE_AT(file, line, __VA_ARGS__)
9518#define ADD_FAIL_CHECK_AT(file, line, ...) DOCTEST_ADD_FAIL_CHECK_AT(file, line, __VA_ARGS__)
9519#define ADD_FAIL_AT(file, line, ...) DOCTEST_ADD_FAIL_AT(file, line, __VA_ARGS__)
9520#define MESSAGE(...) DOCTEST_MESSAGE(__VA_ARGS__)
9521#define FAIL_CHECK(...) DOCTEST_FAIL_CHECK(__VA_ARGS__)
9522#define FAIL(...) DOCTEST_FAIL(__VA_ARGS__)
9523#define TO_LVALUE(...) DOCTEST_TO_LVALUE(__VA_ARGS__)
9524
9525#define WARN(...) DOCTEST_WARN(__VA_ARGS__)
9526#define WARN_FALSE(...) DOCTEST_WARN_FALSE(__VA_ARGS__)
9527#define WARN_THROWS(...) DOCTEST_WARN_THROWS(__VA_ARGS__)
9528#define WARN_THROWS_AS(expr, ...) DOCTEST_WARN_THROWS_AS(expr, __VA_ARGS__)
9529#define WARN_THROWS_WITH(expr, ...) DOCTEST_WARN_THROWS_WITH(expr, __VA_ARGS__)
9530#define WARN_THROWS_WITH_AS(expr, with, ...) DOCTEST_WARN_THROWS_WITH_AS(expr, with, __VA_ARGS__)
9531#define WARN_NOTHROW(...) DOCTEST_WARN_NOTHROW(__VA_ARGS__)
9532#define CHECK(...) DOCTEST_CHECK(__VA_ARGS__)
9533#define CHECK_FALSE(...) DOCTEST_CHECK_FALSE(__VA_ARGS__)
9534#define CHECK_THROWS(...) DOCTEST_CHECK_THROWS(__VA_ARGS__)
9535#define CHECK_THROWS_AS(expr, ...) DOCTEST_CHECK_THROWS_AS(expr, __VA_ARGS__)
9536#define CHECK_THROWS_WITH(expr, ...) DOCTEST_CHECK_THROWS_WITH(expr, __VA_ARGS__)
9537#define CHECK_THROWS_WITH_AS(expr, with, ...) DOCTEST_CHECK_THROWS_WITH_AS(expr, with, __VA_ARGS__)
9538#define CHECK_NOTHROW(...) DOCTEST_CHECK_NOTHROW(__VA_ARGS__)
9539#define REQUIRE(...) DOCTEST_REQUIRE(__VA_ARGS__)
9540#define REQUIRE_FALSE(...) DOCTEST_REQUIRE_FALSE(__VA_ARGS__)
9541#define REQUIRE_THROWS(...) DOCTEST_REQUIRE_THROWS(__VA_ARGS__)
9542#define REQUIRE_THROWS_AS(expr, ...) DOCTEST_REQUIRE_THROWS_AS(expr, __VA_ARGS__)
9543#define REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH(expr, ...) DOCTEST_REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH(expr, __VA_ARGS__)
9544#define REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH_AS(expr, with, ...) DOCTEST_REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH_AS(expr, with, __VA_ARGS__)
9545#define REQUIRE_NOTHROW(...) DOCTEST_REQUIRE_NOTHROW(__VA_ARGS__)
9546
9547#define WARN_MESSAGE(cond, ...) DOCTEST_WARN_MESSAGE(cond, __VA_ARGS__)
9548#define WARN_FALSE_MESSAGE(cond, ...) DOCTEST_WARN_FALSE_MESSAGE(cond, __VA_ARGS__)
9549#define WARN_THROWS_MESSAGE(expr, ...) DOCTEST_WARN_THROWS_MESSAGE(expr, __VA_ARGS__)
9550#define WARN_THROWS_AS_MESSAGE(expr, ex, ...) DOCTEST_WARN_THROWS_AS_MESSAGE(expr, ex, __VA_ARGS__)
9551#define WARN_THROWS_WITH_MESSAGE(expr, with, ...) DOCTEST_WARN_THROWS_WITH_MESSAGE(expr, with, __VA_ARGS__)
9552#define WARN_THROWS_WITH_AS_MESSAGE(expr, with, ex, ...) DOCTEST_WARN_THROWS_WITH_AS_MESSAGE(expr, with, ex, __VA_ARGS__)
9553#define WARN_NOTHROW_MESSAGE(expr, ...) DOCTEST_WARN_NOTHROW_MESSAGE(expr, __VA_ARGS__)
9554#define CHECK_MESSAGE(cond, ...) DOCTEST_CHECK_MESSAGE(cond, __VA_ARGS__)
9555#define CHECK_FALSE_MESSAGE(cond, ...) DOCTEST_CHECK_FALSE_MESSAGE(cond, __VA_ARGS__)

9557#define CHECK_THROWS_AS_MESSAGE(expr, ex, ...) DOCTEST_CHECK_THROWS_AS_MESSAGE(expr, ex, __VA_ARGS__)
9558#define CHECK_THROWS_WITH_MESSAGE(expr, with, ...) DOCTEST_CHECK_THROWS_WITH_MESSAGE(expr, with, __VA_ARGS__)
9559#define CHECK_THROWS_WITH_AS_MESSAGE(expr, with, ex, ...) DOCTEST_CHECK_THROWS_WITH_AS_MESSAGE(expr, with, ex, __VA_ARGS__)
9560#define CHECK_NOTHROW_MESSAGE(expr, ...) DOCTEST_CHECK_NOTHROW_MESSAGE(expr, __VA_ARGS__)
9561#define REQUIRE_MESSAGE(cond, ...) DOCTEST_REQUIRE_MESSAGE(cond, __VA_ARGS__)
9562#define REQUIRE_FALSE_MESSAGE(cond, ...) DOCTEST_REQUIRE_FALSE_MESSAGE(cond, __VA_ARGS__)
9563#define REQUIRE_THROWS_MESSAGE(expr, ...) DOCTEST_REQUIRE_THROWS_MESSAGE(expr, __VA_ARGS__)
9564#define REQUIRE_THROWS_AS_MESSAGE(expr, ex, ...) DOCTEST_REQUIRE_THROWS_AS_MESSAGE(expr, ex, __VA_ARGS__)

9567#define REQUIRE_NOTHROW_MESSAGE(expr, ...) DOCTEST_REQUIRE_NOTHROW_MESSAGE(expr, __VA_ARGS__)

9735#define DOCTEST_DECLARE_STATIC_MUTEX(name) static DOCTEST_DECLARE_MUTEX(name)
9736#define DOCTEST_LOCK_MUTEX(name) std::lock_guard<std::mutex> DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(DOCTEST_ANON_LOCK_)(name);
9737#else // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_MULTITHREADING
9738#define DOCTEST_DECLARE_MUTEX(name)
9739#define DOCTEST_DECLARE_STATIC_MUTEX(name)
9740#define DOCTEST_LOCK_MUTEX(name)
9741#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_MULTITHREADING

9793#define DOCTEST_COUNTOF(x) (sizeof(x) / sizeof(x[0]))
