9834
9835namespace doctest {
9836
9837bool is_running_in_test = false;
9838
9839namespace {
9840 using namespace detail;
9841
9842 template <typename Ex>
9843 DOCTEST_NORETURN void throw_exception(Ex const& e) {
9844#ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
9845 throw e;
9846#else // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
9847 std::cerr << "doctest will terminate because it needed to throw an exception.\n"
9848 << "The message was: " << e.what() << '\n';
9849 std::terminate();
9850#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
9851 }
9852
9853#ifndef DOCTEST_INTERNAL_ERROR
9854#define DOCTEST_INTERNAL_ERROR(msg) \
9855 throw_exception(std::logic_error( \
9856 __FILE__ ":" DOCTEST_TOSTR(__LINE__) ": Internal doctest error: " msg))
9857#endif // DOCTEST_INTERNAL_ERROR
9858
9859 // case insensitive strcmp
9860 int stricmp(const char* a, const char* b) {
9861 for(;; a++, b++) {
9862 const int d = tolower(*a) - tolower(*b);
9863 if(d != 0 || !*a)
9864 return d;
9865 }
9866 }
9867
9868 struct Endianness
9869 {
9870 enum Arch
9871 {
9872 Big,
9873 Little
9874 };
9875
9876 static Arch which() {
9877 int x = 1;
9878 // casting any data pointer to char* is allowed
9879 auto ptr = reinterpret_cast<char*>(&x);
9880 if(*ptr)
9881 return Little;
9882 return Big;
9883 }
9884 };
9885} // namespace
9886
9887namespace detail {
9888 DOCTEST_THREAD_LOCAL class
9889 {
9890 std::vector<std::streampos> stack;
9891 std::stringstream ss;
9892
9893 public:
9894 std::ostream* push() {
9895 stack.push_back(ss.tellp());
9896 return &ss;
9897 }
9898
9899 String pop() {
9900 if (stack.empty())
9901 DOCTEST_INTERNAL_ERROR("TLSS was empty when trying to pop!");
9902
9903 std::streampos pos = stack.back();
9904 stack.pop_back();
9905 unsigned sz = static_cast<unsigned>(ss.tellp() - pos);
9906 ss.rdbuf()->pubseekpos(pos, std::ios::in | std::ios::out);
9907 return String(ss, sz);
9908 }
9909 } g_oss;
9910
9911 std::ostream* tlssPush() {
9912 return g_oss.push();
9913 }
9914
9915 String tlssPop() {
9916 return g_oss.pop();
9917 }
9918
9919#ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_DISABLE
9920
9921namespace timer_large_integer
9922{
9923
9924#if defined(DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS)
9925 using type = ULONGLONG;
9926#else // DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
9927 using type = std::uint64_t;
9928#endif // DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
9929}
9930
9931using ticks_t = timer_large_integer::type;
9932
9933#ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_GETCURRENTTICKS
9934 ticks_t getCurrentTicks() { return DOCTEST_CONFIG_GETCURRENTTICKS(); }
9935#elif defined(DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS)
9936 ticks_t getCurrentTicks() {
9937 static LARGE_INTEGER hz = { {0} }, hzo = { {0} };
9938 if(!hz.QuadPart) {
9939 QueryPerformanceFrequency(&hz);
9940 QueryPerformanceCounter(&hzo);
9941 }
9942 LARGE_INTEGER t;
9943 QueryPerformanceCounter(&t);
9944 return ((t.QuadPart - hzo.QuadPart) * LONGLONG(1000000)) / hz.QuadPart;
9945 }
9946#else // DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
9947 ticks_t getCurrentTicks() {
9948 timeval t;
9949 gettimeofday(&t, nullptr);
9950 return static_cast<ticks_t>(t.tv_sec) * 1000000 + static_cast<ticks_t>(t.tv_usec);
9951 }
9952#endif // DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
9953
9954 struct Timer
9955 {
9956 void start() { m_ticks = getCurrentTicks(); }
9957 unsigned int getElapsedMicroseconds() const {
9958 return static_cast<unsigned int>(getCurrentTicks() - m_ticks);
9959 }
9960 //unsigned int getElapsedMilliseconds() const {
9961 // return static_cast<unsigned int>(getElapsedMicroseconds() / 1000);
9962 //}
9963 double getElapsedSeconds() const { return static_cast<double>(getCurrentTicks() - m_ticks) / 1000000.0; }
9964
9965 private:
9966 ticks_t m_ticks = 0;
9967 };
9968
9969#ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_MULTITHREADING
9970 template <typename T>
9971 using Atomic = T;
9972#else // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_MULTITHREADING
9973 template <typename T>
9974 using Atomic = std::atomic<T>;
9975#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_MULTITHREADING
9976
9977#if defined(DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_MULTI_LANE_ATOMICS) || defined(DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_MULTITHREADING)
9978 template <typename T>
9979 using MultiLaneAtomic = Atomic<T>;
9980#else // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_MULTI_LANE_ATOMICS
9981 // Provides a multilane implementation of an atomic variable that supports add, sub, load,
9982 // store. Instead of using a single atomic variable, this splits up into multiple ones,
9983 // each sitting on a separate cache line. The goal is to provide a speedup when most
9984 // operations are modifying. It achieves this with two properties:
9985 //
9986 // * Multiple atomics are used, so chance of congestion from the same atomic is reduced.
9987 // * Each atomic sits on a separate cache line, so false sharing is reduced.
9988 //
9989 // The disadvantage is that there is a small overhead due to the use of TLS, and load/store
9990 // is slower because all atomics have to be accessed.
9991 template <typename T>
9992 class MultiLaneAtomic
9993 {
9994 struct CacheLineAlignedAtomic
9995 {
9996 Atomic<T> atomic{};
9997 char padding[DOCTEST_MULTI_LANE_ATOMICS_CACHE_LINE_SIZE - sizeof(Atomic<T>)];
9998 };
9999 CacheLineAlignedAtomic m_atomics[DOCTEST_MULTI_LANE_ATOMICS_THREAD_LANES];
10000
10001 static_assert(sizeof(CacheLineAlignedAtomic) == DOCTEST_MULTI_LANE_ATOMICS_CACHE_LINE_SIZE,
10002 "guarantee one atomic takes exactly one cache line");
10003
10004 public:
10005 T operator++() DOCTEST_NOEXCEPT { return fetch_add(1) + 1; }
10006
10007 T operator++(int) DOCTEST_NOEXCEPT { return fetch_add(1); }
10008
10009 T fetch_add(T arg, std::memory_order order = std::memory_order_seq_cst) DOCTEST_NOEXCEPT {
10010 return myAtomic().fetch_add(arg, order);
10011 }
10012
10013 T fetch_sub(T arg, std::memory_order order = std::memory_order_seq_cst) DOCTEST_NOEXCEPT {
10014 return myAtomic().fetch_sub(arg, order);
10015 }
10016
10017 operator T() const DOCTEST_NOEXCEPT { return load(); }
10018
10019 T load(std::memory_order order = std::memory_order_seq_cst) const DOCTEST_NOEXCEPT {
10020 auto result = T();
10021 for(auto const& c : m_atomics) {
10022 result += c.atomic.load(order);
10023 }
10024 return result;
10025 }
10026
10027 T operator=(T desired) DOCTEST_NOEXCEPT { // lgtm [cpp/assignment-does-not-return-this]
10028 store(desired);
10029 return desired;
10030 }
10031
10032 void store(T desired, std::memory_order order = std::memory_order_seq_cst) DOCTEST_NOEXCEPT {
10033 // first value becomes desired", all others become 0.
10034 for(auto& c : m_atomics) {
10035 c.atomic.store(desired, order);
10036 desired = {};
10037 }
10038 }
10039
10040 private:
10041 // Each thread has a different atomic that it operates on. If more than NumLanes threads
10042 // use this, some will use the same atomic. So performance will degrade a bit, but still
10043 // everything will work.
10044 //
10045 // The logic here is a bit tricky. The call should be as fast as possible, so that there
10046 // is minimal to no overhead in determining the correct atomic for the current thread.
10047 //
10048 // 1. A global static counter laneCounter counts continuously up.
10049 // 2. Each successive thread will use modulo operation of that counter so it gets an atomic
10050 // assigned in a round-robin fashion.
10051 // 3. This tlsLaneIdx is stored in the thread local data, so it is directly available with
10052 // little overhead.
10053 Atomic<T>& myAtomic() DOCTEST_NOEXCEPT {
10054 static Atomic<size_t> laneCounter;
10055 DOCTEST_THREAD_LOCAL size_t tlsLaneIdx =
10056 laneCounter++ % DOCTEST_MULTI_LANE_ATOMICS_THREAD_LANES;
10057
10058 return m_atomics[tlsLaneIdx].atomic;
10059 }
10060 };
10061#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_MULTI_LANE_ATOMICS
10062
10063 // this holds both parameters from the command line and runtime data for tests
10064 struct ContextState : ContextOptions, TestRunStats, CurrentTestCaseStats
10065 {
10066 MultiLaneAtomic<int> numAssertsCurrentTest_atomic;
10067 MultiLaneAtomic<int> numAssertsFailedCurrentTest_atomic;
10068
10069 std::vector<std::vector<String>> filters = decltype(filters)(9); // 9 different filters
10070
10071 std::vector<IReporter*> reporters_currently_used;
10072
10073 assert_handler ah = nullptr;
10074
10075 Timer timer;
10076
10077 std::vector<String> stringifiedContexts; // logging from INFO() due to an exception
10078
10079 // stuff for subcases
10080 bool reachedLeaf;
10081 std::vector<SubcaseSignature> subcaseStack;
10082 std::vector<SubcaseSignature> nextSubcaseStack;
10083 std::unordered_set<unsigned long long> fullyTraversedSubcases;
10084 size_t currentSubcaseDepth;
10085 Atomic<bool> shouldLogCurrentException;
10086
10087 void resetRunData() {
10088 numTestCases = 0;
10089 numTestCasesPassingFilters = 0;
10090 numTestSuitesPassingFilters = 0;
10091 numTestCasesFailed = 0;
10092 numAsserts = 0;
10093 numAssertsFailed = 0;
10094 numAssertsCurrentTest = 0;
10095 numAssertsFailedCurrentTest = 0;
10096 }
10097
10098 void finalizeTestCaseData() {
10099 seconds = timer.getElapsedSeconds();
10100
10101 // update the non-atomic counters
10102 numAsserts += numAssertsCurrentTest_atomic;
10103 numAssertsFailed += numAssertsFailedCurrentTest_atomic;
10104 numAssertsCurrentTest = numAssertsCurrentTest_atomic;
10105 numAssertsFailedCurrentTest = numAssertsFailedCurrentTest_atomic;
10106
10107 if(numAssertsFailedCurrentTest)
10108 failure_flags |= TestCaseFailureReason::AssertFailure;
10109
10110 if(Approx(currentTest->m_timeout).epsilon(DBL_EPSILON) != 0 &&
10111 Approx(seconds).epsilon(DBL_EPSILON) > currentTest->m_timeout)
10112 failure_flags |= TestCaseFailureReason::Timeout;
10113
10114 if(currentTest->m_should_fail) {
10115 if(failure_flags) {
10116 failure_flags |= TestCaseFailureReason::ShouldHaveFailedAndDid;
10117 } else {
10118 failure_flags |= TestCaseFailureReason::ShouldHaveFailedButDidnt;
10119 }
10120 } else if(failure_flags && currentTest->m_may_fail) {
10121 failure_flags |= TestCaseFailureReason::CouldHaveFailedAndDid;
10122 } else if(currentTest->m_expected_failures > 0) {
10123 if(numAssertsFailedCurrentTest == currentTest->m_expected_failures) {
10124 failure_flags |= TestCaseFailureReason::FailedExactlyNumTimes;
10125 } else {
10126 failure_flags |= TestCaseFailureReason::DidntFailExactlyNumTimes;
10127 }
10128 }
10129
10130 bool ok_to_fail = (TestCaseFailureReason::ShouldHaveFailedAndDid & failure_flags) ||
10131 (TestCaseFailureReason::CouldHaveFailedAndDid & failure_flags) ||
10132 (TestCaseFailureReason::FailedExactlyNumTimes & failure_flags);
10133
10134 // if any subcase has failed - the whole test case has failed
10135 testCaseSuccess = !(failure_flags && !ok_to_fail);
10136 if(!testCaseSuccess)
10137 numTestCasesFailed++;
10138 }
10139 };
10140
10141 ContextState* g_cs = nullptr;
10142
10143 // used to avoid locks for the debug output
10144 // TODO: figure out if this is indeed necessary/correct - seems like either there still
10145 // could be a race or that there wouldn't be a race even if using the context directly
10146 DOCTEST_THREAD_LOCAL bool g_no_colors;
10147
10148#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_DISABLE
10149} // namespace detail
10150
10151char* String::allocate(size_type sz) {
10152 if (sz <= last) {
10153 buf[sz] = '\0';
10154 setLast(last - sz);
10155 return buf;
10156 } else {
10157 setOnHeap();
10158 data.size = sz;
10159 data.capacity = data.size + 1;
10160 data.ptr = new char[data.capacity];
10161 data.ptr[sz] = '\0';
10162 return data.ptr;
10163 }
10164}
10165
10166void String::setOnHeap() noexcept { *reinterpret_cast<unsigned char*>(&buf[last]) = 128; }
10167void String::setLast(size_type in) noexcept { buf[last] = char(in); }
10168void String::setSize(size_type sz) noexcept {
10169 if (isOnStack()) { buf[sz] = '\0'; setLast(last - sz); }
10170 else { data.ptr[sz] = '\0'; data.size = sz; }
10171}
10172
10173void String::copy(const String& other) {
10174 if(other.isOnStack()) {
10175 memcpy(buf, other.buf, len);
10176 } else {
10177 memcpy(allocate(other.data.size), other.data.ptr, other.data.size);
10178 }
10179}
10180
10181String::String() noexcept {
10182 buf[0] = '\0';
10183 setLast();
10184}
10185
10186String::~String() {
10187 if(!isOnStack())
10188 delete[] data.ptr;
10189} // NOLINT(clang-analyzer-cplusplus.NewDeleteLeaks)
10190
10191String::String(const char* in)
10192 : String(in, strlen(in)) {}
10193
10194String::String(const char* in, size_type in_size) {
10195 memcpy(allocate(in_size), in, in_size);
10196}
10197
10198String::String(std::istream& in, size_type in_size) {
10199 in.read(allocate(in_size), in_size);
10200}
10201
10202String::String(const String& other) { copy(other); }
10203
10204String& String::operator=(const String& other) {
10205 if(this != &other) {
10206 if(!isOnStack())
10207 delete[] data.ptr;
10208
10209 copy(other);
10210 }
10211
10212 return *this;
10213}
10214
10215String& String::operator+=(const String& other) {
10216 const size_type my_old_size = size();
10217 const size_type other_size = other.size();
10218 const size_type total_size = my_old_size + other_size;
10219 if(isOnStack()) {
10220 if(total_size < len) {
10221 // append to the current stack space
10222 memcpy(buf + my_old_size, other.c_str(), other_size + 1);
10223 // NOLINTNEXTLINE(clang-analyzer-cplusplus.NewDeleteLeaks)
10224 setLast(last - total_size);
10225 } else {
10226 // alloc new chunk
10227 char* temp = new char[total_size + 1];
10228 // copy current data to new location before writing in the union
10229 memcpy(temp, buf, my_old_size); // skip the +1 ('\0') for speed
10230 // update data in union
10231 setOnHeap();
10232 data.size = total_size;
10233 data.capacity = data.size + 1;
10234 data.ptr = temp;
10235 // transfer the rest of the data
10236 memcpy(data.ptr + my_old_size, other.c_str(), other_size + 1);
10237 }
10238 } else {
10239 if(data.capacity > total_size) {
10240 // append to the current heap block
10241 data.size = total_size;
10242 memcpy(data.ptr + my_old_size, other.c_str(), other_size + 1);
10243 } else {
10244 // resize
10245 data.capacity *= 2;
10246 if(data.capacity <= total_size)
10247 data.capacity = total_size + 1;
10248 // alloc new chunk
10249 char* temp = new char[data.capacity];
10250 // copy current data to new location before releasing it
10251 memcpy(temp, data.ptr, my_old_size); // skip the +1 ('\0') for speed
10252 // release old chunk
10253 delete[] data.ptr;
10254 // update the rest of the union members
10255 data.size = total_size;
10256 data.ptr = temp;
10257 // transfer the rest of the data
10258 memcpy(data.ptr + my_old_size, other.c_str(), other_size + 1);
10259 }
10260 }
10261
10262 return *this;
10263}
10264
10265String::String(String&& other) noexcept {
10266 memcpy(buf, other.buf, len);
10267 other.buf[0] = '\0';
10268 other.setLast();
10269}
10270
10271String& String::operator=(String&& other) noexcept {
10272 if(this != &other) {
10273 if(!isOnStack())
10274 delete[] data.ptr;
10275 memcpy(buf, other.buf, len);
10276 other.buf[0] = '\0';
10277 other.setLast();
10278 }
10279 return *this;
10280}
10281
10282char String::operator[](size_type i) const {
10283 return const_cast<String*>(this)->operator[](i);
10284}
10285
10286char& String::operator[](size_type i) {
10287 if(isOnStack())
10288 return reinterpret_cast<char*>(buf)[i];
10289 return data.ptr[i];
10290}
10291
10292DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH("-Wmaybe-uninitialized")
10293String::size_type String::size() const {
10294 if(isOnStack())
10295 return last - (size_type(buf[last]) & 31); // using "last" would work only if "len" is 32
10296 return data.size;
10297}
10298DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
10299
10300String::size_type String::capacity() const {
10301 if(isOnStack())
10302 return len;
10303 return data.capacity;
10304}
10305
10306String String::substr(size_type pos, size_type cnt) && {
10307 cnt = std::min(cnt, size() - 1 - pos);
10308 char* cptr = c_str();
10309 memmove(cptr, cptr + pos, cnt);
10310 setSize(cnt);
10311 return std::move(*this);
10312}
10313
10314String String::substr(size_type pos, size_type cnt) const & {
10315 cnt = std::min(cnt, size() - 1 - pos);
10316 return String{ c_str() + pos, cnt };
10317}
10318
10319String::size_type String::find(char ch, size_type pos) const {
10320 const char* begin = c_str();
10321 const char* end = begin + size();
10322 const char* it = begin + pos;
10323 for (; it < end && *it != ch; it++);
10324 if (it < end) { return static_cast<size_type>(it - begin); }
10325 else { return npos; }
10326}
10327
10328String::size_type String::rfind(char ch, size_type pos) const {
10329 const char* begin = c_str();
10330 const char* it = begin + std::min(pos, size() - 1);
10331 for (; it >= begin && *it != ch; it--);
10332 if (it >= begin) { return static_cast<size_type>(it - begin); }
10333 else { return npos; }
10334}
10335
10336int String::compare(const char* other, bool no_case) const {
10337 if(no_case)
10338 return doctest::stricmp(c_str(), other);
10339 return std::strcmp(c_str(), other);
10340}
10341
10342int String::compare(const String& other, bool no_case) const {
10343 return compare(other.c_str(), no_case);
10344}
10345
10346String operator+(const String& lhs, const String& rhs) { return String(lhs) += rhs; }
10347
10348bool operator==(const String& lhs, const String& rhs) { return lhs.compare(rhs) == 0; }
10349bool operator!=(const String& lhs, const String& rhs) { return lhs.compare(rhs) != 0; }
10350bool operator< (const String& lhs, const String& rhs) { return lhs.compare(rhs) < 0; }
10351bool operator> (const String& lhs, const String& rhs) { return lhs.compare(rhs) > 0; }
10352bool operator<=(const String& lhs, const String& rhs) { return (lhs != rhs) ? lhs.compare(rhs) < 0 : true; }
10353bool operator>=(const String& lhs, const String& rhs) { return (lhs != rhs) ? lhs.compare(rhs) > 0 : true; }
10354
10355std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& s, const String& in) { return s << in.c_str(); }
10356
10357Contains::Contains(const String& str) : string(str) { }
10358
10359bool Contains::checkWith(const String& other) const {
10360 return strstr(other.c_str(), string.c_str()) != nullptr;
10361}
10362
10363String toString(const Contains& in) {
10364 return "Contains( " + in.string + " )";
10365}
10366
10367bool operator==(const String& lhs, const Contains& rhs) { return rhs.checkWith(lhs); }
10368bool operator==(const Contains& lhs, const String& rhs) { return lhs.checkWith(rhs); }
10369bool operator!=(const String& lhs, const Contains& rhs) { return !rhs.checkWith(lhs); }
10370bool operator!=(const Contains& lhs, const String& rhs) { return !lhs.checkWith(rhs); }
10371
10372namespace {
10373 void color_to_stream(std::ostream&, Color::Enum) DOCTEST_BRANCH_ON_DISABLED({}, ;)
10374} // namespace
10375
10376namespace Color {
10377 std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& s, Color::Enum code) {
10378 color_to_stream(s, code);
10379 return s;
10380 }
10381} // namespace Color
10382
10383// clang-format off
10384const char* assertString(assertType::Enum at) {
10385 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH(4061) // enum 'x' in switch of enum 'y' is not explicitely handled
10386 #define DOCTEST_GENERATE_ASSERT_TYPE_CASE(assert_type) case assertType::DT_ ## assert_type: return #assert_type
10387 #define DOCTEST_GENERATE_ASSERT_TYPE_CASES(assert_type) \
10388 DOCTEST_GENERATE_ASSERT_TYPE_CASE(WARN_ ## assert_type); \
10389 DOCTEST_GENERATE_ASSERT_TYPE_CASE(CHECK_ ## assert_type); \
10390 DOCTEST_GENERATE_ASSERT_TYPE_CASE(REQUIRE_ ## assert_type)
10391 switch(at) {
10392 DOCTEST_GENERATE_ASSERT_TYPE_CASE(WARN);
10393 DOCTEST_GENERATE_ASSERT_TYPE_CASE(CHECK);
10394 DOCTEST_GENERATE_ASSERT_TYPE_CASE(REQUIRE);
10395
10396 DOCTEST_GENERATE_ASSERT_TYPE_CASES(FALSE);
10397
10398 DOCTEST_GENERATE_ASSERT_TYPE_CASES(THROWS);
10399
10400 DOCTEST_GENERATE_ASSERT_TYPE_CASES(THROWS_AS);
10401
10402 DOCTEST_GENERATE_ASSERT_TYPE_CASES(THROWS_WITH);
10403
10404 DOCTEST_GENERATE_ASSERT_TYPE_CASES(THROWS_WITH_AS);
10405
10406 DOCTEST_GENERATE_ASSERT_TYPE_CASES(NOTHROW);
10407
10408 DOCTEST_GENERATE_ASSERT_TYPE_CASES(EQ);
10409 DOCTEST_GENERATE_ASSERT_TYPE_CASES(NE);
10410 DOCTEST_GENERATE_ASSERT_TYPE_CASES(GT);
10411 DOCTEST_GENERATE_ASSERT_TYPE_CASES(LT);
10412 DOCTEST_GENERATE_ASSERT_TYPE_CASES(GE);
10413 DOCTEST_GENERATE_ASSERT_TYPE_CASES(LE);
10414
10415 DOCTEST_GENERATE_ASSERT_TYPE_CASES(UNARY);
10416 DOCTEST_GENERATE_ASSERT_TYPE_CASES(UNARY_FALSE);
10417
10418 default: DOCTEST_INTERNAL_ERROR("Tried stringifying invalid assert type!");
10419 }
10420 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
10421}
10422// clang-format on
10423
10424const char* failureString(assertType::Enum at) {
10425 if(at & assertType::is_warn)
10426 return "WARNING";
10427 if(at & assertType::is_check)
10428 return "ERROR";
10429 if(at & assertType::is_require)
10430 return "FATAL ERROR";
10431 return "";
10432}
10433
10434DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH("-Wnull-dereference")
10435DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH("-Wnull-dereference")
10436// depending on the current options this will remove the path of filenames
10437const char* skipPathFromFilename(const char* file) {
10438#ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_DISABLE
10439 if(getContextOptions()->no_path_in_filenames) {
10440 auto back = std::strrchr(file, '\\');
10441 auto forward = std::strrchr(file, '/');
10442 if(back || forward) {
10443 if(back > forward)
10444 forward = back;
10445 return forward + 1;
10446 }
10447 }
10448#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_DISABLE
10449 return file;
10450}
10451DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
10452DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
10453
10454bool SubcaseSignature::operator==(const SubcaseSignature& other) const {
10455 return m_line == other.m_line
10456 && std::strcmp(m_file, other.m_file) == 0
10457 && m_name == other.m_name;
10458}
10459
10460bool SubcaseSignature::operator<(const SubcaseSignature& other) const {
10461 if(m_line != other.m_line)
10462 return m_line < other.m_line;
10463 if(std::strcmp(m_file, other.m_file) != 0)
10464 return std::strcmp(m_file, other.m_file) < 0;
10465 return m_name.compare(other.m_name) < 0;
10466}
10467
10468DOCTEST_DEFINE_INTERFACE(IContextScope)
10469
10470namespace detail {
10471 void filldata<const void*>::fill(std::ostream* stream, const void* in) {
10472 if (in) { *stream << in; }
10473 else { *stream << "nullptr"; }
10474 }
10475
10476 template <typename T>
10477 String toStreamLit(T t) {
10478 std::ostream* os = tlssPush();
10479 os->operator<<(t);
10480 return tlssPop();
10481 }
10482}
10483
10484#ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_TREAT_CHAR_STAR_AS_STRING
10485String toString(const char* in) { return String("\"") + (in ? in : "{null string}") + "\""; }
10486#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_TREAT_CHAR_STAR_AS_STRING
10487
10488#if DOCTEST_MSVC >= DOCTEST_COMPILER(19, 20, 0)
10489// see this issue on why this is needed: https://github.com/doctest/doctest/issues/183
10490String toString(const std::string& in) { return in.c_str(); }
10491#endif // VS 2019
10492
10493String toString(String in) { return in; }
10494
10495String toString(std::nullptr_t) { return "nullptr"; }
10496
10497String toString(bool in) { return in ? "true" : "false"; }
10498
10499String toString(float in) { return toStreamLit(in); }
10500String toString(double in) { return toStreamLit(in); }
10501String toString(double long in) { return toStreamLit(in); }
10502
10503String toString(char in) { return toStreamLit(static_cast<signed>(in)); }
10504String toString(char signed in) { return toStreamLit(static_cast<signed>(in)); }
10505String toString(char unsigned in) { return toStreamLit(static_cast<unsigned>(in)); }
10506String toString(short in) { return toStreamLit(in); }
10507String toString(short unsigned in) { return toStreamLit(in); }
10508String toString(signed in) { return toStreamLit(in); }
10509String toString(unsigned in) { return toStreamLit(in); }
10510String toString(long in) { return toStreamLit(in); }
10511String toString(long unsigned in) { return toStreamLit(in); }
10512String toString(long long in) { return toStreamLit(in); }
10513String toString(long long unsigned in) { return toStreamLit(in); }
10514
10515Approx::Approx(double value)
10516 : m_epsilon(static_cast<double>(std::numeric_limits<float>::epsilon()) * 100)
10517 , m_scale(1.0)
10518 , m_value(value) {}
10519
10520Approx Approx::operator()(double value) const {
10521 Approx approx(value);
10522 approx.epsilon(m_epsilon);
10523 approx.scale(m_scale);
10524 return approx;
10525}
10526
10527Approx& Approx::epsilon(double newEpsilon) {
10528 m_epsilon = newEpsilon;
10529 return *this;
10530}
10531Approx& Approx::scale(double newScale) {
10532 m_scale = newScale;
10533 return *this;
10534}
10535
10536bool operator==(double lhs, const Approx& rhs) {
10537 // Thanks to Richard Harris for his help refining this formula
10538 return std::fabs(lhs - rhs.m_value) <
10539 rhs.m_epsilon * (rhs.m_scale + std::max<double>(std::fabs(lhs), std::fabs(rhs.m_value)));
10540}
10541bool operator==(const Approx& lhs, double rhs) { return operator==(rhs, lhs); }
10542bool operator!=(double lhs, const Approx& rhs) { return !operator==(lhs, rhs); }
10543bool operator!=(const Approx& lhs, double rhs) { return !operator==(rhs, lhs); }
10544bool operator<=(double lhs, const Approx& rhs) { return lhs < rhs.m_value || lhs == rhs; }
10545bool operator<=(const Approx& lhs, double rhs) { return lhs.m_value < rhs || lhs == rhs; }
10546bool operator>=(double lhs, const Approx& rhs) { return lhs > rhs.m_value || lhs == rhs; }
10547bool operator>=(const Approx& lhs, double rhs) { return lhs.m_value > rhs || lhs == rhs; }
10548bool operator<(double lhs, const Approx& rhs) { return lhs < rhs.m_value && lhs != rhs; }
10549bool operator<(const Approx& lhs, double rhs) { return lhs.m_value < rhs && lhs != rhs; }
10550bool operator>(double lhs, const Approx& rhs) { return lhs > rhs.m_value && lhs != rhs; }
10551bool operator>(const Approx& lhs, double rhs) { return lhs.m_value > rhs && lhs != rhs; }
10552
10553String toString(const Approx& in) {
10554 return "Approx( " + doctest::toString(in.m_value) + " )";
10555}
10556const ContextOptions* getContextOptions() { return DOCTEST_BRANCH_ON_DISABLED(nullptr, g_cs); }
10557
10558DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH(4738)
10559template <typename F>
10560IsNaN<F>::operator bool() const {
10561 return std::isnan(value) ^ flipped;
10562}
10563DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
10564template struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE_DEF IsNaN<float>;
10565template struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE_DEF IsNaN<double>;
10566template struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE_DEF IsNaN<long double>;
10567template <typename F>
10568String toString(IsNaN<F> in) { return String(in.flipped ? "! " : "") + "IsNaN( " + doctest::toString(in.value) + " )"; }
10569String toString(IsNaN<float> in) { return toString<float>(in); }
10570String toString(IsNaN<double> in) { return toString<double>(in); }
10571String toString(IsNaN<double long> in) { return toString<double long>(in); }
10572
10573} // namespace doctest
10574
10575#ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_DISABLE

10578Context::~Context() = default;
10579void Context::applyCommandLine(int, const char* const*) {}
10580void Context::addFilter(const char*, const char*) {}
10581void Context::clearFilters() {}
10582void Context::setOption(const char*, bool) {}
10583void Context::setOption(const char*, int) {}
10584void Context::setOption(const char*, const char*) {}
10585bool Context::shouldExit() { return false; }
10586void Context::setAsDefaultForAssertsOutOfTestCases() {}
10587void Context::setAssertHandler(detail::assert_handler) {}
10588void Context::setCout(std::ostream*) {}
10589int Context::run() { return 0; }
10590
10591int IReporter::get_num_active_contexts() { return 0; }
10592const IContextScope* const* IReporter::get_active_contexts() { return nullptr; }
10593int IReporter::get_num_stringified_contexts() { return 0; }
10594const String* IReporter::get_stringified_contexts() { return nullptr; }
10595
10596int registerReporter(const char*, int, IReporter*) { return 0; }
10597
10598} // namespace doctest
10599#else // DOCTEST_CONFIG_DISABLE

10601#if !defined(DOCTEST_CONFIG_COLORS_NONE)
10602#if !defined(DOCTEST_CONFIG_COLORS_WINDOWS) && !defined(DOCTEST_CONFIG_COLORS_ANSI)
10603#ifdef DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS

10605#else // linux

10609#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_COLORS_NONE

10611namespace doctest_detail_test_suite_ns {
10612// holds the current test suite
10613doctest::detail::TestSuite& getCurrentTestSuite() {
10614 static doctest::detail::TestSuite data{};
10615 return data;
10616}
10617} // namespace doctest_detail_test_suite_ns
10618
10619namespace doctest {
10620namespace {
10621 // the int (priority) is part of the key for automatic sorting - sadly one can register a
10622 // reporter with a duplicate name and a different priority but hopefully that won't happen often :|
10623 using reporterMap = std::map<std::pair<int, String>, reporterCreatorFunc>;
10624
10625 reporterMap& getReporters() {
10626 static reporterMap data;
10627 return data;
10628 }
10629 reporterMap& getListeners() {
10630 static reporterMap data;
10631 return data;
10632 }
10633} // namespace
10634namespace detail {
10635#define DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(function, ...) \
10636 for(auto& curr_rep : g_cs->reporters_currently_used) \
10637 curr_rep->function(__VA_ARGS__)
10638
10639 bool checkIfShouldThrow(assertType::Enum at) {
10640 if(at & assertType::is_require)
10641 return true;
10642
10643 if((at & assertType::is_check)
10644 && getContextOptions()->abort_after > 0 &&
10645 (g_cs->numAssertsFailed + g_cs->numAssertsFailedCurrentTest_atomic) >=
10646 getContextOptions()->abort_after)
10647 return true;
10648
10649 return false;
10650 }
10651
10652#ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
10653 DOCTEST_NORETURN void throwException() {
10654 g_cs->shouldLogCurrentException = false;
10655 throw TestFailureException(); // NOLINT(hicpp-exception-baseclass)
10656 }
10657#else // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
10658 void throwException() {}
10659#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
10660} // namespace detail
10661
10662namespace {
10663 using namespace detail;
10664 // matching of a string against a wildcard mask (case sensitivity configurable) taken from
10665 // https://www.codeproject.com/Articles/1088/Wildcard-string-compare-globbing
10666 int wildcmp(const char* str, const char* wild, bool caseSensitive) {
10667 const char* cp = str;
10668 const char* mp = wild;
10669
10670 while((*str) && (*wild != '*')) {
10671 if((caseSensitive ? (*wild != *str) : (tolower(*wild) != tolower(*str))) &&
10672 (*wild != '?')) {
10673 return 0;
10674 }
10675 wild++;
10676 str++;
10677 }
10678
10679 while(*str) {
10680 if(*wild == '*') {
10681 if(!*++wild) {
10682 return 1;
10683 }
10684 mp = wild;
10685 cp = str + 1;
10686 } else if((caseSensitive ? (*wild == *str) : (tolower(*wild) == tolower(*str))) ||
10687 (*wild == '?')) {
10688 wild++;
10689 str++;
10690 } else {
10691 wild = mp;
10692 str = cp++;
10693 }
10694 }
10695
10696 while(*wild == '*') {
10697 wild++;
10698 }
10699 return !*wild;
10700 }
10701
10702 // checks if the name matches any of the filters (and can be configured what to do when empty)
10703 bool matchesAny(const char* name, const std::vector<String>& filters, bool matchEmpty,
10704 bool caseSensitive) {
10705 if (filters.empty() && matchEmpty)
10706 return true;
10707 for (auto& curr : filters)
10708 if (wildcmp(name, curr.c_str(), caseSensitive))
10709 return true;
10710 return false;
10711 }
10712
10713 unsigned long long hash(unsigned long long a, unsigned long long b) {
10714 return (a << 5) + b;
10715 }
10716
10717 // C string hash function (djb2) - taken from http://www.cse.yorku.ca/~oz/hash.html
10718 unsigned long long hash(const char* str) {
10719 unsigned long long hash = 5381;
10720 char c;
10721 while ((c = *str++))
10722 hash = ((hash << 5) + hash) + c; // hash * 33 + c
10723 return hash;
10724 }
10725
10726 unsigned long long hash(const SubcaseSignature& sig) {
10727 return hash(hash(hash(sig.m_file), hash(sig.m_name.c_str())), sig.m_line);
10728 }
10729
10730 unsigned long long hash(const std::vector<SubcaseSignature>& sigs, size_t count) {
10731 unsigned long long running = 0;
10732 auto end = sigs.begin() + count;
10733 for (auto it = sigs.begin(); it != end; it++) {
10734 running = hash(running, hash(*it));
10735 }
10736 return running;
10737 }
10738
10739 unsigned long long hash(const std::vector<SubcaseSignature>& sigs) {
10740 unsigned long long running = 0;
10741 for (const SubcaseSignature& sig : sigs) {
10742 running = hash(running, hash(sig));
10743 }
10744 return running;
10745 }
10746} // namespace
10747namespace detail {
10748 bool Subcase::checkFilters() {
10749 if (g_cs->subcaseStack.size() < size_t(g_cs->subcase_filter_levels)) {
10750 if (!matchesAny(m_signature.m_name.c_str(), g_cs->filters[6], true, g_cs->case_sensitive))
10751 return true;
10752 if (matchesAny(m_signature.m_name.c_str(), g_cs->filters[7], false, g_cs->case_sensitive))
10753 return true;
10754 }
10755 return false;
10756 }
10757
10758 Subcase::Subcase(const String& name, const char* file, int line)
10759 : m_signature({name, file, line}) {
10760 if (!g_cs->reachedLeaf) {
10761 if (g_cs->nextSubcaseStack.size() <= g_cs->subcaseStack.size()
10762 || g_cs->nextSubcaseStack[g_cs->subcaseStack.size()] == m_signature) {
10763 // Going down.
10764 if (checkFilters()) { return; }
10765
10766 g_cs->subcaseStack.push_back(m_signature);
10767 g_cs->currentSubcaseDepth++;
10768 m_entered = true;
10769 DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(subcase_start, m_signature);
10770 }
10771 } else {
10772 if (g_cs->subcaseStack[g_cs->currentSubcaseDepth] == m_signature) {
10773 // This subcase is reentered via control flow.
10774 g_cs->currentSubcaseDepth++;
10775 m_entered = true;
10776 DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(subcase_start, m_signature);
10777 } else if (g_cs->nextSubcaseStack.size() <= g_cs->currentSubcaseDepth
10778 && g_cs->fullyTraversedSubcases.find(hash(hash(g_cs->subcaseStack, g_cs->currentSubcaseDepth), hash(m_signature)))
10779 == g_cs->fullyTraversedSubcases.end()) {
10780 if (checkFilters()) { return; }
10781 // This subcase is part of the one to be executed next.
10782 g_cs->nextSubcaseStack.clear();
10783 g_cs->nextSubcaseStack.insert(g_cs->nextSubcaseStack.end(),
10784 g_cs->subcaseStack.begin(), g_cs->subcaseStack.begin() + g_cs->currentSubcaseDepth);
10785 g_cs->nextSubcaseStack.push_back(m_signature);
10786 }
10787 }
10788 }
10789
10790 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH(4996) // std::uncaught_exception is deprecated in C++17
10791 DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH("-Wdeprecated-declarations")
10792 DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH("-Wdeprecated-declarations")
10793
10794 Subcase::~Subcase() {
10795 if (m_entered) {
10796 g_cs->currentSubcaseDepth--;
10797
10798 if (!g_cs->reachedLeaf) {
10799 // Leaf.
10800 g_cs->fullyTraversedSubcases.insert(hash(g_cs->subcaseStack));
10801 g_cs->nextSubcaseStack.clear();
10802 g_cs->reachedLeaf = true;
10803 } else if (g_cs->nextSubcaseStack.empty()) {
10804 // All children are finished.
10805 g_cs->fullyTraversedSubcases.insert(hash(g_cs->subcaseStack));
10806 }
10807
10808#if defined(__cpp_lib_uncaught_exceptions) && __cpp_lib_uncaught_exceptions >= 201411L && (!defined(__MAC_OS_X_VERSION_MIN_REQUIRED) || __MAC_OS_X_VERSION_MIN_REQUIRED >= 101200)
10809 if(std::uncaught_exceptions() > 0
10810#else
10811 if(std::uncaught_exception()
10812#endif
10813 && g_cs->shouldLogCurrentException) {
10814 DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(
10815 test_case_exception, {"exception thrown in subcase - will translate later "
10816 "when the whole test case has been exited (cannot "
10817 "translate while there is an active exception)",
10818 false});
10819 g_cs->shouldLogCurrentException = false;
10820 }
10821
10822 DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(subcase_end, DOCTEST_EMPTY);
10823 }
10824 }
10825
10826 DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
10827 DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
10828 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
10829
10830 Subcase::operator bool() const { return m_entered; }
10831
10832 Result::Result(bool passed, const String& decomposition)
10833 : m_passed(passed)
10834 , m_decomp(decomposition) {}
10835
10836 ExpressionDecomposer::ExpressionDecomposer(assertType::Enum at)
10837 : m_at(at) {}
10838
10839 TestSuite& TestSuite::operator*(const char* in) {
10840 m_test_suite = in;
10841 return *this;
10842 }
10843
10844 TestCase::TestCase(funcType test, const char* file, unsigned line, const TestSuite& test_suite,
10845 const String& type, int template_id) {
10846 m_file = file;
10847 m_line = line;
10848 m_name = nullptr; // will be later overridden in operator*
10849 m_test_suite = test_suite.m_test_suite;
10850 m_description = test_suite.m_description;
10851 m_skip = test_suite.m_skip;
10852 m_no_breaks = test_suite.m_no_breaks;
10853 m_no_output = test_suite.m_no_output;
10854 m_may_fail = test_suite.m_may_fail;
10855 m_should_fail = test_suite.m_should_fail;
10856 m_expected_failures = test_suite.m_expected_failures;
10857 m_timeout = test_suite.m_timeout;
10858
10859 m_test = test;
10860 m_type = type;
10861 m_template_id = template_id;
10862 }
10863
10864 TestCase::TestCase(const TestCase& other)
10865 : TestCaseData() {
10866 *this = other;
10867 }
10868
10869 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH(26434) // hides a non-virtual function
10870 TestCase& TestCase::operator=(const TestCase& other) {
10871 TestCaseData::operator=(other);
10872 m_test = other.m_test;
10873 m_type = other.m_type;
10874 m_template_id = other.m_template_id;
10875 m_full_name = other.m_full_name;
10876
10877 if(m_template_id != -1)
10878 m_name = m_full_name.c_str();
10879 return *this;
10880 }
10881 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
10882
10883 TestCase& TestCase::operator*(const char* in) {
10884 m_name = in;
10885 // make a new name with an appended type for templated test case
10886 if(m_template_id != -1) {
10887 m_full_name = String(m_name) + "<" + m_type + ">";
10888 // redirect the name to point to the newly constructed full name
10889 m_name = m_full_name.c_str();
10890 }
10891 return *this;
10892 }
10893
10894 bool TestCase::operator<(const TestCase& other) const {
10895 // this will be used only to differentiate between test cases - not relevant for sorting
10896 if(m_line != other.m_line)
10897 return m_line < other.m_line;
10898 const int name_cmp = strcmp(m_name, other.m_name);
10899 if(name_cmp != 0)
10900 return name_cmp < 0;
10901 const int file_cmp = m_file.compare(other.m_file);
10902 if(file_cmp != 0)
10903 return file_cmp < 0;
10904 return m_template_id < other.m_template_id;
10905 }
10906
10907 // all the registered tests
10908 std::set<TestCase>& getRegisteredTests() {
10909 static std::set<TestCase> data;
10910 return data;
10911 }
10912} // namespace detail
10913namespace {
10914 using namespace detail;
10915 // for sorting tests by file/line
10916 bool fileOrderComparator(const TestCase* lhs, const TestCase* rhs) {
10917 // this is needed because MSVC gives different case for drive letters
10918 // for __FILE__ when evaluated in a header and a source file
10919 const int res = lhs->m_file.compare(rhs->m_file, bool(DOCTEST_MSVC));
10920 if(res != 0)
10921 return res < 0;
10922 if(lhs->m_line != rhs->m_line)
10923 return lhs->m_line < rhs->m_line;
10924 return lhs->m_template_id < rhs->m_template_id;
10925 }
10926
10927 // for sorting tests by suite/file/line
10928 bool suiteOrderComparator(const TestCase* lhs, const TestCase* rhs) {
10929 const int res = std::strcmp(lhs->m_test_suite, rhs->m_test_suite);
10930 if(res != 0)
10931 return res < 0;
10932 return fileOrderComparator(lhs, rhs);
10933 }
10934
10935 // for sorting tests by name/suite/file/line
10936 bool nameOrderComparator(const TestCase* lhs, const TestCase* rhs) {
10937 const int res = std::strcmp(lhs->m_name, rhs->m_name);
10938 if(res != 0)
10939 return res < 0;
10940 return suiteOrderComparator(lhs, rhs);
10941 }
10942
10943 DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH("-Wdeprecated-declarations")
10944 void color_to_stream(std::ostream& s, Color::Enum code) {
10945 static_cast<void>(s); // for DOCTEST_CONFIG_COLORS_NONE or DOCTEST_CONFIG_COLORS_WINDOWS
10946 static_cast<void>(code); // for DOCTEST_CONFIG_COLORS_NONE
10947#ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_COLORS_ANSI
10948 if(g_no_colors ||
10949 (isatty(STDOUT_FILENO) == false && getContextOptions()->force_colors == false))
10950 return;
10951
10952 auto col = "";
10953 // clang-format off
10954 switch(code) {
10955 case Color::Red: col = "[0;31m"; break;
10956 case Color::Green: col = "[0;32m"; break;
10957 case Color::Blue: col = "[0;34m"; break;
10958 case Color::Cyan: col = "[0;36m"; break;
10959 case Color::Yellow: col = "[0;33m"; break;
10960 case Color::Grey: col = "[1;30m"; break;
10961 case Color::LightGrey: col = "[0;37m"; break;
10962 case Color::BrightRed: col = "[1;31m"; break;
10963 case Color::BrightGreen: col = "[1;32m"; break;
10964 case Color::BrightWhite: col = "[1;37m"; break;
10965 case Color::Bright: // invalid
10966 case Color::None:
10967 case Color::White:
10968 default: col = "[0m";
10969 }
10970 // clang-format on
10971 s << "\033" << col;
10972#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_COLORS_ANSI
10973
10974#ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_COLORS_WINDOWS
10975 if(g_no_colors ||
10976 (_isatty(_fileno(stdout)) == false && getContextOptions()->force_colors == false))
10977 return;
10978
10979 static struct ConsoleHelper {
10980 HANDLE stdoutHandle;
10981 WORD origFgAttrs;
10982 WORD origBgAttrs;
10983
10984 ConsoleHelper() {
10985 stdoutHandle = GetStdHandle(STD_OUTPUT_HANDLE);
10986 CONSOLE_SCREEN_BUFFER_INFO csbiInfo;
10987 GetConsoleScreenBufferInfo(stdoutHandle, &csbiInfo);
10988 origFgAttrs = csbiInfo.wAttributes & ~(BACKGROUND_GREEN | BACKGROUND_RED |
10989 BACKGROUND_BLUE | BACKGROUND_INTENSITY);
10990 origBgAttrs = csbiInfo.wAttributes & ~(FOREGROUND_GREEN | FOREGROUND_RED |
10991 FOREGROUND_BLUE | FOREGROUND_INTENSITY);
10992 }
10993 } ch;
10994
10995#define DOCTEST_SET_ATTR(x) SetConsoleTextAttribute(ch.stdoutHandle, x | ch.origBgAttrs)
10996
10997 // clang-format off
10998 switch (code) {
10999 case Color::White: DOCTEST_SET_ATTR(FOREGROUND_GREEN | FOREGROUND_RED | FOREGROUND_BLUE); break;
11000 case Color::Red: DOCTEST_SET_ATTR(FOREGROUND_RED); break;
11001 case Color::Green: DOCTEST_SET_ATTR(FOREGROUND_GREEN); break;
11002 case Color::Blue: DOCTEST_SET_ATTR(FOREGROUND_BLUE); break;
11003 case Color::Cyan: DOCTEST_SET_ATTR(FOREGROUND_BLUE | FOREGROUND_GREEN); break;
11004 case Color::Yellow: DOCTEST_SET_ATTR(FOREGROUND_RED | FOREGROUND_GREEN); break;
11005 case Color::Grey: DOCTEST_SET_ATTR(0); break;
11006 case Color::LightGrey: DOCTEST_SET_ATTR(FOREGROUND_INTENSITY); break;
11007 case Color::BrightRed: DOCTEST_SET_ATTR(FOREGROUND_INTENSITY | FOREGROUND_RED); break;
11008 case Color::BrightGreen: DOCTEST_SET_ATTR(FOREGROUND_INTENSITY | FOREGROUND_GREEN); break;
11009 case Color::BrightWhite: DOCTEST_SET_ATTR(FOREGROUND_INTENSITY | FOREGROUND_GREEN | FOREGROUND_RED | FOREGROUND_BLUE); break;
11010 case Color::None:
11011 case Color::Bright: // invalid
11012 default: DOCTEST_SET_ATTR(ch.origFgAttrs);
11013 }
11014 // clang-format on
11015#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_COLORS_WINDOWS
11016 }
11017 DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
11018
11019 std::vector<const IExceptionTranslator*>& getExceptionTranslators() {
11020 static std::vector<const IExceptionTranslator*> data;
11021 return data;
11022 }
11023
11024 String translateActiveException() {
11025#ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
11026 String res;
11027 auto& translators = getExceptionTranslators();
11028 for(auto& curr : translators)
11029 if(curr->translate(res))
11030 return res;
11031 // clang-format off
11032 DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH("-Wcatch-value")
11033 try {
11034 throw;
11035 } catch(std::exception& ex) {
11036 return ex.what();
11037 } catch(std::string& msg) {
11038 return msg.c_str();
11039 } catch(const char* msg) {
11040 return msg;
11041 } catch(...) {
11042 return "unknown exception";
11043 }
11044 DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
11045// clang-format on
11046#else // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
11047 return "";
11048#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
11049 }
11050} // namespace
11051
11052namespace detail {
11053 // used by the macros for registering tests
11054 int regTest(const TestCase& tc) {
11055 getRegisteredTests().insert(tc);
11056 return 0;
11057 }
11058
11059 // sets the current test suite
11060 int setTestSuite(const TestSuite& ts) {
11061 doctest_detail_test_suite_ns::getCurrentTestSuite() = ts;
11062 return 0;
11063 }
11064
11065#ifdef DOCTEST_IS_DEBUGGER_ACTIVE
11066 bool isDebuggerActive() { return DOCTEST_IS_DEBUGGER_ACTIVE(); }
11067#else // DOCTEST_IS_DEBUGGER_ACTIVE
11068#ifdef DOCTEST_PLATFORM_LINUX
11069 class ErrnoGuard {
11070 public:
11071 ErrnoGuard() : m_oldErrno(errno) {}
11072 ~ErrnoGuard() { errno = m_oldErrno; }
11073 private:
11074 int m_oldErrno;
11075 };
11076 // See the comments in Catch2 for the reasoning behind this implementation:
11077 // https://github.com/catchorg/Catch2/blob/v2.13.1/include/internal/catch_debugger.cpp#L79-L102
11078 bool isDebuggerActive() {
11079 ErrnoGuard guard;
11080 std::ifstream in("/proc/self/status");
11081 for(std::string line; std::getline(in, line);) {
11082 static const int PREFIX_LEN = 11;
11083 if(line.compare(0, PREFIX_LEN, "TracerPid:\t") == 0) {
11084 return line.length() > PREFIX_LEN && line[PREFIX_LEN] != '0';
11085 }
11086 }
11087 return false;
11088 }
11089#elif defined(DOCTEST_PLATFORM_MAC)
11090 // The following function is taken directly from the following technical note:
11091 // https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/qa/qa1361/_index.html
11092 // Returns true if the current process is being debugged (either
11093 // running under the debugger or has a debugger attached post facto).
11094 bool isDebuggerActive() {
11095 int mib[4];
11096 kinfo_proc info;
11097 size_t size;
11098 // Initialize the flags so that, if sysctl fails for some bizarre
11099 // reason, we get a predictable result.
11100 info.kp_proc.p_flag = 0;
11101 // Initialize mib, which tells sysctl the info we want, in this case
11102 // we're looking for information about a specific process ID.
11103 mib[0] = CTL_KERN;
11104 mib[1] = KERN_PROC;
11105 mib[2] = KERN_PROC_PID;
11106 mib[3] = getpid();
11107 // Call sysctl.
11108 size = sizeof(info);
11109 if(sysctl(mib, DOCTEST_COUNTOF(mib), &info, &size, 0, 0) != 0) {
11110 std::cerr << "\nCall to sysctl failed - unable to determine if debugger is active **\n";
11111 return false;
11112 }
11113 // We're being debugged if the P_TRACED flag is set.
11114 return ((info.kp_proc.p_flag & P_TRACED) != 0);
11115 }
11116#elif DOCTEST_MSVC || defined(__MINGW32__) || defined(__MINGW64__)
11117 bool isDebuggerActive() { return ::IsDebuggerPresent() != 0; }
11118#else
11119 bool isDebuggerActive() { return false; }
11120#endif // Platform
11121#endif // DOCTEST_IS_DEBUGGER_ACTIVE
11122
11123 void registerExceptionTranslatorImpl(const IExceptionTranslator* et) {
11124 if(std::find(getExceptionTranslators().begin(), getExceptionTranslators().end(), et) ==
11125 getExceptionTranslators().end())
11126 getExceptionTranslators().push_back(et);
11127 }
11128
11129 DOCTEST_THREAD_LOCAL std::vector<IContextScope*> g_infoContexts; // for logging with INFO()
11130
11131 ContextScopeBase::ContextScopeBase() {
11132 g_infoContexts.push_back(this);
11133 }
11134
11135 ContextScopeBase::ContextScopeBase(ContextScopeBase&& other) noexcept {
11136 if (other.need_to_destroy) {
11137 other.destroy();
11138 }
11139 other.need_to_destroy = false;
11140 g_infoContexts.push_back(this);
11141 }
11142
11143 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH(4996) // std::uncaught_exception is deprecated in C++17
11144 DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH("-Wdeprecated-declarations")
11145 DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH("-Wdeprecated-declarations")
11146
11147 // destroy cannot be inlined into the destructor because that would mean calling stringify after
11148 // ContextScope has been destroyed (base class destructors run after derived class destructors).
11149 // Instead, ContextScope calls this method directly from its destructor.
11150 void ContextScopeBase::destroy() {
11151#if defined(__cpp_lib_uncaught_exceptions) && __cpp_lib_uncaught_exceptions >= 201411L && (!defined(__MAC_OS_X_VERSION_MIN_REQUIRED) || __MAC_OS_X_VERSION_MIN_REQUIRED >= 101200)
11152 if(std::uncaught_exceptions() > 0) {
11153#else
11154 if(std::uncaught_exception()) {
11155#endif
11156 std::ostringstream s;
11157 this->stringify(&s);
11158 g_cs->stringifiedContexts.push_back(s.str().c_str());
11159 }
11160 g_infoContexts.pop_back();
11161 }
11162
11163 DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
11164 DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
11165 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
11166} // namespace detail
11167namespace {
11168 using namespace detail;
11169
11170#if !defined(DOCTEST_CONFIG_POSIX_SIGNALS) && !defined(DOCTEST_CONFIG_WINDOWS_SEH)
11171 struct FatalConditionHandler
11172 {
11173 static void reset() {}
11174 static void allocateAltStackMem() {}
11175 static void freeAltStackMem() {}
11176 };
11177#else // DOCTEST_CONFIG_POSIX_SIGNALS || DOCTEST_CONFIG_WINDOWS_SEH
11178
11179 void reportFatal(const std::string&);
11180
11181#ifdef DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
11182
11183 struct SignalDefs
11184 {
11185 DWORD id;
11186 const char* name;
11187 };
11188 // There is no 1-1 mapping between signals and windows exceptions.
11189 // Windows can easily distinguish between SO and SigSegV,
11190 // but SigInt, SigTerm, etc are handled differently.
11191 SignalDefs signalDefs[] = {
11192 {static_cast<DWORD>(EXCEPTION_ILLEGAL_INSTRUCTION),
11193 "SIGILL - Illegal instruction signal"},
11194 {static_cast<DWORD>(EXCEPTION_STACK_OVERFLOW), "SIGSEGV - Stack overflow"},
11195 {static_cast<DWORD>(EXCEPTION_ACCESS_VIOLATION),
11196 "SIGSEGV - Segmentation violation signal"},
11197 {static_cast<DWORD>(EXCEPTION_INT_DIVIDE_BY_ZERO), "Divide by zero error"},
11198 };
11199
11200 struct FatalConditionHandler
11201 {
11202 static LONG CALLBACK handleException(PEXCEPTION_POINTERS ExceptionInfo) {
11203 // Multiple threads may enter this filter/handler at once. We want the error message to be printed on the
11204 // console just once no matter how many threads have crashed.
11205 DOCTEST_DECLARE_STATIC_MUTEX(mutex)
11206 static bool execute = true;
11207 {
11208 DOCTEST_LOCK_MUTEX(mutex)
11209 if(execute) {
11210 bool reported = false;
11211 for(size_t i = 0; i < DOCTEST_COUNTOF(signalDefs); ++i) {
11212 if(ExceptionInfo->ExceptionRecord->ExceptionCode == signalDefs[i].id) {
11213 reportFatal(signalDefs[i].name);
11214 reported = true;
11215 break;
11216 }
11217 }
11218 if(reported == false)
11219 reportFatal("Unhandled SEH exception caught");
11220 if(isDebuggerActive() && !g_cs->no_breaks)
11221 DOCTEST_BREAK_INTO_DEBUGGER();
11222 }
11223 execute = false;
11224 }
11225 std::exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
11226 }
11227
11228 static void allocateAltStackMem() {}
11229 static void freeAltStackMem() {}
11230
11231 FatalConditionHandler() {
11232 isSet = true;
11233 // 32k seems enough for doctest to handle stack overflow,
11234 // but the value was found experimentally, so there is no strong guarantee
11235 guaranteeSize = 32 * 1024;
11236 // Register an unhandled exception filter
11237 previousTop = SetUnhandledExceptionFilter(handleException);
11238 // Pass in guarantee size to be filled
11239 SetThreadStackGuarantee(&guaranteeSize);
11240
11241 // On Windows uncaught exceptions from another thread, exceptions from
11242 // destructors, or calls to std::terminate are not a SEH exception
11243
11244 // The terminal handler gets called when:
11245 // - std::terminate is called FROM THE TEST RUNNER THREAD
11246 // - an exception is thrown from a destructor FROM THE TEST RUNNER THREAD
11247 original_terminate_handler = std::get_terminate();
11248 std::set_terminate([]() DOCTEST_NOEXCEPT {
11249 reportFatal("Terminate handler called");
11250 if(isDebuggerActive() && !g_cs->no_breaks)
11251 DOCTEST_BREAK_INTO_DEBUGGER();
11252 std::exit(EXIT_FAILURE); // explicitly exit - otherwise the SIGABRT handler may be called as well
11253 });
11254
11255 // SIGABRT is raised when:
11256 // - std::terminate is called FROM A DIFFERENT THREAD
11257 // - an exception is thrown from a destructor FROM A DIFFERENT THREAD
11258 // - an uncaught exception is thrown FROM A DIFFERENT THREAD
11259 prev_sigabrt_handler = std::signal(SIGABRT, [](int signal) DOCTEST_NOEXCEPT {
11260 if(signal == SIGABRT) {
11261 reportFatal("SIGABRT - Abort (abnormal termination) signal");
11262 if(isDebuggerActive() && !g_cs->no_breaks)
11263 DOCTEST_BREAK_INTO_DEBUGGER();
11264 std::exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
11265 }
11266 });
11267
11268 // The following settings are taken from google test, and more
11269 // specifically from UnitTest::Run() inside of gtest.cc
11270
11271 // the user does not want to see pop-up dialogs about crashes
11272 prev_error_mode_1 = SetErrorMode(SEM_FAILCRITICALERRORS | SEM_NOALIGNMENTFAULTEXCEPT |
11273 SEM_NOGPFAULTERRORBOX | SEM_NOOPENFILEERRORBOX);
11274 // This forces the abort message to go to stderr in all circumstances.
11275 prev_error_mode_2 = _set_error_mode(_OUT_TO_STDERR);
11276 // In the debug version, Visual Studio pops up a separate dialog
11277 // offering a choice to debug the aborted program - we want to disable that.
11278 prev_abort_behavior = _set_abort_behavior(0x0, _WRITE_ABORT_MSG | _CALL_REPORTFAULT);
11279 // In debug mode, the Windows CRT can crash with an assertion over invalid
11280 // input (e.g. passing an invalid file descriptor). The default handling
11281 // for these assertions is to pop up a dialog and wait for user input.
11282 // Instead ask the CRT to dump such assertions to stderr non-interactively.
11283 prev_report_mode = _CrtSetReportMode(_CRT_ASSERT, _CRTDBG_MODE_FILE | _CRTDBG_MODE_DEBUG);
11284 prev_report_file = _CrtSetReportFile(_CRT_ASSERT, _CRTDBG_FILE_STDERR);
11285 }
11286
11287 static void reset() {
11288 if(isSet) {
11289 // Unregister handler and restore the old guarantee
11290 SetUnhandledExceptionFilter(previousTop);
11291 SetThreadStackGuarantee(&guaranteeSize);
11292 std::set_terminate(original_terminate_handler);
11293 std::signal(SIGABRT, prev_sigabrt_handler);
11294 SetErrorMode(prev_error_mode_1);
11295 _set_error_mode(prev_error_mode_2);
11296 _set_abort_behavior(prev_abort_behavior, _WRITE_ABORT_MSG | _CALL_REPORTFAULT);
11297 static_cast<void>(_CrtSetReportMode(_CRT_ASSERT, prev_report_mode));
11298 static_cast<void>(_CrtSetReportFile(_CRT_ASSERT, prev_report_file));
11299 isSet = false;
11300 }
11301 }
11302
11303 ~FatalConditionHandler() { reset(); }
11304
11305 private:
11306 static UINT prev_error_mode_1;
11307 static int prev_error_mode_2;
11308 static unsigned int prev_abort_behavior;
11309 static int prev_report_mode;
11310 static _HFILE prev_report_file;
11311 static void (DOCTEST_CDECL *prev_sigabrt_handler)(int);
11312 static std::terminate_handler original_terminate_handler;
11313 static bool isSet;
11314 static ULONG guaranteeSize;
11315 static LPTOP_LEVEL_EXCEPTION_FILTER previousTop;
11316 };
11317
11318 UINT FatalConditionHandler::prev_error_mode_1;
11319 int FatalConditionHandler::prev_error_mode_2;
11320 unsigned int FatalConditionHandler::prev_abort_behavior;
11321 int FatalConditionHandler::prev_report_mode;
11322 _HFILE FatalConditionHandler::prev_report_file;
11323 void (DOCTEST_CDECL *FatalConditionHandler::prev_sigabrt_handler)(int);
11324 std::terminate_handler FatalConditionHandler::original_terminate_handler;
11325 bool FatalConditionHandler::isSet = false;
11326 ULONG FatalConditionHandler::guaranteeSize = 0;
11327 LPTOP_LEVEL_EXCEPTION_FILTER FatalConditionHandler::previousTop = nullptr;
11328
11329#else // DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
11330
11331 struct SignalDefs
11332 {
11333 int id;
11334 const char* name;
11335 };
11336 SignalDefs signalDefs[] = {{SIGINT, "SIGINT - Terminal interrupt signal"},
11337 {SIGILL, "SIGILL - Illegal instruction signal"},
11338 {SIGFPE, "SIGFPE - Floating point error signal"},
11339 {SIGSEGV, "SIGSEGV - Segmentation violation signal"},
11340 {SIGTERM, "SIGTERM - Termination request signal"},
11341 {SIGABRT, "SIGABRT - Abort (abnormal termination) signal"}};
11342
11343 struct FatalConditionHandler
11344 {
11345 static bool isSet;
11346 static struct sigaction oldSigActions[DOCTEST_COUNTOF(signalDefs)];
11347 static stack_t oldSigStack;
11348 static size_t altStackSize;
11349 static char* altStackMem;
11350
11351 static void handleSignal(int sig) {
11352 const char* name = "<unknown signal>";
11353 for(std::size_t i = 0; i < DOCTEST_COUNTOF(signalDefs); ++i) {
11354 SignalDefs& def = signalDefs[i];
11355 if(sig == def.id) {
11356 name = def.name;
11357 break;
11358 }
11359 }
11360 reset();
11361 reportFatal(name);
11362 raise(sig);
11363 }
11364
11365 static void allocateAltStackMem() {
11366 altStackMem = new char[altStackSize];
11367 }
11368
11369 static void freeAltStackMem() {
11370 delete[] altStackMem;
11371 }
11372
11373 FatalConditionHandler() {
11374 isSet = true;
11375 stack_t sigStack;
11376 sigStack.ss_sp = altStackMem;
11377 sigStack.ss_size = altStackSize;
11378 sigStack.ss_flags = 0;
11379 sigaltstack(&sigStack, &oldSigStack);
11380 struct sigaction sa = {};
11381 sa.sa_handler = handleSignal;
11382 sa.sa_flags = SA_ONSTACK;
11383 for(std::size_t i = 0; i < DOCTEST_COUNTOF(signalDefs); ++i) {
11384 sigaction(signalDefs[i].id, &sa, &oldSigActions[i]);
11385 }
11386 }
11387
11388 ~FatalConditionHandler() { reset(); }
11389 static void reset() {
11390 if(isSet) {
11391 // Set signals back to previous values -- hopefully nobody overwrote them in the meantime
11392 for(std::size_t i = 0; i < DOCTEST_COUNTOF(signalDefs); ++i) {
11393 sigaction(signalDefs[i].id, &oldSigActions[i], nullptr);
11394 }
11395 // Return the old stack
11396 sigaltstack(&oldSigStack, nullptr);
11397 isSet = false;
11398 }
11399 }
11400 };
11401
11402 bool FatalConditionHandler::isSet = false;
11403 struct sigaction FatalConditionHandler::oldSigActions[DOCTEST_COUNTOF(signalDefs)] = {};
11404 stack_t FatalConditionHandler::oldSigStack = {};
11405 size_t FatalConditionHandler::altStackSize = 4 * SIGSTKSZ;
11406 char* FatalConditionHandler::altStackMem = nullptr;
11407
11408#endif // DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
11409#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_POSIX_SIGNALS || DOCTEST_CONFIG_WINDOWS_SEH
11410
11411} // namespace
11412
11413namespace {
11414 using namespace detail;
11415
11416#ifdef DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
11417#define DOCTEST_OUTPUT_DEBUG_STRING(text) ::OutputDebugStringA(text)
11418#else
11419 // TODO: integration with XCode and other IDEs
11420#define DOCTEST_OUTPUT_DEBUG_STRING(text)
11421#endif // Platform
11422
11423 void addAssert(assertType::Enum at) {
11424 if((at & assertType::is_warn) == 0)
11425 g_cs->numAssertsCurrentTest_atomic++;
11426 }
11427
11428 void addFailedAssert(assertType::Enum at) {
11429 if((at & assertType::is_warn) == 0)
11430 g_cs->numAssertsFailedCurrentTest_atomic++;
11431 }
11432
11433#if defined(DOCTEST_CONFIG_POSIX_SIGNALS) || defined(DOCTEST_CONFIG_WINDOWS_SEH)
11434 void reportFatal(const std::string& message) {
11435 g_cs->failure_flags |= TestCaseFailureReason::Crash;
11436
11437 DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(test_case_exception, {message.c_str(), true});
11438
11439 while (g_cs->subcaseStack.size()) {
11440 g_cs->subcaseStack.pop_back();
11441 DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(subcase_end, DOCTEST_EMPTY);
11442 }
11443
11444 g_cs->finalizeTestCaseData();
11445
11446 DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(test_case_end, *g_cs);
11447
11448 DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(test_run_end, *g_cs);
11449 }
11450#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_POSIX_SIGNALS || DOCTEST_CONFIG_WINDOWS_SEH
11451} // namespace
11452
11453AssertData::AssertData(assertType::Enum at, const char* file, int line, const char* expr,
11454 const char* exception_type, const StringContains& exception_string)
11455 : m_test_case(g_cs->currentTest), m_at(at), m_file(file), m_line(line), m_expr(expr),
11456 m_failed(true), m_threw(false), m_threw_as(false), m_exception_type(exception_type),
11457 m_exception_string(exception_string) {
11458#if DOCTEST_MSVC
11459 if (m_expr[0] == ' ') // this happens when variadic macros are disabled under MSVC
11460 ++m_expr;
11461#endif // MSVC
11462}
11463
11464namespace detail {
11465 ResultBuilder::ResultBuilder(assertType::Enum at, const char* file, int line, const char* expr,
11466 const char* exception_type, const String& exception_string)
11467 : AssertData(at, file, line, expr, exception_type, exception_string) { }
11468
11469 ResultBuilder::ResultBuilder(assertType::Enum at, const char* file, int line, const char* expr,
11470 const char* exception_type, const Contains& exception_string)
11471 : AssertData(at, file, line, expr, exception_type, exception_string) { }
11472
11473 void ResultBuilder::setResult(const Result& res) {
11474 m_decomp = res.m_decomp;
11475 m_failed = !res.m_passed;
11476 }
11477
11478 void ResultBuilder::translateException() {
11479 m_threw = true;
11480 m_exception = translateActiveException();
11481 }
11482
11483 bool ResultBuilder::log() {
11484 if(m_at & assertType::is_throws) {
11485 m_failed = !m_threw;
11486 } else if((m_at & assertType::is_throws_as) && (m_at & assertType::is_throws_with)) {
11487 m_failed = !m_threw_as || !m_exception_string.check(m_exception);
11488 } else if(m_at & assertType::is_throws_as) {
11489 m_failed = !m_threw_as;
11490 } else if(m_at & assertType::is_throws_with) {
11491 m_failed = !m_exception_string.check(m_exception);
11492 } else if(m_at & assertType::is_nothrow) {
11493 m_failed = m_threw;
11494 }
11495
11496 if(m_exception.size())
11497 m_exception = "\"" + m_exception + "\"";
11498
11499 if(is_running_in_test) {
11500 addAssert(m_at);
11501 DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(log_assert, *this);
11502
11503 if(m_failed)
11504 addFailedAssert(m_at);
11505 } else if(m_failed) {
11506 failed_out_of_a_testing_context(*this);
11507 }
11508
11509 return m_failed && isDebuggerActive() && !getContextOptions()->no_breaks &&
11510 (g_cs->currentTest == nullptr || !g_cs->currentTest->m_no_breaks); // break into debugger
11511 }
11512
11513 void ResultBuilder::react() const {
11514 if(m_failed && checkIfShouldThrow(m_at))
11515 throwException();
11516 }
11517
11518 void failed_out_of_a_testing_context(const AssertData& ad) {
11519 if(g_cs->ah)
11520 g_cs->ah(ad);
11521 else
11522 std::abort();
11523 }
11524
11525 bool decomp_assert(assertType::Enum at, const char* file, int line, const char* expr,
11526 const Result& result) {
11527 bool failed = !result.m_passed;
11528
11529 // ###################################################################################
11530 // IF THE DEBUGGER BREAKS HERE - GO 1 LEVEL UP IN THE CALLSTACK FOR THE FAILING ASSERT
11531 // THIS IS THE EFFECT OF HAVING 'DOCTEST_CONFIG_SUPER_FAST_ASSERTS' DEFINED
11532 // ###################################################################################
11533 DOCTEST_ASSERT_OUT_OF_TESTS(result.m_decomp);
11534 DOCTEST_ASSERT_IN_TESTS(result.m_decomp);
11535 return !failed;
11536 }
11537
11538 MessageBuilder::MessageBuilder(const char* file, int line, assertType::Enum severity) {
11539 m_stream = tlssPush();
11540 m_file = file;
11541 m_line = line;
11542 m_severity = severity;
11543 }
11544
11545 MessageBuilder::~MessageBuilder() {
11546 if (!logged)
11547 tlssPop();
11548 }
11549
11550 DOCTEST_DEFINE_INTERFACE(IExceptionTranslator)
11551
11552 bool MessageBuilder::log() {
11553 if (!logged) {
11554 m_string = tlssPop();
11555 logged = true;
11556 }
11557
11558 DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(log_message, *this);
11559
11560 const bool isWarn = m_severity & assertType::is_warn;
11561
11562 // warn is just a message in this context so we don't treat it as an assert
11563 if(!isWarn) {
11564 addAssert(m_severity);
11565 addFailedAssert(m_severity);
11566 }
11567
11568 return isDebuggerActive() && !getContextOptions()->no_breaks && !isWarn &&
11569 (g_cs->currentTest == nullptr || !g_cs->currentTest->m_no_breaks); // break into debugger
11570 }
11571
11572 void MessageBuilder::react() {
11573 if(m_severity & assertType::is_require)
11574 throwException();
11575 }
11576} // namespace detail
11577namespace {
11578 using namespace detail;
11579
11580 // clang-format off
11581
11582// =================================================================================================
11583// The following code has been taken verbatim from Catch2/include/internal/catch_xmlwriter.h/cpp
11584// This is done so cherry-picking bug fixes is trivial - even the style/formatting is untouched.
11585// =================================================================================================
11586
11587 class XmlEncode {
11588 public:
11589 enum ForWhat { ForTextNodes, ForAttributes };
11590
11591 XmlEncode( std::string const& str, ForWhat forWhat = ForTextNodes );
11592
11593 void encodeTo( std::ostream& os ) const;
11594
11595 friend std::ostream& operator << ( std::ostream& os, XmlEncode const& xmlEncode );
11596
11597 private:
11598 std::string m_str;
11599 ForWhat m_forWhat;
11600 };
11601
11602 class XmlWriter {
11603 public:
11604
11605 class ScopedElement {
11606 public:
11607 ScopedElement( XmlWriter* writer );
11608
11609 ScopedElement( ScopedElement&& other ) DOCTEST_NOEXCEPT;
11610 ScopedElement& operator=( ScopedElement&& other ) DOCTEST_NOEXCEPT;
11611
11612 ~ScopedElement();
11613
11614 ScopedElement& writeText( std::string const& text, bool indent = true );
11615
11616 template<typename T>
11617 ScopedElement& writeAttribute( std::string const& name, T const& attribute ) {
11618 m_writer->writeAttribute( name, attribute );
11619 return *this;
11620 }
11621
11622 private:
11623 mutable XmlWriter* m_writer = nullptr;
11624 };
11625
11626 XmlWriter( std::ostream& os = std::cout );
11627 ~XmlWriter();
11628
11629 XmlWriter( XmlWriter const& ) = delete;
11630 XmlWriter& operator=( XmlWriter const& ) = delete;
11631
11632 XmlWriter& startElement( std::string const& name );
11633
11634 ScopedElement scopedElement( std::string const& name );
11635
11636 XmlWriter& endElement();
11637
11638 XmlWriter& writeAttribute( std::string const& name, std::string const& attribute );
11639
11640 XmlWriter& writeAttribute( std::string const& name, const char* attribute );
11641
11642 XmlWriter& writeAttribute( std::string const& name, bool attribute );
11643
11644 template<typename T>
11645 XmlWriter& writeAttribute( std::string const& name, T const& attribute ) {
11646 std::stringstream rss;
11647 rss << attribute;
11648 return writeAttribute( name, rss.str() );
11649 }
11650
11651 XmlWriter& writeText( std::string const& text, bool indent = true );
11652
11653 //XmlWriter& writeComment( std::string const& text );
11654
11655 //void writeStylesheetRef( std::string const& url );
11656
11657 //XmlWriter& writeBlankLine();
11658
11659 void ensureTagClosed();
11660
11661 void writeDeclaration();
11662
11663 private:
11664
11665 void newlineIfNecessary();
11666
11667 bool m_tagIsOpen = false;
11668 bool m_needsNewline = false;
11669 std::vector<std::string> m_tags;
11670 std::string m_indent;
11671 std::ostream& m_os;
11672 };
11673
11674// =================================================================================================
11675// The following code has been taken verbatim from Catch2/include/internal/catch_xmlwriter.h/cpp
11676// This is done so cherry-picking bug fixes is trivial - even the style/formatting is untouched.
11677// =================================================================================================
11678
11679using uchar = unsigned char;
11680
11681namespace {
11682
11683 size_t trailingBytes(unsigned char c) {
11684 if ((c & 0xE0) == 0xC0) {
11685 return 2;
11686 }
11687 if ((c & 0xF0) == 0xE0) {
11688 return 3;
11689 }
11690 if ((c & 0xF8) == 0xF0) {
11691 return 4;
11692 }
11693 DOCTEST_INTERNAL_ERROR("Invalid multibyte utf-8 start byte encountered");
11694 }
11695
11696 uint32_t headerValue(unsigned char c) {
11697 if ((c & 0xE0) == 0xC0) {
11698 return c & 0x1F;
11699 }
11700 if ((c & 0xF0) == 0xE0) {
11701 return c & 0x0F;
11702 }
11703 if ((c & 0xF8) == 0xF0) {
11704 return c & 0x07;
11705 }
11706 DOCTEST_INTERNAL_ERROR("Invalid multibyte utf-8 start byte encountered");
11707 }
11708
11709 void hexEscapeChar(std::ostream& os, unsigned char c) {
11710 std::ios_base::fmtflags f(os.flags());
11711 os << "\\x"
11712 << std::uppercase << std::hex << std::setfill('0') << std::setw(2)
11713 << static_cast<int>(c);
11714 os.flags(f);
11715 }
11716
11717} // anonymous namespace
11718
11719 XmlEncode::XmlEncode( std::string const& str, ForWhat forWhat )
11720 : m_str( str ),
11721 m_forWhat( forWhat )
11722 {}
11723
11724 void XmlEncode::encodeTo( std::ostream& os ) const {
11725 // Apostrophe escaping not necessary if we always use " to write attributes
11726 // (see: https://www.w3.org/TR/xml/#syntax)
11727
11728 for( std::size_t idx = 0; idx < m_str.size(); ++ idx ) {
11729 uchar c = m_str[idx];
11730 switch (c) {
11731 case '<': os << "&lt;"; break;
11732 case '&': os << "&amp;"; break;
11733
11734 case '>':
11735 // See: https://www.w3.org/TR/xml/#syntax
11736 if (idx > 2 && m_str[idx - 1] == ']' && m_str[idx - 2] == ']')
11737 os << "&gt;";
11738 else
11739 os << c;
11740 break;
11741
11742 case '\"':
11743 if (m_forWhat == ForAttributes)
11744 os << "&quot;";
11745 else
11746 os << c;
11747 break;
11748
11749 default:
11750 // Check for control characters and invalid utf-8
11751
11752 // Escape control characters in standard ascii
11753 // see https://stackoverflow.com/questions/404107/why-are-control-characters-illegal-in-xml-1-0
11754 if (c < 0x09 || (c > 0x0D && c < 0x20) || c == 0x7F) {
11755 hexEscapeChar(os, c);
11756 break;
11757 }
11758
11759 // Plain ASCII: Write it to stream
11760 if (c < 0x7F) {
11761 os << c;
11762 break;
11763 }
11764
11765 // UTF-8 territory
11766 // Check if the encoding is valid and if it is not, hex escape bytes.
11767 // Important: We do not check the exact decoded values for validity, only the encoding format
11768 // First check that this bytes is a valid lead byte:
11769 // This means that it is not encoded as 1111 1XXX
11770 // Or as 10XX XXXX
11771 if (c < 0xC0 ||
11772 c >= 0xF8) {
11773 hexEscapeChar(os, c);
11774 break;
11775 }
11776
11777 auto encBytes = trailingBytes(c);
11778 // Are there enough bytes left to avoid accessing out-of-bounds memory?
11779 if (idx + encBytes - 1 >= m_str.size()) {
11780 hexEscapeChar(os, c);
11781 break;
11782 }
11783 // The header is valid, check data
11784 // The next encBytes bytes must together be a valid utf-8
11785 // This means: bitpattern 10XX XXXX and the extracted value is sane (ish)
11786 bool valid = true;
11787 uint32_t value = headerValue(c);
11788 for (std::size_t n = 1; n < encBytes; ++n) {
11789 uchar nc = m_str[idx + n];
11790 valid &= ((nc & 0xC0) == 0x80);
11791 value = (value << 6) | (nc & 0x3F);
11792 }
11793
11794 if (
11795 // Wrong bit pattern of following bytes
11796 (!valid) ||
11797 // Overlong encodings
11798 (value < 0x80) ||
11799 ( value < 0x800 && encBytes > 2) || // removed "0x80 <= value &&" because redundant
11800 (0x800 < value && value < 0x10000 && encBytes > 3) ||
11801 // Encoded value out of range
11802 (value >= 0x110000)
11803 ) {
11804 hexEscapeChar(os, c);
11805 break;
11806 }
11807
11808 // If we got here, this is in fact a valid(ish) utf-8 sequence
11809 for (std::size_t n = 0; n < encBytes; ++n) {
11810 os << m_str[idx + n];
11811 }
11812 idx += encBytes - 1;
11813 break;
11814 }
11815 }
11816 }
11817
11818 std::ostream& operator << ( std::ostream& os, XmlEncode const& xmlEncode ) {
11819 xmlEncode.encodeTo( os );
11820 return os;
11821 }
11822
11823 XmlWriter::ScopedElement::ScopedElement( XmlWriter* writer )
11824 : m_writer( writer )
11825 {}
11826
11827 XmlWriter::ScopedElement::ScopedElement( ScopedElement&& other ) DOCTEST_NOEXCEPT
11828 : m_writer( other.m_writer ){
11829 other.m_writer = nullptr;
11830 }
11831 XmlWriter::ScopedElement& XmlWriter::ScopedElement::operator=( ScopedElement&& other ) DOCTEST_NOEXCEPT {
11832 if ( m_writer ) {
11833 m_writer->endElement();
11834 }
11835 m_writer = other.m_writer;
11836 other.m_writer = nullptr;
11837 return *this;
11838 }
11839
11840
11841 XmlWriter::ScopedElement::~ScopedElement() {
11842 if( m_writer )
11843 m_writer->endElement();
11844 }
11845
11846 XmlWriter::ScopedElement& XmlWriter::ScopedElement::writeText( std::string const& text, bool indent ) {
11847 m_writer->writeText( text, indent );
11848 return *this;
11849 }
11850
11851 XmlWriter::XmlWriter( std::ostream& os ) : m_os( os )
11852 {
11853 // writeDeclaration(); // called explicitly by the reporters that use the writer class - see issue #627
11854 }
11855
11856 XmlWriter::~XmlWriter() {
11857 while( !m_tags.empty() )
11858 endElement();
11859 }
11860
11861 XmlWriter& XmlWriter::startElement( std::string const& name ) {
11862 ensureTagClosed();
11863 newlineIfNecessary();
11864 m_os << m_indent << '<' << name;
11865 m_tags.push_back( name );
11866 m_indent += " ";
11867 m_tagIsOpen = true;
11868 return *this;
11869 }
11870
11871 XmlWriter::ScopedElement XmlWriter::scopedElement( std::string const& name ) {
11872 ScopedElement scoped( this );
11873 startElement( name );
11874 return scoped;
11875 }
11876
11877 XmlWriter& XmlWriter::endElement() {
11878 newlineIfNecessary();
11879 m_indent = m_indent.substr( 0, m_indent.size()-2 );
11880 if( m_tagIsOpen ) {
11881 m_os << "/>";
11882 m_tagIsOpen = false;
11883 }
11884 else {
11885 m_os << m_indent << "</" << m_tags.back() << ">";
11886 }
11887 m_os << std::endl;
11888 m_tags.pop_back();
11889 return *this;
11890 }
11891
11892 XmlWriter& XmlWriter::writeAttribute( std::string const& name, std::string const& attribute ) {
11893 if( !name.empty() && !attribute.empty() )
11894 m_os << ' ' << name << "=\"" << XmlEncode( attribute, XmlEncode::ForAttributes ) << '"';
11895 return *this;
11896 }
11897
11898 XmlWriter& XmlWriter::writeAttribute( std::string const& name, const char* attribute ) {
11899 if( !name.empty() && attribute && attribute[0] != '\0' )
11900 m_os << ' ' << name << "=\"" << XmlEncode( attribute, XmlEncode::ForAttributes ) << '"';
11901 return *this;
11902 }
11903
11904 XmlWriter& XmlWriter::writeAttribute( std::string const& name, bool attribute ) {
11905 m_os << ' ' << name << "=\"" << ( attribute ? "true" : "false" ) << '"';
11906 return *this;
11907 }
11908
11909 XmlWriter& XmlWriter::writeText( std::string const& text, bool indent ) {
11910 if( !text.empty() ){
11911 bool tagWasOpen = m_tagIsOpen;
11912 ensureTagClosed();
11913 if( tagWasOpen && indent )
11914 m_os << m_indent;
11915 m_os << XmlEncode( text );
11916 m_needsNewline = true;
11917 }
11918 return *this;
11919 }
11920
11921 //XmlWriter& XmlWriter::writeComment( std::string const& text ) {
11922 // ensureTagClosed();
11923 // m_os << m_indent << "<!--" << text << "-->";
11924 // m_needsNewline = true;
11925 // return *this;
11926 //}
11927
11928 //void XmlWriter::writeStylesheetRef( std::string const& url ) {
11929 // m_os << "<?xml-stylesheet type=\"text/xsl\" href=\"" << url << "\"?>\n";
11930 //}
11931
11932 //XmlWriter& XmlWriter::writeBlankLine() {
11933 // ensureTagClosed();
11934 // m_os << '\n';
11935 // return *this;
11936 //}
11937
11938 void XmlWriter::ensureTagClosed() {
11939 if( m_tagIsOpen ) {
11940 m_os << ">" << std::endl;
11941 m_tagIsOpen = false;
11942 }
11943 }
11944
11945 void XmlWriter::writeDeclaration() {
11946 m_os << "<?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"UTF-8\"?>\n";
11947 }
11948
11949 void XmlWriter::newlineIfNecessary() {
11950 if( m_needsNewline ) {
11951 m_os << std::endl;
11952 m_needsNewline = false;
11953 }
11954 }
11955
11956// =================================================================================================
11957// End of copy-pasted code from Catch
11958// =================================================================================================
11959
11960 // clang-format on
11961
11962 struct XmlReporter : public IReporter
11963 {
11964 XmlWriter xml;
11965 DOCTEST_DECLARE_MUTEX(mutex)
11966
11967 // caching pointers/references to objects of these types - safe to do
11968 const ContextOptions& opt;
11969 const TestCaseData* tc = nullptr;
11970
11971 XmlReporter(const ContextOptions& co)
11972 : xml(*co.cout)
11973 , opt(co) {}
11974
11975 void log_contexts() {
11976 int num_contexts = get_num_active_contexts();
11977 if(num_contexts) {
11978 auto contexts = get_active_contexts();
11979 std::stringstream ss;
11980 for(int i = 0; i < num_contexts; ++i) {
11981 contexts[i]->stringify(&ss);
11982 xml.scopedElement("Info").writeText(ss.str());
11983 ss.str("");
11984 }
11985 }
11986 }
11987
11988 unsigned line(unsigned l) const { return opt.no_line_numbers ? 0 : l; }
11989
11990 void test_case_start_impl(const TestCaseData& in) {
11991 bool open_ts_tag = false;
11992 if(tc != nullptr) { // we have already opened a test suite
11993 if(std::strcmp(tc->m_test_suite, in.m_test_suite) != 0) {
11994 xml.endElement();
11995 open_ts_tag = true;
11996 }
11997 }
11998 else {
11999 open_ts_tag = true; // first test case ==> first test suite
12000 }
12001
12002 if(open_ts_tag) {
12003 xml.startElement("TestSuite");
12004 xml.writeAttribute("name", in.m_test_suite);
12005 }
12006
12007 tc = &in;
12008 xml.startElement("TestCase")
12009 .writeAttribute("name", in.m_name)
12010 .writeAttribute("filename", skipPathFromFilename(in.m_file.c_str()))
12011 .writeAttribute("line", line(in.m_line))
12012 .writeAttribute("description", in.m_description);
12013
12014 if(Approx(in.m_timeout) != 0)
12015 xml.writeAttribute("timeout", in.m_timeout);
12016 if(in.m_may_fail)
12017 xml.writeAttribute("may_fail", true);
12018 if(in.m_should_fail)
12019 xml.writeAttribute("should_fail", true);
12020 }
12021
12022 // =========================================================================================
12023 // WHAT FOLLOWS ARE OVERRIDES OF THE VIRTUAL METHODS OF THE REPORTER INTERFACE
12024 // =========================================================================================
12025
12026 void report_query(const QueryData& in) override {
12027 test_run_start();
12028 if(opt.list_reporters) {
12029 for(auto& curr : getListeners())
12030 xml.scopedElement("Listener")
12031 .writeAttribute("priority", curr.first.first)
12032 .writeAttribute("name", curr.first.second);
12033 for(auto& curr : getReporters())
12034 xml.scopedElement("Reporter")
12035 .writeAttribute("priority", curr.first.first)
12036 .writeAttribute("name", curr.first.second);
12037 } else if(opt.count || opt.list_test_cases) {
12038 for(unsigned i = 0; i < in.num_data; ++i) {
12039 xml.scopedElement("TestCase").writeAttribute("name", in.data[i]->m_name)
12040 .writeAttribute("testsuite", in.data[i]->m_test_suite)
12041 .writeAttribute("filename", skipPathFromFilename(in.data[i]->m_file.c_str()))
12042 .writeAttribute("line", line(in.data[i]->m_line))
12043 .writeAttribute("skipped", in.data[i]->m_skip);
12044 }
12045 xml.scopedElement("OverallResultsTestCases")
12046 .writeAttribute("unskipped", in.run_stats->numTestCasesPassingFilters);
12047 } else if(opt.list_test_suites) {
12048 for(unsigned i = 0; i < in.num_data; ++i)
12049 xml.scopedElement("TestSuite").writeAttribute("name", in.data[i]->m_test_suite);
12050 xml.scopedElement("OverallResultsTestCases")
12051 .writeAttribute("unskipped", in.run_stats->numTestCasesPassingFilters);
12052 xml.scopedElement("OverallResultsTestSuites")
12053 .writeAttribute("unskipped", in.run_stats->numTestSuitesPassingFilters);
12054 }
12055 xml.endElement();
12056 }
12057
12058 void test_run_start() override {
12059 xml.writeDeclaration();
12060
12061 // remove .exe extension - mainly to have the same output on UNIX and Windows
12062 std::string binary_name = skipPathFromFilename(opt.binary_name.c_str());
12063#ifdef DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
12064 if(binary_name.rfind(".exe") != std::string::npos)
