12065 binary_name = binary_name.substr(0, binary_name.length() - 4);
12066#endif // DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
12067
12068 xml.startElement("doctest").writeAttribute("binary", binary_name);
12069 if(opt.no_version == false)
12070 xml.writeAttribute("version", DOCTEST_VERSION_STR);
12071
12072 // only the consequential ones (TODO: filters)
12073 xml.scopedElement("Options")
12074 .writeAttribute("order_by", opt.order_by.c_str())
12075 .writeAttribute("rand_seed", opt.rand_seed)
12076 .writeAttribute("first", opt.first)
12077 .writeAttribute("last", opt.last)
12078 .writeAttribute("abort_after", opt.abort_after)
12079 .writeAttribute("subcase_filter_levels", opt.subcase_filter_levels)
12080 .writeAttribute("case_sensitive", opt.case_sensitive)
12081 .writeAttribute("no_throw", opt.no_throw)
12082 .writeAttribute("no_skip", opt.no_skip);
12083 }
12084
12085 void test_run_end(const TestRunStats& p) override {
12086 if(tc) // the TestSuite tag - only if there has been at least 1 test case
12087 xml.endElement();
12088
12089 xml.scopedElement("OverallResultsAsserts")
12090 .writeAttribute("successes", p.numAsserts - p.numAssertsFailed)
12091 .writeAttribute("failures", p.numAssertsFailed);
12092
12093 xml.startElement("OverallResultsTestCases")
12094 .writeAttribute("successes",
12095 p.numTestCasesPassingFilters - p.numTestCasesFailed)
12096 .writeAttribute("failures", p.numTestCasesFailed);
12097 if(opt.no_skipped_summary == false)
12098 xml.writeAttribute("skipped", p.numTestCases - p.numTestCasesPassingFilters);
12099 xml.endElement();
12100
12101 xml.endElement();
12102 }
12103
12104 void test_case_start(const TestCaseData& in) override {
12105 test_case_start_impl(in);
12106 xml.ensureTagClosed();
12107 }
12108
12109 void test_case_reenter(const TestCaseData&) override {}
12110
12111 void test_case_end(const CurrentTestCaseStats& st) override {
12112 xml.startElement("OverallResultsAsserts")
12113 .writeAttribute("successes",
12114 st.numAssertsCurrentTest - st.numAssertsFailedCurrentTest)
12115 .writeAttribute("failures", st.numAssertsFailedCurrentTest)
12116 .writeAttribute("test_case_success", st.testCaseSuccess);
12117 if(opt.duration)
12118 xml.writeAttribute("duration", st.seconds);
12119 if(tc->m_expected_failures)
12120 xml.writeAttribute("expected_failures", tc->m_expected_failures);
12121 xml.endElement();
12122
12123 xml.endElement();
12124 }
12125
12126 void test_case_exception(const TestCaseException& e) override {
12127 DOCTEST_LOCK_MUTEX(mutex)
12128
12129 xml.scopedElement("Exception")
12130 .writeAttribute("crash", e.is_crash)
12131 .writeText(e.error_string.c_str());
12132 }
12133
12134 void subcase_start(const SubcaseSignature& in) override {
12135 xml.startElement("SubCase")
12136 .writeAttribute("name", in.m_name)
12137 .writeAttribute("filename", skipPathFromFilename(in.m_file))
12138 .writeAttribute("line", line(in.m_line));
12139 xml.ensureTagClosed();
12140 }
12141
12142 void subcase_end() override { xml.endElement(); }
12143
12144 void log_assert(const AssertData& rb) override {
12145 if(!rb.m_failed && !opt.success)
12146 return;
12147
12148 DOCTEST_LOCK_MUTEX(mutex)
12149
12150 xml.startElement("Expression")
12151 .writeAttribute("success", !rb.m_failed)
12152 .writeAttribute("type", assertString(rb.m_at))
12153 .writeAttribute("filename", skipPathFromFilename(rb.m_file))
12154 .writeAttribute("line", line(rb.m_line));
12155
12156 xml.scopedElement("Original").writeText(rb.m_expr);
12157
12158 if(rb.m_threw)
12159 xml.scopedElement("Exception").writeText(rb.m_exception.c_str());
12160
12161 if(rb.m_at & assertType::is_throws_as)
12162 xml.scopedElement("ExpectedException").writeText(rb.m_exception_type);
12163 if(rb.m_at & assertType::is_throws_with)
12164 xml.scopedElement("ExpectedExceptionString").writeText(rb.m_exception_string.c_str());
12165 if((rb.m_at & assertType::is_normal) && !rb.m_threw)
12166 xml.scopedElement("Expanded").writeText(rb.m_decomp.c_str());
12167
12168 log_contexts();
12169
12170 xml.endElement();
12171 }
12172
12173 void log_message(const MessageData& mb) override {
12174 DOCTEST_LOCK_MUTEX(mutex)
12175
12176 xml.startElement("Message")
12177 .writeAttribute("type", failureString(mb.m_severity))
12178 .writeAttribute("filename", skipPathFromFilename(mb.m_file))
12179 .writeAttribute("line", line(mb.m_line));
12180
12181 xml.scopedElement("Text").writeText(mb.m_string.c_str());
12182
12183 log_contexts();
12184
12185 xml.endElement();
12186 }
12187
12188 void test_case_skipped(const TestCaseData& in) override {
12189 if(opt.no_skipped_summary == false) {
12190 test_case_start_impl(in);
12191 xml.writeAttribute("skipped", "true");
12192 xml.endElement();
12193 }
12194 }
12195 };
12196
12197 DOCTEST_REGISTER_REPORTER("xml", 0, XmlReporter);
12198
12199 void fulltext_log_assert_to_stream(std::ostream& s, const AssertData& rb) {
12200 if((rb.m_at & (assertType::is_throws_as | assertType::is_throws_with)) ==
12201 0)
12202 s << Color::Cyan << assertString(rb.m_at) << "( " << rb.m_expr << " ) "
12203 << Color::None;
12204
12205 if(rb.m_at & assertType::is_throws) {
12206 s << (rb.m_threw ? "threw as expected!" : "did NOT throw at all!") << "\n";
12207 } else if((rb.m_at & assertType::is_throws_as) &&
12208 (rb.m_at & assertType::is_throws_with)) {
12209 s << Color::Cyan << assertString(rb.m_at) << "( " << rb.m_expr << ", \""
12210 << rb.m_exception_string.c_str()
12211 << "\", " << rb.m_exception_type << " ) " << Color::None;
12212 if(rb.m_threw) {
12213 if(!rb.m_failed) {
12214 s << "threw as expected!\n";
12215 } else {
12216 s << "threw a DIFFERENT exception! (contents: " << rb.m_exception << ")\n";
12217 }
12218 } else {
12219 s << "did NOT throw at all!\n";
12220 }
12221 } else if(rb.m_at &
12222 assertType::is_throws_as) {
12223 s << Color::Cyan << assertString(rb.m_at) << "( " << rb.m_expr << ", "
12224 << rb.m_exception_type << " ) " << Color::None
12225 << (rb.m_threw ? (rb.m_threw_as ? "threw as expected!" :
12226 "threw a DIFFERENT exception: ") :
12227 "did NOT throw at all!")
12228 << Color::Cyan << rb.m_exception << "\n";
12229 } else if(rb.m_at &
12230 assertType::is_throws_with) {
12231 s << Color::Cyan << assertString(rb.m_at) << "( " << rb.m_expr << ", \""
12232 << rb.m_exception_string.c_str()
12233 << "\" ) " << Color::None
12234 << (rb.m_threw ? (!rb.m_failed ? "threw as expected!" :
12235 "threw a DIFFERENT exception: ") :
12236 "did NOT throw at all!")
12237 << Color::Cyan << rb.m_exception << "\n";
12238 } else if(rb.m_at & assertType::is_nothrow) {
12239 s << (rb.m_threw ? "THREW exception: " : "didn't throw!") << Color::Cyan
12240 << rb.m_exception << "\n";
12241 } else {
12242 s << (rb.m_threw ? "THREW exception: " :
12243 (!rb.m_failed ? "is correct!\n" : "is NOT correct!\n"));
12244 if(rb.m_threw)
12245 s << rb.m_exception << "\n";
12246 else
12247 s << " values: " << assertString(rb.m_at) << "( " << rb.m_decomp << " )\n";
12248 }
12249 }
12250
12251 // TODO:
12252 // - log_message()
12253 // - respond to queries
12254 // - honor remaining options
12255 // - more attributes in tags
12256 struct JUnitReporter : public IReporter
12257 {
12258 XmlWriter xml;
12259 DOCTEST_DECLARE_MUTEX(mutex)
12260 Timer timer;
12261 std::vector<String> deepestSubcaseStackNames;
12262
12263 struct JUnitTestCaseData
12264 {
12265 static std::string getCurrentTimestamp() {
12266 // Beware, this is not reentrant because of backward compatibility issues
12267 // Also, UTC only, again because of backward compatibility (%z is C++11)
12268 time_t rawtime;
12269 std::time(&rawtime);
12270 auto const timeStampSize = sizeof("2017-01-16T17:06:45Z");
12271
12272 std::tm timeInfo;
12273#ifdef DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
12274 gmtime_s(&timeInfo, &rawtime);
12275#else // DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
12276 gmtime_r(&rawtime, &timeInfo);
12277#endif // DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
12278
12279 char timeStamp[timeStampSize];
12280 const char* const fmt = "%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ";
12281
12282 std::strftime(timeStamp, timeStampSize, fmt, &timeInfo);
12283 return std::string(timeStamp);
12284 }
12285
12286 struct JUnitTestMessage
12287 {
12288 JUnitTestMessage(const std::string& _message, const std::string& _type, const std::string& _details)
12289 : message(_message), type(_type), details(_details) {}
12290
12291 JUnitTestMessage(const std::string& _message, const std::string& _details)
12292 : message(_message), type(), details(_details) {}
12293
12294 std::string message, type, details;
12295 };
12296
12297 struct JUnitTestCase
12298 {
12299 JUnitTestCase(const std::string& _classname, const std::string& _name)
12300 : classname(_classname), name(_name), time(0), failures() {}
12301
12302 std::string classname, name;
12303 double time;
12304 std::vector<JUnitTestMessage> failures, errors;
12305 };
12306
12307 void add(const std::string& classname, const std::string& name) {
12308 testcases.emplace_back(classname, name);
12309 }
12310
12311 void appendSubcaseNamesToLastTestcase(std::vector<String> nameStack) {
12312 for(auto& curr: nameStack)
12313 if(curr.size())
12314 testcases.back().name += std::string("/") + curr.c_str();
12315 }
12316
12317 void addTime(double time) {
12318 if(time < 1e-4)
12319 time = 0;
12320 testcases.back().time = time;
12321 totalSeconds += time;
12322 }
12323
12324 void addFailure(const std::string& message, const std::string& type, const std::string& details) {
12325 testcases.back().failures.emplace_back(message, type, details);
12326 ++totalFailures;
12327 }
12328
12329 void addError(const std::string& message, const std::string& details) {
12330 testcases.back().errors.emplace_back(message, details);
12331 ++totalErrors;
12332 }
12333
12334 std::vector<JUnitTestCase> testcases;
12335 double totalSeconds = 0;
12336 int totalErrors = 0, totalFailures = 0;
12337 };
12338
12339 JUnitTestCaseData testCaseData;
12340
12341 // caching pointers/references to objects of these types - safe to do
12342 const ContextOptions& opt;
12343 const TestCaseData* tc = nullptr;
12344
12345 JUnitReporter(const ContextOptions& co)
12346 : xml(*co.cout)
12347 , opt(co) {}
12348
12349 unsigned line(unsigned l) const { return opt.no_line_numbers ? 0 : l; }
12350
12351 // =========================================================================================
12352 // WHAT FOLLOWS ARE OVERRIDES OF THE VIRTUAL METHODS OF THE REPORTER INTERFACE
12353 // =========================================================================================
12354
12355 void report_query(const QueryData&) override {
12356 xml.writeDeclaration();
12357 }
12358
12359 void test_run_start() override {
12360 xml.writeDeclaration();
12361 }
12362
12363 void test_run_end(const TestRunStats& p) override {
12364 // remove .exe extension - mainly to have the same output on UNIX and Windows
12365 std::string binary_name = skipPathFromFilename(opt.binary_name.c_str());
12366#ifdef DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
12367 if(binary_name.rfind(".exe") != std::string::npos)
12368 binary_name = binary_name.substr(0, binary_name.length() - 4);
12369#endif // DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
12370 xml.startElement("testsuites");
12371 xml.startElement("testsuite").writeAttribute("name", binary_name)
12372 .writeAttribute("errors", testCaseData.totalErrors)
12373 .writeAttribute("failures", testCaseData.totalFailures)
12374 .writeAttribute("tests", p.numAsserts);
12375 if(opt.no_time_in_output == false) {
12376 xml.writeAttribute("time", testCaseData.totalSeconds);
12377 xml.writeAttribute("timestamp", JUnitTestCaseData::getCurrentTimestamp());
12378 }
12379 if(opt.no_version == false)
12380 xml.writeAttribute("doctest_version", DOCTEST_VERSION_STR);
12381
12382 for(const auto& testCase : testCaseData.testcases) {
12383 xml.startElement("testcase")
12384 .writeAttribute("classname", testCase.classname)
12385 .writeAttribute("name", testCase.name);
12386 if(opt.no_time_in_output == false)
12387 xml.writeAttribute("time", testCase.time);
12388 // This is not ideal, but it should be enough to mimic gtest's junit output.
12389 xml.writeAttribute("status", "run");
12390
12391 for(const auto& failure : testCase.failures) {
12392 xml.scopedElement("failure")
12393 .writeAttribute("message", failure.message)
12394 .writeAttribute("type", failure.type)
12395 .writeText(failure.details, false);
12396 }
12397
12398 for(const auto& error : testCase.errors) {
12399 xml.scopedElement("error")
12400 .writeAttribute("message", error.message)
12401 .writeText(error.details);
12402 }
12403
12404 xml.endElement();
12405 }
12406 xml.endElement();
12407 xml.endElement();
12408 }
12409
12410 void test_case_start(const TestCaseData& in) override {
12411 testCaseData.add(skipPathFromFilename(in.m_file.c_str()), in.m_name);
12412 timer.start();
12413 }
12414
12415 void test_case_reenter(const TestCaseData& in) override {
12416 testCaseData.addTime(timer.getElapsedSeconds());
12417 testCaseData.appendSubcaseNamesToLastTestcase(deepestSubcaseStackNames);
12418 deepestSubcaseStackNames.clear();
12419
12420 timer.start();
12421 testCaseData.add(skipPathFromFilename(in.m_file.c_str()), in.m_name);
12422 }
12423
12424 void test_case_end(const CurrentTestCaseStats&) override {
12425 testCaseData.addTime(timer.getElapsedSeconds());
12426 testCaseData.appendSubcaseNamesToLastTestcase(deepestSubcaseStackNames);
12427 deepestSubcaseStackNames.clear();
12428 }
12429
12430 void test_case_exception(const TestCaseException& e) override {
12431 DOCTEST_LOCK_MUTEX(mutex)
12432 testCaseData.addError("exception", e.error_string.c_str());
12433 }
12434
12435 void subcase_start(const SubcaseSignature& in) override {
12436 deepestSubcaseStackNames.push_back(in.m_name);
12437 }
12438
12439 void subcase_end() override {}
12440
12441 void log_assert(const AssertData& rb) override {
12442 if(!rb.m_failed) // report only failures & ignore the `success` option
12443 return;
12444
12445 DOCTEST_LOCK_MUTEX(mutex)
12446
12447 std::ostringstream os;
12448 os << skipPathFromFilename(rb.m_file) << (opt.gnu_file_line ? ":" : "(")
12449 << line(rb.m_line) << (opt.gnu_file_line ? ":" : "):") << std::endl;
12450
12451 fulltext_log_assert_to_stream(os, rb);
12452 log_contexts(os);
12453 testCaseData.addFailure(rb.m_decomp.c_str(), assertString(rb.m_at), os.str());
12454 }
12455
12456 void log_message(const MessageData&) override {}
12457
12458 void test_case_skipped(const TestCaseData&) override {}
12459
12460 void log_contexts(std::ostringstream& s) {
12461 int num_contexts = get_num_active_contexts();
12462 if(num_contexts) {
12463 auto contexts = get_active_contexts();
12464
12465 s << " logged: ";
12466 for(int i = 0; i < num_contexts; ++i) {
12467 s << (i == 0 ? "" : " ");
12468 contexts[i]->stringify(&s);
12469 s << std::endl;
12470 }
12471 }
12472 }
12473 };
12474
12475 DOCTEST_REGISTER_REPORTER("junit", 0, JUnitReporter);
12476
12477 struct Whitespace
12478 {
12479 int nrSpaces;
12480 explicit Whitespace(int nr)
12481 : nrSpaces(nr) {}
12482 };
12483
12484 std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& out, const Whitespace& ws) {
12485 if(ws.nrSpaces != 0)
12486 out << std::setw(ws.nrSpaces) << ' ';
12487 return out;
12488 }
12489
12490 struct ConsoleReporter : public IReporter
12491 {
12492 std::ostream& s;
12493 bool hasLoggedCurrentTestStart;
12494 std::vector<SubcaseSignature> subcasesStack;
12495 size_t currentSubcaseLevel;
12496 DOCTEST_DECLARE_MUTEX(mutex)
12497
12498 // caching pointers/references to objects of these types - safe to do
12499 const ContextOptions& opt;
12500 const TestCaseData* tc;
12501
12502 ConsoleReporter(const ContextOptions& co)
12503 : s(*co.cout)
12504 , opt(co) {}
12505
12506 ConsoleReporter(const ContextOptions& co, std::ostream& ostr)
12507 : s(ostr)
12508 , opt(co) {}
12509
12510 // =========================================================================================
12511 // WHAT FOLLOWS ARE HELPERS USED BY THE OVERRIDES OF THE VIRTUAL METHODS OF THE INTERFACE
12512 // =========================================================================================
12513
12514 void separator_to_stream() {
12515 s << Color::Yellow
12516 << "==============================================================================="
12517 "\n";
12518 }
12519
12520 const char* getSuccessOrFailString(bool success, assertType::Enum at,
12521 const char* success_str) {
12522 if(success)
12523 return success_str;
12524 return failureString(at);
12525 }
12526
12527 Color::Enum getSuccessOrFailColor(bool success, assertType::Enum at) {
12528 return success ? Color::BrightGreen :
12529 (at & assertType::is_warn) ? Color::Yellow : Color::Red;
12530 }
12531
12532 void successOrFailColoredStringToStream(bool success, assertType::Enum at,
12533 const char* success_str = "SUCCESS") {
12534 s << getSuccessOrFailColor(success, at)
12535 << getSuccessOrFailString(success, at, success_str) << ": ";
12536 }
12537
12538 void log_contexts() {
12539 int num_contexts = get_num_active_contexts();
12540 if(num_contexts) {
12541 auto contexts = get_active_contexts();
12542
12543 s << Color::None << " logged: ";
12544 for(int i = 0; i < num_contexts; ++i) {
12545 s << (i == 0 ? "" : " ");
12546 contexts[i]->stringify(&s);
12547 s << "\n";
12548 }
12549 }
12550
12551 s << "\n";
12552 }
12553
12554 // this was requested to be made virtual so users could override it
12555 virtual void file_line_to_stream(const char* file, int line,
12556 const char* tail = "") {
12557 s << Color::LightGrey << skipPathFromFilename(file) << (opt.gnu_file_line ? ":" : "(")
12558 << (opt.no_line_numbers ? 0 : line) // 0 or the real num depending on the option
12559 << (opt.gnu_file_line ? ":" : "):") << tail;
12560 }
12561
12562 void logTestStart() {
12563 if(hasLoggedCurrentTestStart)
12564 return;
12565
12566 separator_to_stream();
12567 file_line_to_stream(tc->m_file.c_str(), tc->m_line, "\n");
12568 if(tc->m_description)
12569 s << Color::Yellow << "DESCRIPTION: " << Color::None << tc->m_description << "\n";
12570 if(tc->m_test_suite && tc->m_test_suite[0] != '\0')
12571 s << Color::Yellow << "TEST SUITE: " << Color::None << tc->m_test_suite << "\n";
12572 if(strncmp(tc->m_name, " Scenario:", 11) != 0)
12573 s << Color::Yellow << "TEST CASE: ";
12574 s << Color::None << tc->m_name << "\n";
12575
12576 for(size_t i = 0; i < currentSubcaseLevel; ++i) {
12577 if(subcasesStack[i].m_name[0] != '\0')
12578 s << " " << subcasesStack[i].m_name << "\n";
12579 }
12580
12581 if(currentSubcaseLevel != subcasesStack.size()) {
12582 s << Color::Yellow << "\nDEEPEST SUBCASE STACK REACHED (DIFFERENT FROM THE CURRENT ONE):\n" << Color::None;
12583 for(size_t i = 0; i < subcasesStack.size(); ++i) {
12584 if(subcasesStack[i].m_name[0] != '\0')
12585 s << " " << subcasesStack[i].m_name << "\n";
12586 }
12587 }
12588
12589 s << "\n";
12590
12591 hasLoggedCurrentTestStart = true;
12592 }
12593
12594 void printVersion() {
12595 if(opt.no_version == false)
12596 s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None << "doctest version is \""
12597 << DOCTEST_VERSION_STR << "\"\n";
12598 }
12599
12600 void printIntro() {
12601 if(opt.no_intro == false) {
12602 printVersion();
12603 s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None
12604 << "run with \"--" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "help\" for options\n";
12605 }
12606 }
12607
12608 void printHelp() {
12609 int sizePrefixDisplay = static_cast<int>(strlen(DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY));
12610 printVersion();
12611 // clang-format off
12612 s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest]\n" << Color::None;
12613 s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None;
12614 s << "boolean values: \"1/on/yes/true\" or \"0/off/no/false\"\n";
12615 s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None;
12616 s << "filter values: \"str1,str2,str3\" (comma separated strings)\n";
12617 s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest]\n" << Color::None;
12618 s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None;
12619 s << "filters use wildcards for matching strings\n";
12620 s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None;
12621 s << "something passes a filter if any of the strings in a filter matches\n";
12622#ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_UNPREFIXED_OPTIONS
12623 s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest]\n" << Color::None;
12624 s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None;
12625 s << "ALL FLAGS, OPTIONS AND FILTERS ALSO AVAILABLE WITH A \"" DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "\" PREFIX!!!\n";
12626#endif
12627 s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest]\n" << Color::None;
12628 s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None;
12629 s << "Query flags - the program quits after them. Available:\n\n";
12630 s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "?, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "help, -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "h "
12631 << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*0) << "prints this message\n";
12632 s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "v, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "version "
12633 << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "prints the version\n";
12634 s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "c, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "count "
12635 << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "prints the number of matching tests\n";
12636 s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "ltc, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "list-test-cases "
12637 << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "lists all matching tests by name\n";
12638 s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "lts, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "list-test-suites "
12639 << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "lists all matching test suites\n";
12640 s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "lr, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "list-reporters "
12641 << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "lists all registered reporters\n\n";
12642 // ================================================================================== << 79
12643 s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None;
12644 s << "The available <int>/<string> options/filters are:\n\n";
12645 s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "tc, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "test-case=<filters> "
12646 << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "filters tests by their name\n";
12647 s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "tce, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "test-case-exclude=<filters> "
12648 << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "filters OUT tests by their name\n";
12649 s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "sf, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "source-file=<filters> "
12650 << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "filters tests by their file\n";
12651 s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "sfe, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "source-file-exclude=<filters> "
12652 << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "filters OUT tests by their file\n";
12653 s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "ts, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "test-suite=<filters> "
12654 << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "filters tests by their test suite\n";
12655 s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "tse, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "test-suite-exclude=<filters> "
12656 << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "filters OUT tests by their test suite\n";
12657 s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "sc, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "subcase=<filters> "
12658 << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "filters subcases by their name\n";
12659 s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "sce, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "subcase-exclude=<filters> "
12660 << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "filters OUT subcases by their name\n";
12661 s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "r, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "reporters=<filters> "
12662 << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "reporters to use (console is default)\n";
12663 s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "o, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "out=<string> "
12664 << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "output filename\n";
12665 s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "ob, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "order-by=<string> "
12666 << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "how the tests should be ordered\n";
12667 s << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*3) << " <string> - [file/suite/name/rand/none]\n";
12668 s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "rs, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "rand-seed=<int> "
12669 << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "seed for random ordering\n";
12670 s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "f, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "first=<int> "
12671 << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "the first test passing the filters to\n";
12672 s << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*3) << " execute - for range-based execution\n";
12673 s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "l, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "last=<int> "
12674 << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "the last test passing the filters to\n";
12675 s << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*3) << " execute - for range-based execution\n";
12676 s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "aa, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "abort-after=<int> "
12677 << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "stop after <int> failed assertions\n";
12678 s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "scfl,--" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "subcase-filter-levels=<int> "
12679 << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "apply filters for the first <int> levels\n";
12680 s << Color::Cyan << "\n[doctest] " << Color::None;
12681 s << "Bool options - can be used like flags and true is assumed. Available:\n\n";
12682 s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "s, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "success=<bool> "
12683 << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "include successful assertions in output\n";
12684 s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "cs, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "case-sensitive=<bool> "
12685 << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "filters being treated as case sensitive\n";
12686 s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "e, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "exit=<bool> "
12687 << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "exits after the tests finish\n";
12688 s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "d, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "duration=<bool> "
12689 << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "prints the time duration of each test\n";
12690 s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "m, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "minimal=<bool> "
12691 << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "minimal console output (only failures)\n";
12692 s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "q, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "quiet=<bool> "
12693 << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "no console output\n";
12694 s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "nt, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "no-throw=<bool> "
12695 << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "skips exceptions-related assert checks\n";
12696 s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "ne, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "no-exitcode=<bool> "
12697 << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "returns (or exits) always with success\n";
12698 s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "nr, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "no-run=<bool> "
12699 << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "skips all runtime doctest operations\n";
12700 s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "ni, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "no-intro=<bool> "
12701 << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "omit the framework intro in the output\n";
12702 s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "nv, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "no-version=<bool> "
12703 << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "omit the framework version in the output\n";
12704 s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "nc, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "no-colors=<bool> "
12705 << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "disables colors in output\n";
12706 s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "fc, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "force-colors=<bool> "
12707 << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "use colors even when not in a tty\n";
12708 s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "nb, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "no-breaks=<bool> "
12709 << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "disables breakpoints in debuggers\n";
12710 s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "ns, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "no-skip=<bool> "
12711 << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "don't skip test cases marked as skip\n";
12712 s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "gfl, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "gnu-file-line=<bool> "
12713 << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << ":n: vs (n): for line numbers in output\n";
12714 s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "npf, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "no-path-filenames=<bool> "
12715 << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "only filenames and no paths in output\n";
12716 s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "nln, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "no-line-numbers=<bool> "
12717 << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "0 instead of real line numbers in output\n";
12718 // ================================================================================== << 79
12719 // clang-format on
12720
12721 s << Color::Cyan << "\n[doctest] " << Color::None;
12722 s << "for more information visit the project documentation\n\n";
12723 }
12724
12725 void printRegisteredReporters() {
12726 printVersion();
12727 auto printReporters = [this] (const reporterMap& reporters, const char* type) {
12728 if(reporters.size()) {
12729 s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None << "listing all registered " << type << "\n";
12730 for(auto& curr : reporters)
12731 s << "priority: " << std::setw(5) << curr.first.first
12732 << " name: " << curr.first.second << "\n";
12733 }
12734 };
12735 printReporters(getListeners(), "listeners");
12736 printReporters(getReporters(), "reporters");
12737 }
12738
12739 // =========================================================================================
12740 // WHAT FOLLOWS ARE OVERRIDES OF THE VIRTUAL METHODS OF THE REPORTER INTERFACE
12741 // =========================================================================================
12742
12743 void report_query(const QueryData& in) override {
12744 if(opt.version) {
12745 printVersion();
12746 } else if(opt.help) {
12747 printHelp();
12748 } else if(opt.list_reporters) {
12749 printRegisteredReporters();
12750 } else if(opt.count || opt.list_test_cases) {
12751 if(opt.list_test_cases) {
12752 s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None
12753 << "listing all test case names\n";
12754 separator_to_stream();
12755 }
12756
12757 for(unsigned i = 0; i < in.num_data; ++i)
12758 s << Color::None << in.data[i]->m_name << "\n";
12759
12760 separator_to_stream();
12761
12762 s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None
12763 << "unskipped test cases passing the current filters: "
12764 << g_cs->numTestCasesPassingFilters << "\n";
12765
12766 } else if(opt.list_test_suites) {
12767 s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None << "listing all test suites\n";
12768 separator_to_stream();
12769
12770 for(unsigned i = 0; i < in.num_data; ++i)
12771 s << Color::None << in.data[i]->m_test_suite << "\n";
12772
12773 separator_to_stream();
12774
12775 s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None
12776 << "unskipped test cases passing the current filters: "
12777 << g_cs->numTestCasesPassingFilters << "\n";
12778 s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None
12779 << "test suites with unskipped test cases passing the current filters: "
12780 << g_cs->numTestSuitesPassingFilters << "\n";
12781 }
12782 }
12783
12784 void test_run_start() override {
12785 if(!opt.minimal)
12786 printIntro();
12787 }
12788
12789 void test_run_end(const TestRunStats& p) override {
12790 if(opt.minimal && p.numTestCasesFailed == 0)
12791 return;
12792
12793 separator_to_stream();
12794 s << std::dec;
12795
12796 auto totwidth = int(std::ceil(log10((std::max(p.numTestCasesPassingFilters, static_cast<unsigned>(p.numAsserts))) + 1)));
12797 auto passwidth = int(std::ceil(log10((std::max(p.numTestCasesPassingFilters - p.numTestCasesFailed, static_cast<unsigned>(p.numAsserts - p.numAssertsFailed))) + 1)));
12798 auto failwidth = int(std::ceil(log10((std::max(p.numTestCasesFailed, static_cast<unsigned>(p.numAssertsFailed))) + 1)));
12799 const bool anythingFailed = p.numTestCasesFailed > 0 || p.numAssertsFailed > 0;
12800 s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None << "test cases: " << std::setw(totwidth)
12801 << p.numTestCasesPassingFilters << " | "
12802 << ((p.numTestCasesPassingFilters == 0 || anythingFailed) ? Color::None :
12803 Color::Green)
12804 << std::setw(passwidth) << p.numTestCasesPassingFilters - p.numTestCasesFailed << " passed"
12805 << Color::None << " | " << (p.numTestCasesFailed > 0 ? Color::Red : Color::None)
12806 << std::setw(failwidth) << p.numTestCasesFailed << " failed" << Color::None << " |";
12807 if(opt.no_skipped_summary == false) {
12808 const int numSkipped = p.numTestCases - p.numTestCasesPassingFilters;
12809 s << " " << (numSkipped == 0 ? Color::None : Color::Yellow) << numSkipped
12810 << " skipped" << Color::None;
12811 }
12812 s << "\n";
12813 s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None << "assertions: " << std::setw(totwidth)
12814 << p.numAsserts << " | "
12815 << ((p.numAsserts == 0 || anythingFailed) ? Color::None : Color::Green)
12816 << std::setw(passwidth) << (p.numAsserts - p.numAssertsFailed) << " passed" << Color::None
12817 << " | " << (p.numAssertsFailed > 0 ? Color::Red : Color::None) << std::setw(failwidth)
12818 << p.numAssertsFailed << " failed" << Color::None << " |\n";
12819 s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None
12820 << "Status: " << (p.numTestCasesFailed > 0 ? Color::Red : Color::Green)
12821 << ((p.numTestCasesFailed > 0) ? "FAILURE!" : "SUCCESS!") << Color::None << std::endl;
12822 }
12823
12824 void test_case_start(const TestCaseData& in) override {
12825 hasLoggedCurrentTestStart = false;
12826 tc = &in;
12827 subcasesStack.clear();
12828 currentSubcaseLevel = 0;
12829 }
12830
12831 void test_case_reenter(const TestCaseData&) override {
12832 subcasesStack.clear();
12833 }
12834
12835 void test_case_end(const CurrentTestCaseStats& st) override {
12836 if(tc->m_no_output)
12837 return;
12838
12839 // log the preamble of the test case only if there is something
12840 // else to print - something other than that an assert has failed
12841 if(opt.duration ||
12842 (st.failure_flags && st.failure_flags != static_cast<int>(TestCaseFailureReason::AssertFailure)))
12843 logTestStart();
12844
12845 if(opt.duration)
12846 s << Color::None << std::setprecision(6) << std::fixed << st.seconds
12847 << " s: " << tc->m_name << "\n";
12848
12849 if(st.failure_flags & TestCaseFailureReason::Timeout)
12850 s << Color::Red << "Test case exceeded time limit of " << std::setprecision(6)
12851 << std::fixed << tc->m_timeout << "!\n";
12852
12853 if(st.failure_flags & TestCaseFailureReason::ShouldHaveFailedButDidnt) {
12854 s << Color::Red << "Should have failed but didn't! Marking it as failed!\n";
12855 } else if(st.failure_flags & TestCaseFailureReason::ShouldHaveFailedAndDid) {
12856 s << Color::Yellow << "Failed as expected so marking it as not failed\n";
12857 } else if(st.failure_flags & TestCaseFailureReason::CouldHaveFailedAndDid) {
12858 s << Color::Yellow << "Allowed to fail so marking it as not failed\n";
12859 } else if(st.failure_flags & TestCaseFailureReason::DidntFailExactlyNumTimes) {
12860 s << Color::Red << "Didn't fail exactly " << tc->m_expected_failures
12861 << " times so marking it as failed!\n";
12862 } else if(st.failure_flags & TestCaseFailureReason::FailedExactlyNumTimes) {
12863 s << Color::Yellow << "Failed exactly " << tc->m_expected_failures
12864 << " times as expected so marking it as not failed!\n";
12865 }
12866 if(st.failure_flags & TestCaseFailureReason::TooManyFailedAsserts) {
12867 s << Color::Red << "Aborting - too many failed asserts!\n";
12868 }
12869 s << Color::None; // lgtm [cpp/useless-expression]
12870 }
12871
12872 void test_case_exception(const TestCaseException& e) override {
12873 DOCTEST_LOCK_MUTEX(mutex)
12874 if(tc->m_no_output)
12875 return;
12876
12877 logTestStart();
12878
12879 file_line_to_stream(tc->m_file.c_str(), tc->m_line, " ");
12880 successOrFailColoredStringToStream(false, e.is_crash ? assertType::is_require :
12881 assertType::is_check);
12882 s << Color::Red << (e.is_crash ? "test case CRASHED: " : "test case THREW exception: ")
12883 << Color::Cyan << e.error_string << "\n";
12884
12885 int num_stringified_contexts = get_num_stringified_contexts();
12886 if(num_stringified_contexts) {
12887 auto stringified_contexts = get_stringified_contexts();
12888 s << Color::None << " logged: ";
12889 for(int i = num_stringified_contexts; i > 0; --i) {
12890 s << (i == num_stringified_contexts ? "" : " ")
12891 << stringified_contexts[i - 1] << "\n";
12892 }
12893 }
12894 s << "\n" << Color::None;
12895 }
12896
12897 void subcase_start(const SubcaseSignature& subc) override {
12898 subcasesStack.push_back(subc);
12899 ++currentSubcaseLevel;
12900 hasLoggedCurrentTestStart = false;
12901 }
12902
12903 void subcase_end() override {
12904 --currentSubcaseLevel;
12905 hasLoggedCurrentTestStart = false;
12906 }
12907
12908 void log_assert(const AssertData& rb) override {
12909 if((!rb.m_failed && !opt.success) || tc->m_no_output)
12910 return;
12911
12912 DOCTEST_LOCK_MUTEX(mutex)
12913
12914 logTestStart();
12915
12916 file_line_to_stream(rb.m_file, rb.m_line, " ");
12917 successOrFailColoredStringToStream(!rb.m_failed, rb.m_at);
12918
12919 fulltext_log_assert_to_stream(s, rb);
12920
12921 log_contexts();
12922 }
12923
12924 void log_message(const MessageData& mb) override {
12925 if(tc->m_no_output)
12926 return;
12927
12928 DOCTEST_LOCK_MUTEX(mutex)
12929
12930 logTestStart();
12931
12932 file_line_to_stream(mb.m_file, mb.m_line, " ");
12933 s << getSuccessOrFailColor(false, mb.m_severity)
12934 << getSuccessOrFailString(mb.m_severity & assertType::is_warn, mb.m_severity,
12935 "MESSAGE") << ": ";
12936 s << Color::None << mb.m_string << "\n";
12937 log_contexts();
12938 }
12939
12940 void test_case_skipped(const TestCaseData&) override {}
12941 };
12942
12943 DOCTEST_REGISTER_REPORTER("console", 0, ConsoleReporter);
12944
12945#ifdef DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
12946 struct DebugOutputWindowReporter : public ConsoleReporter
12947 {
12948 DOCTEST_THREAD_LOCAL static std::ostringstream oss;
12949
12950 DebugOutputWindowReporter(const ContextOptions& co)
12951 : ConsoleReporter(co, oss) {}
12952
12953#define DOCTEST_DEBUG_OUTPUT_REPORTER_OVERRIDE(func, type, arg) \
12954 void func(type arg) override { \
12955 bool with_col = g_no_colors; \
12956 g_no_colors = false; \
12957 ConsoleReporter::func(arg); \
12958 if(oss.tellp() != std::streampos{}) { \
12959 DOCTEST_OUTPUT_DEBUG_STRING(oss.str().c_str()); \
12960 oss.str(""); \
12961 } \
12962 g_no_colors = with_col; \
12963 }
12964
12965 DOCTEST_DEBUG_OUTPUT_REPORTER_OVERRIDE(test_run_start, DOCTEST_EMPTY, DOCTEST_EMPTY)
12966 DOCTEST_DEBUG_OUTPUT_REPORTER_OVERRIDE(test_run_end, const TestRunStats&, in)
12967 DOCTEST_DEBUG_OUTPUT_REPORTER_OVERRIDE(test_case_start, const TestCaseData&, in)
12968 DOCTEST_DEBUG_OUTPUT_REPORTER_OVERRIDE(test_case_reenter, const TestCaseData&, in)
12969 DOCTEST_DEBUG_OUTPUT_REPORTER_OVERRIDE(test_case_end, const CurrentTestCaseStats&, in)
12970 DOCTEST_DEBUG_OUTPUT_REPORTER_OVERRIDE(test_case_exception, const TestCaseException&, in)
12971 DOCTEST_DEBUG_OUTPUT_REPORTER_OVERRIDE(subcase_start, const SubcaseSignature&, in)
12972 DOCTEST_DEBUG_OUTPUT_REPORTER_OVERRIDE(subcase_end, DOCTEST_EMPTY, DOCTEST_EMPTY)
12973 DOCTEST_DEBUG_OUTPUT_REPORTER_OVERRIDE(log_assert, const AssertData&, in)
12974 DOCTEST_DEBUG_OUTPUT_REPORTER_OVERRIDE(log_message, const MessageData&, in)
12975 DOCTEST_DEBUG_OUTPUT_REPORTER_OVERRIDE(test_case_skipped, const TestCaseData&, in)
12976 };
12977
12978 DOCTEST_THREAD_LOCAL std::ostringstream DebugOutputWindowReporter::oss;
12979#endif // DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
12980
12981 // the implementation of parseOption()
12982 bool parseOptionImpl(int argc, const char* const* argv, const char* pattern, String* value) {
12983 // going from the end to the beginning and stopping on the first occurrence from the end
12984 for(int i = argc; i > 0; --i) {
12985 auto index = i - 1;
12986 auto temp = std::strstr(argv[index], pattern);
12987 if(temp && (value || strlen(temp) == strlen(pattern))) {
12988 // eliminate matches in which the chars before the option are not '-'
12989 bool noBadCharsFound = true;
12990 auto curr = argv[index];
12991 while(curr != temp) {
12992 if(*curr++ != '-') {
12993 noBadCharsFound = false;
12994 break;
12995 }
12996 }
12997 if(noBadCharsFound && argv[index][0] == '-') {
12998 if(value) {
12999 // parsing the value of an option
13000 temp += strlen(pattern);
13001 const unsigned len = strlen(temp);
13002 if(len) {
13003 *value = temp;
13004 return true;
13005 }
13006 } else {
13007 // just a flag - no value
13008 return true;
13009 }
13010 }
13011 }
13012 }
13013 return false;
13014 }
13015
13016 // parses an option and returns the string after the '=' character
13017 bool parseOption(int argc, const char* const* argv, const char* pattern, String* value = nullptr,
13018 const String& defaultVal = String()) {
13019 if(value)
13020 *value = defaultVal;
13021#ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_UNPREFIXED_OPTIONS
13022 // offset (normally 3 for "dt-") to skip prefix
13023 if(parseOptionImpl(argc, argv, pattern + strlen(DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX), value))
13024 return true;
13025#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_UNPREFIXED_OPTIONS
13026 return parseOptionImpl(argc, argv, pattern, value);
13027 }
13028
13029 // locates a flag on the command line
13030 bool parseFlag(int argc, const char* const* argv, const char* pattern) {
13031 return parseOption(argc, argv, pattern);
13032 }
13033
13034 // parses a comma separated list of words after a pattern in one of the arguments in argv
13035 bool parseCommaSepArgs(int argc, const char* const* argv, const char* pattern,
13036 std::vector<String>& res) {
13037 String filtersString;
13038 if(parseOption(argc, argv, pattern, &filtersString)) {
13039 // tokenize with "," as a separator, unless escaped with backslash
13040 std::ostringstream s;
13041 auto flush = [&s, &res]() {
13042 auto string = s.str();
13043 if(string.size() > 0) {
13044 res.push_back(string.c_str());
13045 }
13046 s.str("");
13047 };
13048
13049 bool seenBackslash = false;
13050 const char* current = filtersString.c_str();
13051 const char* end = current + strlen(current);
13052 while(current != end) {
13053 char character = *current++;
13054 if(seenBackslash) {
13055 seenBackslash = false;
13056 if(character == ',' || character == '\\') {
13057 s.put(character);
13058 continue;
13059 }
13060 s.put('\\');
13061 }
13062 if(character == '\\') {
13063 seenBackslash = true;
13064 } else if(character == ',') {
13065 flush();
13066 } else {
13067 s.put(character);
13068 }
13069 }
13070
13071 if(seenBackslash) {
13072 s.put('\\');
13073 }
13074 flush();
13075 return true;
13076 }
13077 return false;
13078 }
13079
13080 enum optionType
13081 {
13082 option_bool,
13083 option_int
13084 };
13085
13086 // parses an int/bool option from the command line
13087 bool parseIntOption(int argc, const char* const* argv, const char* pattern, optionType type,
13088 int& res) {
13089 String parsedValue;
13090 if(!parseOption(argc, argv, pattern, &parsedValue))
13091 return false;
13092
13093 if(type) {
13094 // integer
13095 // TODO: change this to use std::stoi or something else! currently it uses undefined behavior - assumes '0' on failed parse...
13096 int theInt = std::atoi(parsedValue.c_str());
13097 if (theInt != 0) {
13098 res = theInt;
13099 return true;
13100 }
13101 } else {
13102 // boolean
13103 const char positive[][5] = { "1", "true", "on", "yes" }; // 5 - strlen("true") + 1
13104 const char negative[][6] = { "0", "false", "off", "no" }; // 6 - strlen("false") + 1
13105
13106 // if the value matches any of the positive/negative possibilities
13107 for (unsigned i = 0; i < 4; i++) {
13108 if (parsedValue.compare(positive[i], true) == 0) {
13109 res = 1;
13110 return true;
13111 }
13112 if (parsedValue.compare(negative[i], true) == 0) {
13113 res = 0;
13114 return true;
13115 }
13116 }
13117 }
13118 return false;
13119 }
13120} // namespace
13121
13122Context::Context(int argc, const char* const* argv)
13123 : p(new detail::ContextState) {
13124 parseArgs(argc, argv, true);
13125 if(argc)
13126 p->binary_name = argv[0];
13127}
13128
13129Context::~Context() {
13130 if(g_cs == p)
13131 g_cs = nullptr;
13132 delete p;
13133}
13134
13135void Context::applyCommandLine(int argc, const char* const* argv) {
13136 parseArgs(argc, argv);
13137 if(argc)
13138 p->binary_name = argv[0];
13139}
13140
13141// parses args
13142void Context::parseArgs(int argc, const char* const* argv, bool withDefaults) {
13143 using namespace detail;
13144
13145 // clang-format off
13146 parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "source-file=", p->filters[0]);
13147 parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "sf=", p->filters[0]);
13148 parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "source-file-exclude=",p->filters[1]);
13149 parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "sfe=", p->filters[1]);
13150 parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "test-suite=", p->filters[2]);
13151 parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "ts=", p->filters[2]);
13152 parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "test-suite-exclude=", p->filters[3]);
13153 parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "tse=", p->filters[3]);
13154 parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "test-case=", p->filters[4]);
13155 parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "tc=", p->filters[4]);
13156 parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "test-case-exclude=", p->filters[5]);
13157 parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "tce=", p->filters[5]);
13158 parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "subcase=", p->filters[6]);
13159 parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "sc=", p->filters[6]);
13160 parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "subcase-exclude=", p->filters[7]);
13161 parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "sce=", p->filters[7]);
13162 parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "reporters=", p->filters[8]);
13163 parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "r=", p->filters[8]);
13164 // clang-format on
13165
13166 int intRes = 0;
13167 String strRes;
13168
13169#define DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG(name, sname, var, default) \
13170 if(parseIntOption(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX name "=", option_bool, intRes) || \
13171 parseIntOption(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX sname "=", option_bool, intRes)) \
13172 p->var = static_cast<bool>(intRes); \
13173 else if(parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX name) || \
13174 parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX sname)) \
13175 p->var = true; \
13176 else if(withDefaults) \
13177 p->var = default
13178
13179#define DOCTEST_PARSE_INT_OPTION(name, sname, var, default) \
13180 if(parseIntOption(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX name "=", option_int, intRes) || \
13181 parseIntOption(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX sname "=", option_int, intRes)) \
13182 p->var = intRes; \
13183 else if(withDefaults) \
13184 p->var = default
13185
13186#define DOCTEST_PARSE_STR_OPTION(name, sname, var, default) \
13187 if(parseOption(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX name "=", &strRes, default) || \
13188 parseOption(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX sname "=", &strRes, default) || \
13189 withDefaults) \
13190 p->var = strRes
13191
13192 // clang-format off
13193 DOCTEST_PARSE_STR_OPTION("out", "o", out, "");
13194 DOCTEST_PARSE_STR_OPTION("order-by", "ob", order_by, "file");
13195 DOCTEST_PARSE_INT_OPTION("rand-seed", "rs", rand_seed, 0);
13196
13197 DOCTEST_PARSE_INT_OPTION("first", "f", first, 0);
13198 DOCTEST_PARSE_INT_OPTION("last", "l", last, UINT_MAX);
13199
13200 DOCTEST_PARSE_INT_OPTION("abort-after", "aa", abort_after, 0);
13201 DOCTEST_PARSE_INT_OPTION("subcase-filter-levels", "scfl", subcase_filter_levels, INT_MAX);
13202
13203 DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("success", "s", success, false);
13204 DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("case-sensitive", "cs", case_sensitive, false);
13205 DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("exit", "e", exit, false);
13206 DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("duration", "d", duration, false);
13207 DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("minimal", "m", minimal, false);
13208 DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("quiet", "q", quiet, false);
13209 DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("no-throw", "nt", no_throw, false);
13210 DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("no-exitcode", "ne", no_exitcode, false);
13211 DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("no-run", "nr", no_run, false);
13212 DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("no-intro", "ni", no_intro, false);
13213 DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("no-version", "nv", no_version, false);
13214 DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("no-colors", "nc", no_colors, false);
13215 DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("force-colors", "fc", force_colors, false);
13216 DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("no-breaks", "nb", no_breaks, false);
13217 DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("no-skip", "ns", no_skip, false);
13218 DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("gnu-file-line", "gfl", gnu_file_line, !bool(DOCTEST_MSVC));
13219 DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("no-path-filenames", "npf", no_path_in_filenames, false);
13220 DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("no-line-numbers", "nln", no_line_numbers, false);
13221 DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("no-debug-output", "ndo", no_debug_output, false);
13222 DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("no-skipped-summary", "nss", no_skipped_summary, false);
13223 DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("no-time-in-output", "ntio", no_time_in_output, false);
13224 // clang-format on
13225
13226 if(withDefaults) {
13227 p->help = false;
13228 p->version = false;
13229 p->count = false;
13230 p->list_test_cases = false;
13231 p->list_test_suites = false;
13232 p->list_reporters = false;
13233 }
13234 if(parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "help") ||
13235 parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "h") ||
13236 parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "?")) {
13237 p->help = true;
13238 p->exit = true;
13239 }
13240 if(parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "version") ||
13241 parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "v")) {
13242 p->version = true;
13243 p->exit = true;
13244 }
13245 if(parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "count") ||
13246 parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "c")) {
13247 p->count = true;
13248 p->exit = true;
13249 }
13250 if(parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "list-test-cases") ||
13251 parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "ltc")) {
13252 p->list_test_cases = true;
13253 p->exit = true;
13254 }
13255 if(parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "list-test-suites") ||
13256 parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "lts")) {
13257 p->list_test_suites = true;
13258 p->exit = true;
13259 }
13260 if(parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "list-reporters") ||
13261 parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "lr")) {
13262 p->list_reporters = true;
13263 p->exit = true;
13264 }
13265}
13266
13267// allows the user to add procedurally to the filters from the command line
13268void Context::addFilter(const char* filter, const char* value) { setOption(filter, value); }
13269
13270// allows the user to clear all filters from the command line
13271void Context::clearFilters() {
13272 for(auto& curr : p->filters)
13273 curr.clear();
13274}
13275
13276// allows the user to override procedurally the bool options from the command line
13277void Context::setOption(const char* option, bool value) {
13278 setOption(option, value ? "true" : "false");
13279}
13280
13281// allows the user to override procedurally the int options from the command line
13282void Context::setOption(const char* option, int value) {
13283 setOption(option, toString(value).c_str());
13284}
13285
13286// allows the user to override procedurally the string options from the command line
13287void Context::setOption(const char* option, const char* value) {
13288 auto argv = String("-") + option + "=" + value;
13289 auto lvalue = argv.c_str();
13290 parseArgs(1, &lvalue);
13291}
13292
13293// users should query this in their main() and exit the program if true
13294bool Context::shouldExit() { return p->exit; }
13295
13296void Context::setAsDefaultForAssertsOutOfTestCases() { g_cs = p; }
13297
13298void Context::setAssertHandler(detail::assert_handler ah) { p->ah = ah; }
13299
13300void Context::setCout(std::ostream* out) { p->cout = out; }
13301
13302static class DiscardOStream : public std::ostream
13303{
13304private:
13305 class : public std::streambuf
13306 {
13307 private:
13308 // allowing some buffering decreases the amount of calls to overflow
13309 char buf[1024];
13310
13311 protected:
13312 std::streamsize xsputn(const char_type*, std::streamsize count) override { return count; }
13313
13314 int_type overflow(int_type ch) override {
13315 setp(std::begin(buf), std::end(buf));
13316 return traits_type::not_eof(ch);
13317 }
13318 } discardBuf;
13319
13320public:
13321 DiscardOStream()
13322 : std::ostream(&discardBuf) {}
13323} discardOut;
13324
13325// the main function that does all the filtering and test running
13326int Context::run() {
13327 using namespace detail;
13328
13329 // save the old context state in case such was setup - for using asserts out of a testing context
13330 auto old_cs = g_cs;
13331 // this is the current contest
13332 g_cs = p;
13333 is_running_in_test = true;
13334
13335 g_no_colors = p->no_colors;
13336 p->resetRunData();
13337
13338 std::fstream fstr;
13339 if(p->cout == nullptr) {
13340 if(p->quiet) {
13341 p->cout = &discardOut;
13342 } else if(p->out.size()) {
13343 // to a file if specified
13344 fstr.open(p->out.c_str(), std::fstream::out);
13345 p->cout = &fstr;
13346 } else {
13347 // stdout by default
13348 p->cout = &std::cout;
13349 }
13350 }
13351
13352 FatalConditionHandler::allocateAltStackMem();
13353
13354 auto cleanup_and_return = [&]() {
13355 FatalConditionHandler::freeAltStackMem();
13356
13357 if(fstr.is_open())
13358 fstr.close();
13359
13360 // restore context
13361 g_cs = old_cs;
13362 is_running_in_test = false;
13363
13364 // we have to free the reporters which were allocated when the run started
13365 for(auto& curr : p->reporters_currently_used)
13366 delete curr;
13367 p->reporters_currently_used.clear();
13368
13369 if(p->numTestCasesFailed && !p->no_exitcode)
13370 return EXIT_FAILURE;
13371 return EXIT_SUCCESS;
13372 };
13373
13374 // setup default reporter if none is given through the command line
13375 if(p->filters[8].empty())
13376 p->filters[8].push_back("console");
13377
13378 // check to see if any of the registered reporters has been selected
13379 for(auto& curr : getReporters()) {
13380 if(matchesAny(curr.first.second.c_str(), p->filters[8], false, p->case_sensitive))
13381 p->reporters_currently_used.push_back(curr.second(*g_cs));
13382 }
13383
13384 // TODO: check if there is nothing in reporters_currently_used
13385
13386 // prepend all listeners
13387 for(auto& curr : getListeners())
13388 p->reporters_currently_used.insert(p->reporters_currently_used.begin(), curr.second(*g_cs));
13389
13390#ifdef DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
13391 if(isDebuggerActive() && p->no_debug_output == false)
13392 p->reporters_currently_used.push_back(new DebugOutputWindowReporter(*g_cs));
13393#endif // DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
13394
13395 // handle version, help and no_run
13396 if(p->no_run || p->version || p->help || p->list_reporters) {
13397 DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(report_query, QueryData());
13398
13399 return cleanup_and_return();
13400 }
13401
13402 std::vector<const TestCase*> testArray;
13403 for(auto& curr : getRegisteredTests())
13404 testArray.push_back(&curr);
13405 p->numTestCases = testArray.size();
13406
13407 // sort the collected records
13408 if(!testArray.empty()) {
13409 if(p->order_by.compare("file", true) == 0) {
13410 std::sort(testArray.begin(), testArray.end(), fileOrderComparator);
13411 } else if(p->order_by.compare("suite", true) == 0) {
13412 std::sort(testArray.begin(), testArray.end(), suiteOrderComparator);
13413 } else if(p->order_by.compare("name", true) == 0) {
13414 std::sort(testArray.begin(), testArray.end(), nameOrderComparator);
13415 } else if(p->order_by.compare("rand", true) == 0) {
13416 std::srand(p->rand_seed);
13417
13418 // random_shuffle implementation
13419 const auto first = &testArray[0];
13420 for(size_t i = testArray.size() - 1; i > 0; --i) {
13421 int idxToSwap = std::rand() % (i + 1);
13422
13423 const auto temp = first[i];
13424
13425 first[i] = first[idxToSwap];
13426 first[idxToSwap] = temp;
13427 }
13428 } else if(p->order_by.compare("none", true) == 0) {
13429 // means no sorting - beneficial for death tests which call into the executable
13430 // with a specific test case in mind - we don't want to slow down the startup times
13431 }
13432 }
13433
13434 std::set<String> testSuitesPassingFilt;
13435
13436 bool query_mode = p->count || p->list_test_cases || p->list_test_suites;
13437 std::vector<const TestCaseData*> queryResults;
13438
13439 if(!query_mode)
13440 DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(test_run_start, DOCTEST_EMPTY);
13441
13442 // invoke the registered functions if they match the filter criteria (or just count them)
13443 for(auto& curr : testArray) {
13444 const auto& tc = *curr;
13445
13446 bool skip_me = false;
13447 if(tc.m_skip && !p->no_skip)
13448 skip_me = true;
13449
13450 if(!matchesAny(tc.m_file.c_str(), p->filters[0], true, p->case_sensitive))
13451 skip_me = true;
13452 if(matchesAny(tc.m_file.c_str(), p->filters[1], false, p->case_sensitive))
13453 skip_me = true;
13454 if(!matchesAny(tc.m_test_suite, p->filters[2], true, p->case_sensitive))
13455 skip_me = true;
13456 if(matchesAny(tc.m_test_suite, p->filters[3], false, p->case_sensitive))
13457 skip_me = true;
13458 if(!matchesAny(tc.m_name, p->filters[4], true, p->case_sensitive))
13459 skip_me = true;
13460 if(matchesAny(tc.m_name, p->filters[5], false, p->case_sensitive))
13461 skip_me = true;
13462
13463 if(!skip_me)
13464 p->numTestCasesPassingFilters++;
13465
13466 // skip the test if it is not in the execution range
13467 if((p->last < p->numTestCasesPassingFilters && p->first <= p->last) ||
13468 (p->first > p->numTestCasesPassingFilters))
13469 skip_me = true;
13470
13471 if(skip_me) {
13472 if(!query_mode)
13473 DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(test_case_skipped, tc);
13474 continue;
13475 }
13476
13477 // do not execute the test if we are to only count the number of filter passing tests
13478 if(p->count)
13479 continue;
13480
13481 // print the name of the test and don't execute it
13482 if(p->list_test_cases) {
13483 queryResults.push_back(&tc);
13484 continue;
13485 }
13486
13487 // print the name of the test suite if not done already and don't execute it
13488 if(p->list_test_suites) {
13489 if((testSuitesPassingFilt.count(tc.m_test_suite) == 0) && tc.m_test_suite[0] != '\0') {
13490 queryResults.push_back(&tc);
13491 testSuitesPassingFilt.insert(tc.m_test_suite);
13492 p->numTestSuitesPassingFilters++;
13493 }
13494 continue;
13495 }
13496
13497 // execute the test if it passes all the filtering
13498 {
13499 p->currentTest = &tc;
13500
13501 p->failure_flags = TestCaseFailureReason::None;
13502 p->seconds = 0;
13503
13504 // reset atomic counters
13505 p->numAssertsFailedCurrentTest_atomic = 0;
13506 p->numAssertsCurrentTest_atomic = 0;
13507
13508 p->fullyTraversedSubcases.clear();
13509
13510 DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(test_case_start, tc);
13511
13512 p->timer.start();
13513
13514 bool run_test = true;
13515
13516 do {
13517 // reset some of the fields for subcases (except for the set of fully passed ones)
13518 p->reachedLeaf = false;
13519 // May not be empty if previous subcase exited via exception.
13520 p->subcaseStack.clear();
13521 p->currentSubcaseDepth = 0;
13522
13523 p->shouldLogCurrentException = true;
13524
13525 // reset stuff for logging with INFO()
13526 p->stringifiedContexts.clear();
13527
13528#ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
13529 try {
13530#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
13531// MSVC 2015 diagnoses fatalConditionHandler as unused (because reset() is a static method)
13532DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH(4101) // unreferenced local variable
13533 FatalConditionHandler fatalConditionHandler; // Handle signals
13534 // execute the test
13535 tc.m_test();
13536 fatalConditionHandler.reset();
13537DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
13538#ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
13539 } catch(const TestFailureException&) {
13540 p->failure_flags |= TestCaseFailureReason::AssertFailure;
13541 } catch(...) {
13542 DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(test_case_exception,
13543 {translateActiveException(), false});
13544 p->failure_flags |= TestCaseFailureReason::Exception;
13545 }
13546#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
13547
13548 // exit this loop if enough assertions have failed - even if there are more subcases
13549 if(p->abort_after > 0 &&
13550 p->numAssertsFailed + p->numAssertsFailedCurrentTest_atomic >= p->abort_after) {
13551 run_test = false;
13552 p->failure_flags |= TestCaseFailureReason::TooManyFailedAsserts;
13553 }
13554
13555 if(!p->nextSubcaseStack.empty() && run_test)
13556 DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(test_case_reenter, tc);
13557 if(p->nextSubcaseStack.empty())
13558 run_test = false;
13559 } while(run_test);
13560
13561 p->finalizeTestCaseData();
13562
13563 DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(test_case_end, *g_cs);
13564
13565 p->currentTest = nullptr;
13566
13567 // stop executing tests if enough assertions have failed
13568 if(p->abort_after > 0 && p->numAssertsFailed >= p->abort_after)
13569 break;
13570 }
13571 }
13572
13573 if(!query_mode) {
13574 DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(test_run_end, *g_cs);
13575 } else {
13576 QueryData qdata;
13577 qdata.run_stats = g_cs;
13578 qdata.data = queryResults.data();
13579 qdata.num_data = unsigned(queryResults.size());
13580 DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(report_query, qdata);
13581 }
13582
13583 return cleanup_and_return();
13584}
13585
13586DOCTEST_DEFINE_INTERFACE(IReporter)
13587
13588int IReporter::get_num_active_contexts() { return detail::g_infoContexts.size(); }
13589const IContextScope* const* IReporter::get_active_contexts() {
13590 return get_num_active_contexts() ? &detail::g_infoContexts[0] : nullptr;
13591}
13592
13593int IReporter::get_num_stringified_contexts() { return detail::g_cs->stringifiedContexts.size(); }
13594const String* IReporter::get_stringified_contexts() {
13595 return get_num_stringified_contexts() ? &detail::g_cs->stringifiedContexts[0] : nullptr;
13596}
13597
13598namespace detail {
13599 void registerReporterImpl(const char* name, int priority, reporterCreatorFunc c, bool isReporter) {
13600 if(isReporter)
13601 getReporters().insert(reporterMap::value_type(reporterMap::key_type(priority, name), c));
13602 else
13603 getListeners().insert(reporterMap::value_type(reporterMap::key_type(priority, name), c));
13604 }
13605} // namespace detail
13606
13607} // namespace doctest
13608
13609#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_DISABLE
13610
13611#ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_IMPLEMENT_WITH_MAIN
13612DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH(4007) // 'function' : must be 'attribute' - see issue #182
13613int main(int argc, char** argv) { return doctest::Context(argc, argv).run(); }
13614DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
13615#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_IMPLEMENT_WITH_MAIN
13616
13617DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
13618DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
13619DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
13620
13621DOCTEST_SUPPRESS_COMMON_WARNINGS_POP
13622
13623#endif // DOCTEST_LIBRARY_IMPLEMENTATION
13624#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_IMPLEMENT
13625AG("no-run", "nr", no_run, false);
13626 DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("no-intro", "ni", no_intro, false);
13627 DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("no-version", "nv", no_version, false);
13628 DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("no-colors", "nc", no_colors, false);
13629 DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("force-colors", "fc", force_colors, false);
13630 DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("no-breaks", "nb", no_breaks, false);
13631 DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("no-skip", "ns", no_skip, false);
13632 DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("gnu-file-line", "gfl", gnu_file_line, !bool(DOCTEST_MSVC));
13633 DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("no-path-filenames", "npf", no_path_in_filenames, false);
13634 DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("no-line-numbers", "nln", no_line_numbers, false);
13635 DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("no-debug-output", "ndo", no_debug_output, false);
13636 DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("no-skipped-summary", "nss", no_skipped_summary, false);
13637 DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("no-time-in-output", "ntio", no_time_in_output, false);
13638 // clang-format on
13639
13640 if(withDefaults) {
13641 p->help = false;
13642 p->version = false;
13643 p->count = false;
13644 p->list_test_cases = false;
13645 p->list_test_suites = false;
13646 p->list_reporters = false;
13647 }
13648 if(parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "help") ||
13649 parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "h") ||
13650 parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "?")) {
13651 p->help = true;
13652 p->exit = true;
13653 }
13654 if(parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "version") ||
13655 parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "v")) {
13656 p->version = true;
13657 p->exit = true;
13658 }
13659 if(parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "count") ||
13660 parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "c")) {
13661 p->count = true;
13662 p->exit = true;
13663 }
13664 if(parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "list-test-cases") ||
13665 parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "ltc")) {
13666 p->list_test_cases = true;
13667 p->exit = true;
13668 }
13669 if(parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "list-test-suites") ||
13670 parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "lts")) {
13671 p->list_test_suites = true;
13672 p->exit = true;
13673 }
13674 if(parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "list-reporters") ||
13675 parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "lr")) {
13676 p->list_reporters = true;
13677 p->exit = true;
13678 }
13679}
13680
13681// allows the user to add procedurally to the filters from the command line
13682void Context::addFilter(const char* filter, const char* value) { setOption(filter, value); }
13683
13684// allows the user to clear all filters from the command line
13685void Context::clearFilters() {
13686 for(auto& curr : p->filters)
13687 curr.clear();
13688}
13689
13690// allows the user to override procedurally the bool options from the command line
13691void Context::setOption(const char* option, bool value) {
13692 setOption(option, value ? "true" : "false");
13693}
13694
13695// allows the user to override procedurally the int options from the command line
13696void Context::setOption(const char* option, int value) {
13697 setOption(option, toString(value).c_str());
13698}
13699
13700// allows the user to override procedurally the string options from the command line
13701void Context::setOption(const char* option, const char* value) {
13702 auto argv = String("-") + option + "=" + value;
13703 auto lvalue = argv.c_str();
13704 parseArgs(1, &lvalue);
13705}
13706
13707// users should query this in their main() and exit the program if true
13708bool Context::shouldExit() { return p->exit; }
13709
13710void Context::setAsDefaultForAssertsOutOfTestCases() { g_cs = p; }
13711
13712void Context::setAssertHandler(detail::assert_handler ah) { p->ah = ah; }
13713
13714void Context::setCout(std::ostream* out) { p->cout = out; }
13715
13716static class DiscardOStream : public std::ostream
13717{
13718private:
13719 class : public std::streambuf
13720 {
13721 private:
13722 // allowing some buffering decreases the amount of calls to overflow
13723 char buf[1024];
13724
13725 protected:
13726 std::streamsize xsputn(const char_type*, std::streamsize count) override { return count; }
13727
13728 int_type overflow(int_type ch) override {
13729 setp(std::begin(buf), std::end(buf));
13730 return traits_type::not_eof(ch);
13731 }
13732 } discardBuf;
13733
13734public:
13735 DiscardOStream()
13736 : std::ostream(&discardBuf) {}
13737} discardOut;
13738
13739// the main function that does all the filtering and test running
13740int Context::run() {
13741 using namespace detail;
13742
13743 // save the old context state in case such was setup - for using asserts out of a testing context
13744 auto old_cs = g_cs;
13745 // this is the current contest
13746 g_cs = p;
13747 is_running_in_test = true;
13748
13749 g_no_colors = p->no_colors;
13750 p->resetRunData();
13751
13752 std::fstream fstr;
13753 if(p->cout == nullptr) {
13754 if(p->quiet) {
13755 p->cout = &discardOut;
13756 } else if(p->out.size()) {
13757 // to a file if specified
13758 fstr.open(p->out.c_str(), std::fstream::out);
13759 p->cout = &fstr;
13760 } else {
13761 // stdout by default
13762 p->cout = &std::cout;
13763 }
13764 }
13765
13766 FatalConditionHandler::allocateAltStackMem();
13767
13768 auto cleanup_and_return = [&]() {
13769 FatalConditionHandler::freeAltStackMem();
13770
13771 if(fstr.is_open())
13772 fstr.close();
13773
13774 // restore context
13775 g_cs = old_cs;
13776 is_running_in_test = false;
13777
13778 // we have to free the reporters which were allocated when the run started
13779 for(auto& curr : p->reporters_currently_used)
13780 delete curr;
13781 p->reporters_currently_used.clear();
13782
13783 if(p->numTestCasesFailed && !p->no_exitcode)
13784 return EXIT_FAILURE;
13785 return EXIT_SUCCESS;
13786 };
13787
13788 // setup default reporter if none is given through the command line
13789 if(p->filters[8].empty())
13790 p->filters[8].push_back("console");
13791
13792 // check to see if any of the registered reporters has been selected
13793 for(auto& curr : getReporters()) {
13794 if(matchesAny(curr.first.second.c_str(), p->filters[8], false, p->case_sensitive))
13795 p->reporters_currently_used.push_back(curr.second(*g_cs));
13796 }
13797
13798 // TODO: check if there is nothing in reporters_currently_used
13799
13800 // prepend all listeners
13801 for(auto& curr : getListeners())
13802 p->reporters_currently_used.insert(p->reporters_currently_used.begin(), curr.second(*g_cs));
13803
13804#ifdef DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
13805 if(isDebuggerActive() && p->no_debug_output == false)
13806 p->reporters_currently_used.push_back(new DebugOutputWindowReporter(*g_cs));
13807#endif // DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
13808
13809 // handle version, help and no_run
13810 if(p->no_run || p->version || p->help || p->list_reporters) {
13811 DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(report_query, QueryData());
13812
13813 return cleanup_and_return();
13814 }
13815
13816 std::vector<const TestCase*> testArray;
13817 for(auto& curr : getRegisteredTests())
13818 testArray.push_back(&curr);
13819 p->numTestCases = testArray.size();
13820
13821 // sort the collected records
13822 if(!testArray.empty()) {
13823 if(p->order_by.compare("file", true) == 0) {
13824 std::sort(testArray.begin(), testArray.end(), fileOrderComparator);
13825 } else if(p->order_by.compare("suite", true) == 0) {
13826 std::sort(testArray.begin(), testArray.end(), suiteOrderComparator);
13827 } else if(p->order_by.compare("name", true) == 0) {
13828 std::sort(testArray.begin(), testArray.end(), nameOrderComparator);
13829 } else if(p->order_by.compare("rand", true) == 0) {
13830 std::srand(p->rand_seed);
13831
13832 // random_shuffle implementation
13833 const auto first = &testArray[0];
13834 for(size_t i = testArray.size() - 1; i > 0; --i) {
13835 int idxToSwap = std::rand() % (i + 1);
13836
13837 const auto temp = first[i];
13838
13839 first[i] = first[idxToSwap];
13840 first[idxToSwap] = temp;
13841 }
13842 } else if(p->order_by.compare("none", true) == 0) {
13843 // means no sorting - beneficial for death tests which call into the executable
13844 // with a specific test case in mind - we don't want to slow down the startup times
13845 }
13846 }
13847
13848 std::set<String> testSuitesPassingFilt;
13849
13850 bool query_mode = p->count || p->list_test_cases || p->list_test_suites;
13851 std::vector<const TestCaseData*> queryResults;
13852
13853 if(!query_mode)
13854 DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(test_run_start, DOCTEST_EMPTY);
13855
13856 // invoke the registered functions if they match the filter criteria (or just count them)
13857 for(auto& curr : testArray) {
13858 const auto& tc = *curr;
13859
13860 bool skip_me = false;
13861 if(tc.m_skip && !p->no_skip)
13862 skip_me = true;
13863
13864 if(!matchesAny(tc.m_file.c_str(), p->filters[0], true, p->case_sensitive))
13865 skip_me = true;
13866 if(matchesAny(tc.m_file.c_str(), p->filters[1], false, p->case_sensitive))
13867 skip_me = true;
13868 if(!matchesAny(tc.m_test_suite, p->filters[2], true, p->case_sensitive))
13869 skip_me = true;
13870 if(matchesAny(tc.m_test_suite, p->filters[3], false, p->case_sensitive))
13871 skip_me = true;
13872 if(!matchesAny(tc.m_name, p->filters[4], true, p->case_sensitive))
13873 skip_me = true;
13874 if(matchesAny(tc.m_name, p->filters[5], false, p->case_sensitive))
13875 skip_me = true;
13876
13877 if(!skip_me)
13878 p->numTestCasesPassingFilters++;
13879
13880 // skip the test if it is not in the execution range
13881 if((p->last < p->numTestCasesPassingFilters && p->first <= p->last) ||
13882 (p->first > p->numTestCasesPassingFilters))
13883 skip_me = true;
13884
13885 if(skip_me) {
13886 if(!query_mode)
13887 DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(test_case_skipped, tc);
13888 continue;
13889 }
13890
13891 // do not execute the test if we are to only count the number of filter passing tests
13892 if(p->count)
13893 continue;
13894
13895 // print the name of the test and don't execute it
13896 if(p->list_test_cases) {
13897 queryResults.push_back(&tc);
13898 continue;
13899 }
13900
13901 // print the name of the test suite if not done already and don't execute it
13902 if(p->list_test_suites) {
13903 if((testSuitesPassingFilt.count(tc.m_test_suite) == 0) && tc.m_test_suite[0] != '\0') {
13904 queryResults.push_back(&tc);
13905 testSuitesPassingFilt.insert(tc.m_test_suite);
13906 p->numTestSuitesPassingFilters++;
13907 }
13908 continue;
13909 }
13910
13911 // execute the test if it passes all the filtering
13912 {
13913 p->currentTest = &tc;
13914
13915 p->failure_flags = TestCaseFailureReason::None;
13916 p->seconds = 0;
13917
13918 // reset atomic counters
13919 p->numAssertsFailedCurrentTest_atomic = 0;
13920 p->numAssertsCurrentTest_atomic = 0;
13921
13922 p->fullyTraversedSubcases.clear();
13923
13924 DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(test_case_start, tc);
13925
13926 p->timer.start();
13927
13928 bool run_test = true;
13929
13930 do {
13931 // reset some of the fields for subcases (except for the set of fully passed ones)
13932 p->reachedLeaf = false;
13933 // May not be empty if previous subcase exited via exception.
13934 p->subcaseStack.clear();
13935 p->currentSubcaseDepth = 0;
13936
13937 p->shouldLogCurrentException = true;
13938
13939 // reset stuff for logging with INFO()
13940 p->stringifiedContexts.clear();
13941
13942#ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
13943 try {
13944#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
13945// MSVC 2015 diagnoses fatalConditionHandler as unused (because reset() is a static method)
13946DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH(4101) // unreferenced local variable
13947 FatalConditionHandler fatalConditionHandler; // Handle signals
13948 // execute the test
13949 tc.m_test();
13950 fatalConditionHandler.reset();
13951DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
13952#ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
13953 } catch(const TestFailureException&) {
13954 p->failure_flags |= TestCaseFailureReason::AssertFailure;
13955 } catch(...) {
13956 DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(test_case_exception,
13957 {translateActiveException(), false});
13958 p->failure_flags |= TestCaseFailureReason::Exception;
13959 }
13960#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
13961
13962 // exit this loop if enough assertions have failed - even if there are more subcases
13963 if(p->abort_after > 0 &&
13964 p->numAssertsFailed + p->numAssertsFailedCurrentTest_atomic >= p->abort_after) {
13965 run_test = false;
13966 p->failure_flags |= TestCaseFailureReason::TooManyFailedAsserts;
13967 }
13968
13969 if(!p->nextSubcaseStack.empty() && run_test)
13970 DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(test_case_reenter, tc);
13971 if(p->nextSubcaseStack.empty())
13972 run_test = false;
13973 } while(run_test);
13974
13975 p->finalizeTestCaseData();
13976
13977 DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(test_case_end, *g_cs);
13978
13979 p->currentTest = nullptr;
13980
13981 // stop executing tests if enough assertions have failed
13982 if(p->abort_after > 0 && p->numAssertsFailed >= p->abort_after)
13983 break;
13984 }
13985 }
13986
13987 if(!query_mode) {
13988 DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(test_run_end, *g_cs);
13989 } else {
13990 QueryData qdata;
13991 qdata.run_stats = g_cs;
13992 qdata.data = queryResults.data();
13993 qdata.num_data = unsigned(queryResults.size());
13994 DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(report_query, qdata);
13995 }
13996
13997 return cleanup_and_return();
13998}
13999
14000DOCTEST_DEFINE_INTERFACE(IReporter)
14001
14002int IReporter::get_num_active_contexts() { return detail::g_infoContexts.size(); }
14003const IContextScope* const* IReporter::get_active_contexts() {
14004 return get_num_active_contexts() ? &detail::g_infoContexts[0] : nullptr;
14005}
14006
14007int IReporter::get_num_stringified_contexts() { return detail::g_cs->stringifiedContexts.size(); }
14008const String* IReporter::get_stringified_contexts() {
14009 return get_num_stringified_contexts() ? &detail::g_cs->stringifiedContexts[0] : nullptr;
14010}
14011
14012namespace detail {
14013 void registerReporterImpl(const char* name, int priority, reporterCreatorFunc c, bool isReporter) {
14014 if(isReporter)
14015 getReporters().insert(reporterMap::value_type(reporterMap::key_type(priority, name), c));
14016 else
14017 getListeners().insert(reporterMap::value_type(reporterMap::key_type(priority, name), c));
14018 }
14019} // namespace detail
14020
14021} // namespace doctest
14022
14023#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_DISABLE
14024
14025#ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_IMPLEMENT_WITH_MAIN
14026DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH(4007) // 'function' : must be 'attribute' - see issue #182
14027int main(int argc, char** argv) { return doctest::Context(argc, argv).run(); }
14028DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
14029#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_IMPLEMENT_WITH_MAIN
14030
14031DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
14032DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
14033DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP

14035DOCTEST_SUPPRESS_COMMON_WARNINGS_POP
14036
14037#endif // DOCTEST_LIBRARY_IMPLEMENTATION
14038#endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_IMPLEMENT
